magis tamen po&longs;tea, quanta et qualia e&longs;&longs;e dedeant, poterit intelligi: nunc de
parietibus quibu&longs;dam & tectis dicam.

Primò &longs;uper &longs;ecundum murum lon­
gum &longs;tatuatur paries omnino &longs;imilis ei, cuius &longs;tructuram libro nono expli­
caui, cùm de&longs;criberem officinam, in cuius fornacibus uenæ auri, argenti, æ­
ris excoquuntur: ex hoc pariete tectum, quod con&longs;tet è tegulis coctilibus, ad
primum murum longum pertineat: ea uerò domicilij pars in &longs;e contineat fol­
les, machinas eos comprimentes, organa eo&longs;dem diducentia: deinde in me­
dio &longs;pacio, quod e&longs;t inter &longs;ecundum & tertium murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, &longs;ub&longs;tra­
tis &longs;axis erigatur tignum altum pedes octo, cra&longs;&longs;um & latum duos: quod di
&longs;tet à &longs;ecundo muro longo pedibus tredecim.

In hoc tigno &longs;tatuto & &longs;ecun
do muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o, qui ea parte habeat foramen quadratum, altum & latum
pedes duos, locetur trabs longa pedes quatuor & triginta atque palmum.

Al
tera quoque trabs eiu&longs;dem longitudinis, latitudinis, cra&longs;&longs;itudinis collocetur
in eodem tigno &longs;tatuto, & tertio muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o.

Earum uerò duarum tra­
bium capita, quà coeunt, fibulis ferreis copulentur.

Simili modo à tigno &longs;ta
tuto uer&longs;us murum quartum ad decem pedes alterum tignum erigatur, &
duæ trabes ip&longs;i ac muris imponantur: quæ &longs;imillimæ &longs;int iam dictis.

In his
duabus trabibus & quarto muro longo locentur trabes numero decem &
&longs;eptem, longæ pedes tres & quadraginta, atque palmos tres, latæ pedem, cra&longs;
&longs;æ palmos tres: quarum prima &longs;uperponatur &longs;ecundo muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o, ulti
ma continenter ad tertium & quartum murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, cæteræ in me­
dio eorum &longs;pacio.
Di&longs;tet autem una ab altera pedibus tribus.

In ip&longs;arum for­
mis, quæ &longs;unt in capitibus, quæ &longs;pectant &longs;ecundum murum longum, inclu­
dantur capita totidem tignorum obliquè erectorum in aduer&longs;a illa, quæ re­
cta &longs;uper &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;tatuta &longs;unt: fiatque hoc modo alter ca­
mini paries obliquus, a&longs;&longs;imilis ei, quem nono libro de&longs;crip&longs;i.

Ne uerò hic i
cidar in parietem rectum, cauetur bacillis ferreis, &longs;ed raris: & quidem propte­
rea quod quatuor camini latericij, qui in hoc &longs;pacio con&longs;truentur, cum par­
um &longs;u&longs;tineant: retro ad pedes duodecim itenim in formis trabium, in dua­
bus illis & quarto muro longo collocatarum, includantur capita totidem ti
gnorum obliquè erectorum in alia totidem tigna item obliquè erecta, quo
rum capita inferiora quoque includantur in formis trabium, qua in quarto mu
ro longo collocatæ &longs;unt.

Illorum uerò tignorum obliquorum capita &longs;uperi
ora cum horum capitibus &longs;uperioribus coniungantur.

Sed cùm tigna obli­
qua primi ordinis à tignis &longs;ecundi ordinis ab&longs;int pedes duodecim, ut cana­
lis in medio &longs;pacio bene locari po&longs;&longs;it, inter bina quæque denuo bina obliquè
erigantur: quorum capita inferiora etiam includantur in formis trabium, in
duabus illis trabibus et quarto muro longo collocatarum: di&longs;tentque inter &longs;e
cubito.

Superius uerò caput alterius longi pedes quindecim incumbat in ter­
gum tigni primi ordinis alterius, longi pedes decem & octo, in tergum tigni
&longs;ecundi ordinis, quod abe&longs;t longius.

Eiu&longs;modi autem medijs tignis obliquis
tales &longs;int &longs;ub&longs;tructiones: &longs;uper alteram quanque trabem in duabus illis trabibus
& quarto muro longo collo catam &longs;tatuatur tignum rectum: quod etiam i­
p&longs;um, ut &longs;atis habeat firmitatis, fulciatur obliquo tigno.

His rectis impona­
tur trabs longa, in quam incumbant unius ordinis media tigna obliqua.

Si­
mili modo alterius ordinis media tigna obliqua incumbant in trabem lon­
gam, quæ alijs rectis imponatur.

Ab unaquaque præterea trabe, in duabus il
lis & quarto muro longo collocata, &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad duos pedes ponatur
tignum tran&longs;uer&longs;um: quod ex medio tigno obliquo primi ordinis ad medi
um tignum obliquum &longs;ecundi ordinis pertineat: quibus tignis tran&longs;uer&longs;is
imponatur canalis ex una arbore cauatus: tum à cuiu&longs;que tigni medij primi or­
dinis tergo tignum, longum pedes &longs;ex, pertingat ferè ad canalem: cuius tigni
caput inferius &longs;u&longs;tineat tigillum longum duos pedes.

Id uerò in&longs;i&longs;tat in eo­
dem tigno medio primi ordinis: &longs;imiliter à cuiu&longs;que tigni medij &longs;ecundi ordi
nis tergo tignum ferè pertingat ad canalem, &longs;ed longum pedes &longs;eptem: cuius
item caput inferius &longs;u&longs;tineat tigillum, quod in&longs;i&longs;tat in eodem tigno medio
&longs;ecundi ordinis: itaque &longs;uprema parte ad primi & &longs;ecundi ordinis principalia
tigna obliqua affigantur a&longs;&longs;erculi longi, ad quos appendantur tegulæ cocti
les: media, ad primi & &longs;ecundi ordinis media tigna: infima, ad tigna, quæ à
tergo cuiu&longs;que tigni medij primi & &longs;ecundi ordinis fere pertingunt ad cana­
lem: attamen ad a&longs;&longs;erculos, ad hæc tigna affixos, inferiores affigantur &longs;can­
dulæ abiegnæ in canalem penetrantes: minus enim imber maximus, uel nix
liquefacta permanat in domicilium.

At interiores &longs;ub&longs;tructiones, quæ &longs;u&longs;ti
neant obliqua tigna &longs;ecundi ordinis, & aduer&longs;a tertij, quod in&longs;olentes non
&longs;int, non nece&longs;&longs;e habeo explicare.

In hac autem domicilij parte ad &longs;ecundum
murum longum &longs;int fornaces, in quibus panes ærei fathi&longs;centes iam torre fa
cti coquuntur, ut denuo æris colorem & &longs;peciem habeant, &longs;icuti re uera &longs;unt
ærei: reliquum &longs;pacium occupent aliæ duæ fornaces: una, in qua calefiunt æ­
rei panes integri: altera, in qua ignis calore torrentur fathi&longs;centes: & uia, quæ
à ianua e&longs;t ad fornaces.

Tum in medio tertij & quinti muri tran&longs;uer&longs;i &longs;pacio
&longs;imiliter duo tigna &longs;ub&longs;tratis &longs;axis erigantur: quorum utrunque &longs;it altum pe­
des octo, latum & cra&longs;&longs;um duos.

Alterum à &longs;ecundo muro longo di&longs;tet pe­
dibus tredecim, alterum totidem à tertio muro longo.

Ip&longs;a uero inter &longs;e di­
&longs;tent pedibus item tredecim: his duobus tignis & tertio muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o &longs;u
perponantur duæ trabes longæ pedes unum & quadraginta ac palmum, la
tæ & cra&longs;&longs;æ pedes duos.

Aliæ item duæ trabes eiu&longs;dem longitudinis, latitu
dinis, cra&longs;&longs;itudinis &longs;uperponantur alijs duobus tignis &longs;tatutis, & &longs;eptimo mu
ro tran&longs;uer&longs;o: capita binarum trabium, qua coeunt, fibulis ferreis copulen­
tur.

In eis autem trabibus rur&longs;us collocentur trabes una & uiginti, longæ pe
des tredecim, latæ pedem, cra&longs;&longs;æ palmos tres: quarum prima locetur in ter­
tio muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o, ultima in &longs;eptimo muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o, reliquæ in medio
eorum &longs;pacio: di&longs;tetque una ab altera pedibus tribus.

In harum formis, qua &longs;pe­
ctant &longs;ecundum murum longum includantur capita totidem tignorum ob
liquè erectorum in aduer&longs;a, quæ recta &longs;uper &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;unt
&longs;tatuta: fiatque hoc modo alter camini paries obliquus.

At qua &longs;pectant terti­
um murum longum in earundem trabium formis includantur capita toti­
dem tignorum obliquè erectorum, in aduer&longs;a tertij parietis obliqui tigna:
fiatque hoc modo alter alterius camini paries obliquus.

Ne uerò hic incidat
in contrarium obliquum, ille in contrarium rectum, caueatur partim crebris
bacillis ferreis, ex nonnullis tignis ad eis oppo&longs;ita pertinentibus: partim ti­
gnis raris, quæ è tergo tignorum obliquorum ad tergum obliquorum, quæ
retro &longs;unt, pertinent: ea cra&longs;&longs;a & lata &longs;unt palmos duos, utrinque perforata.

V­
traque tigna obliqua cingantur laminis ferreis, latis digitos tres, cra&longs;&longs;is &longs;emi­
digitum, quæ complexu &longs;uo contineant capita tignorum, de quibus iam di
xi: quæ copulationes ut firmæ &longs;int: in cuiu&longs;que capitis tignorum foramine in
figatur clauus ferreus utrinque per laminam penetrans.

Sed trabes & tigna media, quæ canales & tectum &longs;u&longs;tinere debent, o­
mnino &longs;e habeant, ut &longs;upra dicta, ni&longs;i quod media obliqua &longs;ecundi ordinis
non &longs;int longiora medijs primi ordinis: & quod tigna, quæ à tergo cuiu&longs;que
medij tigni obliqui, &longs;ecundi ordinis pertingent ferè ad canalem non &longs;int lon­
giora tignis, quæ à tergo cuiu&longs;que medij tigni obliqui primi ordinis pertin­
gent ferè ad canalem.

In hac domicilij parte ad &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;int
fornaces, in quibus æs cum plumbo mi&longs;cetur, & recrementa recoquuntur.

Ad tertium uerò murum longum fornaces, in quibus argentum & plumbum
ab ære &longs;ecernuntur.

Medium &longs;pacium occupent duæ machinæ, quarum al­
tera panes ærei de catino leuati in terra reponuntur: altera de terra in &longs;ecun­
da fornace.

In tertio præterea & quarto muro longo collocentur trabes item
una & uiginti, longæ pedes decem & octo, ac palmos tres: in quarum formis
quæ à tergo tertij muri longi &longs;unt ad duos pedes, includantur capita totidem
tignorum oblique erectorum, in aduer&longs;a tigna obliqua alterius obliqui pa­
rietis &longs;ecundi camini: fiatque i&longs;to modo tertius paries obliquus, alijs pror&longs;us
a&longs;&longs;imilis.

Totidem quoque tignorum capita includantur in formis earundem
trabium, qua collocatæ &longs;unt in quarto muro longo: quæ tigna etiam ip&longs;a ob­
lique erecta incumbant in terga proximorum, & &longs;u&longs;tineant tectum, quod to
tum con&longs;tet è tegulis coctilibus, & &longs;ub&longs;tructiones habeant u&longs;itatas.

In hac
parte domicilij &longs;int duo conclauia: in quorum priore concluduntur panes
ærei, in altero plumbei.

Deinde in medio noni muri tran&longs;uer&longs;i & decimi &longs;pa
cio, quod ad latera habet &longs;ecundum & quintum murum longum, &longs;ub&longs;tratis
&longs;axis iterum erigatur tignum altum pedes duodecim, latum & cra&longs;&longs;um du­
os: id di&longs;tet à &longs;ecundo muro longo pedes tredecim, à quinto muro longo,
&longs;ex.

Ei tigno &longs;tatuto & nono muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o &longs;uperponatur trabs longa pe
des tres & triginta, atque palmos tres, lata & cra&longs;&longs;a palmos duos.

Altera &qring;que
trabs eiu&longs;dem longitudinis, latitudinis, cra&longs;&longs;itudinis eidem tigno &longs;tatuto, et
decimo muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o &longs;uperponatur: quarum duarum trabium capita, quà
coeunt, fibulis ferreis copulentur.

In his trabibus & quinto muro longo col­
locentur trabes numero decem, longa pedes octo, et palmos tres: quarum pri
ma locetur in nono muro tran&longs;uer&longs;o, ultima in decimo, reliquæ in medio e­
orum &longs;pacio.

Alia ab alia ab&longs;it pedes tres: in ip&longs;arum formis, quà &longs;pectant &longs;e
cundum murum longum, etiam includantur capita totidem tignorum ob­
liquorum erectorum in aduer&longs;a, quæ &longs;uper &longs;ecundum murum longum re­
cta &longs;unt &longs;tatuta: fiatque rur&longs;us hoc modo camini paries obliquus, cæteris o­
mnino &longs;imilis: qui &longs;uprema parte, qua fumus eluctatur, à recto di&longs;tet pedi­
bus duobus.

Totidem quoque tignorum capita includantur in earum trabi­
um formis, qua collocatæ &longs;unt in quinto muro longo: quæ etiam oblique
erecta in terga proximorum incumbant, &longs;u&longs;tineantque tectum è tegulis coctili
bus factum.

In hac domicilij parte ad &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;int quatuor forna
ces, in quibus plumbum ab argento &longs;eparatur: atque machinæ, quibus earum
opercula de catinis leuantur: quinetiam domicilij pars, quæ e&longs;t inter primum
murum longum, & partem &longs;ecundi muri longi interci&longs;am, in qua e&longs;t pilum, quo
panes ærei franguntur: & quatuor pila, quibus cadmiæ, quæ decutiuntur è
parietibus fornacum, &longs;ubiectæ franguntur & comminuuntur: atque lateres, &longs;u­
per quos panes ærei fathi&longs;centes &longs;tatuti torre fiunt, tectum habeat u&longs;itatum: ut
etiam ea quæ e&longs;t inter &longs;eptimum murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, & duo decimum atque de­
cimum tertium: ac cui à lateribus &longs;unt quintus murus longus, & &longs;extus & terti
us.

Quæ domicilij pars di&longs;tribuatur in duas partes: in quarum priore &longs;tatua
tur fornacula, in qua artifex experiatur metalla, & puluerem o&longs;&longs;ium comminu­
torum unà cum alijs con&longs;eruet: in altera conficiatur puluis, ex quo foci & ca
tini fornacum fiunt.

Sed extra domicilium ad tergum quarti muri longi prope o­
&longs;tium officinæ ad ingredientis læuam &longs;it focus, in quo ex magnis plumbi ma&longs;&longs;is
liquefactis fiant minores, ut facilius appendi po&longs;&longs;int.

Tam enim plumbeæ
ma&longs;&longs;æ quàm ærei panes debent primò præparari, ut appendi, & certo pon­
dere in fornacibus coqui & commi&longs;ceri po&longs;&longs;int.

Sed focus, ut inde ordiar, in
quo liquandæ &longs;unt ma&longs;&longs;æ plumbeæ, longus &longs;it pedes &longs;ex, latus quinque, ab
utroque latere, munito &longs;axis in terra partim defo&longs;&longs;is, &longs;ed altioribus quàm fo­
cus palmo, & interius luto oblitis, uer&longs;us mediam & priorem partem decli­
uis, ut plumbum liquidum defluere, & in catinum effluere po&longs;&longs;it.

Po&longs;teriore ei­
us parte murus exi&longs;tat, qui murum quartum longum muniat contra uim i­
gnis.

Is, ex lateribus & luto factus, altus &longs;it pedes quatuor, cra&longs;&longs;us palmos
tres, in ferius latus pedes quinque, &longs;uperius tres & palmos duos.

Etenim pau­
latim fiat angu&longs;tior: cui parti &longs;uperiori &longs;eptem lateres imponantur: quorum
medij recta erigantur, extremi oblique: toti lutum cra&longs;&longs;um illinatur.

Ante fo­
cum &longs;it catinus: cuius fouea lata pedem & palmos tres, alta pedem, &longs;en&longs;im fi­
at angu&longs;tior.

Itaque cùm ma&longs;&longs;æ plumbeæ &longs;unt liquandæ, tunc operarius pri­
mò ligna &longs;ic imponat in focum, ut eorum caput alterum &longs;pectet murum, alte
rum catinum.

Deinde, ab alijs operarijs adiutus, ma&longs;&longs;am trudibus in uehicu
lum promoueat, & ad gruem trahat.

Vehiculum aut con&longs;tet ex a&longs;&longs;eribus,
qui coagmentati &longs;unt lati pedes duos & dimidium, longi quinque: id habeat
duos axiculos ferreos: circum quos utrinque uoluantur orbiculi ferrei, lati pal­
mos duos, cra&longs;&longs;i totidem digitos.

Habeat temonem, & in eo inclu&longs;um funem,
quo pertrahatur ad gruem: qui pror&longs;us &longs;imilis e&longs;t eis, qui in &longs;ecunda officinæ
parte &longs;unt, ni&longs;i quod ro&longs;trum tam longum non habeat.

Forceps, cuius chelæ
prehendent ma&longs;&longs;am plumbeam, longa &longs;it pedes duos, & palmum ac digitos
duos.

Eius utraque chela uncinata malleo percu&longs;&longs;a, ma&longs;&longs;æ impingatur & infi
gatur: utrunque manubrium &longs;uperiore parte &longs;it recuruum, alterum dextram
uer&longs;us, alterum &longs;ini&longs;tram: in quorum utroque infimi duarum catellarum annu­
li, tres uerò eis &longs;int, includantur, &longs;upremi autem in magno annulo rotundo:
in quo etiam includatur uncus catenæ, à ro&longs;tri orbiculo demi&longs;&longs;æ: grus uecti
uer&longs;atus ma&longs;&longs;am &longs;ubleuat: ro&longs;tro ductus ad focum eam lignis imponit: dein
de aliam atque aliam ma&longs;&longs;am operarij aduehant, & &longs;imili modo in lignis &longs;oci
collocent.

Etenim ma&longs;&longs;æ quæ pendunt circiter centum & &longs;exaginta centum­
pondia &longs;imul in ea imponi & liquari &longs;olent.

Tum operarius carbones in ma&longs;­
&longs;as conijciat: quæ omnia ue&longs;peri parentur: quare, &longs;i metuerit pluuias, ea te­
cto, quod huc atque illuc portari pote&longs;t, operiat.

Id po&longs;teriore parte duos ha­
beat pedes, ut pluuiæ, quas excepit, è decliui defluant in aream: &longs;equenti die
mane prunas batillo in carbones conijciat: quo modo ma&longs;&longs;æ plumbeæ car­
bonibus &longs;ubinde adiectis lique&longs;cunt.

Plumbum, quàm primum id ip&longs;um con
ceperit catinus, cochleari ferreo effundat in catillos æreos, qualibus &longs;ecretor
uti &longs;olet.

Quod &longs;i &longs;tatim refrigeratum non fuerit, tum aquam affundat & mal­
leo cu&longs;pidato, in ip&longs;um infixo, extrahat: cuius mallei pars cu&longs;pidata &longs;it, lon­
ga palmos tres: teres, digitos duos.

Sed catillis aquam luto&longs;am illinire opor
tet, ut ex eis inuer&longs;is, & mallei parte terete, quæ lata e&longs;t, percu&longs;&longs;is panes plum­
bei facile excidant: qualis aqua ni catillis illinatur, periculum e&longs;t, ne plumbum
per colliquefactos penetret.

Alij in &longs;ini&longs;tram &longs;umunt lignum inferiore par­
te graue, coque catillum percutiunt: dextra uerò mallei aciem in panem plum
beum infigunt, atque &longs;ic ip&longs;um extrahunt.

Mox operarius aliud plumbum in
catillos uacuos infundat: idque faciat, donec munus plumbi liquandi perfe­
cerit.

Cùm autem plumbum liquatur, quiddam &longs;pumæ argenti &longs;imile na&longs;ci­
tur: nec mirum, cùm ea quondam Puteolis ex &longs;olo plumbo, in &longs;ecundis for
nacibus acri igni cocto, facta &longs;it, & nunc fieri po&longs;&longs;it.

I&longs;ti porrò plumbei pa­
nes in conclaue plumbarium inuehantur.

Focus A. Saxa in terra defe&longs;&longs;a B. Murus qui quartum mu­
rum longum ab iniuria ignis tuetur C. Catinus D. Ma&longs;&longs;æ
plumbeæ E. Vehiculum F. Eius orbiculi G. Grus H.
Forceps I. Ligna K. Catilli L. Cochlear M.
Malleus N. Panes O.

At panes ærei ci&longs;ijs iniecti inuehantur in tertiam officinæ partem, ibique
&longs;inguli ma&longs;&longs;is &longs;uperpo&longs;iti, & crebris pili præ ferrati ictibus &longs;ellæ impacti fran
gantur: qualis machina &longs;ic &longs;e habeat.

Truncus quernus humi locetur longus
pedes quinque, latus et cra&longs;&longs;us tres: cuius cap&longs;a, in media eius parte priore pa
tens, longa &longs;it pedes duos & totidem palmos, lata pedes duos, alta palmos
tres & digitos duos: cuius pars extuberans &longs;upina exi&longs;tat, lata iaceat in trun
co.

In eorum medio locetur &longs;ella ænea: cuius pars &longs;en&longs;im depre&longs;&longs;a & lata pal
mum, ac digitos duos interiecta &longs;it inter duas ma&longs;&longs;as plumbeas, altior utrinque
lata palmum, eiu&longs;dem &longs;ubiecta.

Itaque tota &longs;ella &longs;it lata palmos tres & digitos
duos, longa pedem, cra&longs;&longs;a palmos duos.

At &longs;uper truncum utrinque ad latus
cap&longs;æ &longs;tatuatur tignum latum & cra&longs;&longs;um cubitum: eorum capita &longs;uperiora
aliquantum reci&longs;a includantur in formis trabium domicilij: à trunco &longs;ur&longs;um
uer&longs;us ad pedes quatuor, & digitos duos, duo tigna tran&longs;uer&longs;a continenter
coniungantur: quorum utrunque latum & cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;it palmos tres: eorum ca
pita intrin &longs;ecus reci&longs;a includantur in formis exterioribus tignorum &longs;tatuto
rum, unaque cum eis terebrentur: in quæ foramina infigantur claui ferrei, pri
ore parte cornuti: quorum alterum cornu &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad tignum &longs;tatutum
adigatur, alterum deor&longs;um: po&longs;teriore uerò parte perforati, ut ferreis paxil­
lis latis in foramina infixis, & adactis tigna tran&longs;uer&longs;a coercere po&longs;&longs;int: ea ti­
gna in medio habeant foramen quadrangulum, quaqua uer&longs;us latum palmos
tres & &longs;emidigitum: in quod pilum præferratum immittatur.

Ab his tignis
tran&longs;uer&longs;is &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad pedes tres, & palmos duos: iterum eiu&longs;modi duo
tigna &longs;int, habeantque foramen quadrangulum in &longs;e continens idem pilum: quod
quadrangulum &longs;it, & longum pedes undecim, latum & cra&longs;&longs;um palmos tres:
Eius ferri, longi pedem & palmum, caput longum & latum &longs;it palmos du­
os, cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;uperius palmum et digitos duos, inferius totidem digitos: nam
paulatim fiat angu&longs;tius.

Cauda uerò longa palmos tres, lata et cra&longs;&longs;a, quà de
capite oritur, palmos duos: quò longius ab ip&longs;o di&longs;cedet, eò etiam fiat angu
&longs;tius.

Superiore parte includatur in pilo perforata, ut paxillus ferreus infigi
po&longs;&longs;it: tribus laminis ferreis quadrangulis uinciatur: quarum infima latum
palmum &longs;it inter caput ferri et caput pili: media lata digitos tres deinceps ca
put pili cingat: à quo &longs;uprema totidem digitos lata ab&longs;it digitos duos.

Ab in­
fima ferri parte &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad pedes duos, & totidem digitos &longs;it dens qua­
drangulus, è pilo pedem & palmum extans, cra&longs;&longs;us palmos duos: attamen,
cum à pilo di&longs;ce&longs;&longs;erit &longs;ex digitos, inferius ad duos digitos fiat tenuior: à den­
te &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad palmos tres, pilum in medio habeat foramen rotundum:
in quod infigatur clauus ferreus, teres, longus pedes duos, latus &longs;e&longs;quidigi­
tum: in cuius po&longs;teriore parte caua inclu&longs;um &longs;it manubrium ligneum longum
palmos duos & totidem digitos.

Is clauus in inferiora tigna tran&longs;uer&longs;a incum
bens ob&longs;tat, ne ip&longs;um, cùm res hoc non po&longs;tulat, decidat.

Axis autem, qui pi­
lum attollit, utrinque habeat binos dentes: qui inter &longs;e di&longs;tent palmis duobus
& digitis tribus: qui ex eo extent pedem & palmum, ac digitos duos: qui per
eum penetrantes paxillis adactis firmentur: qui lati & cra&longs;&longs;i &longs;int palmum ac
digitos duos: quorum capita rotundata tegantur lamina ferrea æque ac ip&longs;a
lata, utrinque pedem demi&longs;&longs;a, clauis ferreis ad ea affixa: quæ capita habeant fo
ramina rotunda: in quæ includatur axiculus ferreus per axiculum æneum pe­
netrans.

Illi ab altera parte caput &longs;it latum, ab altera foramen, in quod infiga
tur clauus ferreus, ne ip&longs;e axiculus è dentibus excidat.

Ænea præterea fi­
&longs;tula &longs;it longa palmos duos, lata unum: per cuius foramen rotundum latum
digitos duos, ferreus axiculus penetret in ea inclu&longs;us.

Nec æneus &longs;olum uol
uatur circa ferreum, &longs;ed ip&longs;e quoque ferreus uer&longs;etur.

Itaque cùm axis uoluitur,
axiculi ænei uici&longs;&longs;im leuant dentem pili.

Quoniam uerò axiculis ferreis &
æneis ex dentibus extractis, hic pili dens non attollitur, alterius organi pila
&longs;ine hoc &longs;ubleuantur.

Porrò unum idemque tympanum, quod circa axem ro
tæ e&longs;t, cuique fu&longs;i &longs;unt, & huius axis tympanum dentatum moueat, & alteri­
us, qui tigilla follium &longs;equentis quartæ domicilij partis deprimit: &longs;ed contra­
rio motu.

Nam tympanum axis, qui pila attollit, uer&longs;us &longs;eptentrionem cir­
cumagit: eius, qui tigilla follium deprimit, uer&longs;us meridiem.

Truncus A. Tigna &longs;tatuta B. Tigna tran&longs;uer&longs;a C. Pili caput D.
Eius dens E. Eiu&longs;dem foramen F. Clauus ferreus G. Ma&longs;&longs;æ
plumbeæ H. Sella ænea I. Axis K. Dentes eius L.
Axiculus ferreus M. Fi&longs;tula ænea N.

Sed panes qui cra&longs;&longs;iores &longs;unt, quàm ut ictibus pili præferrati cito frangi
po&longs;&longs;int, quales poti&longs;&longs;imum &longs;unt hi, qui in infimo catini loco re&longs;ederunt, in­
uehantur in primam officinæ partem: atque ibi calefiant in fornace, quæ à &longs;e­
cundo muro longo di&longs;ter pedibus octo & uiginti: à &longs;ecundo tran&longs;uer&longs;o du
odecim: cuius tres parietes &longs;axis quadrangulis, quibus &longs;uperpo&longs;iti &longs;int late­
res, extruantur.

Po&longs;terior altus exi&longs;tat pedes tres & palmum: quæ altitudo
etiam &longs;it his, qui &longs;unt à lateribus.

Eorum tamen uterque priore parte, qua pa­
tet fornax, decliuis, altus &longs;it tantummodo pedes duos, & palmos tres: omnes
uerò cra&longs;&longs;i pedem & palmum: &longs;uper hos parietes, ne ip&longs;i minus cra&longs;&longs;i, nimis
graue onus impo&longs;itum ferre non po&longs;&longs;int, &longs;tatuantur quatuor tigna, lutoque
oblinantur.

Ea &longs;u&longs;tineant caminum a&longs;&longs;urgentem, & per tectum penetrantem:
cuius camini non modo cratibus, &longs;ed etiam tignis lutum cra&longs;&longs;um illinatur.

Focus autem fornacis quaquauer&longs;us &longs;it longus pedes &longs;ex, lateribus &longs;tratus,
decliuis.

Panes ærei in hac fornace collocati calefiant hoc modo: in fornacem
primo continenter ponantur, tantummodo lapillis oui magnitudine inter­
po&longs;itis, ut ignis calor in medium inter eos &longs;pacium penetrare po&longs;&longs;it: quineti
ain qui in infimo catini loco re&longs;ederunt, in dimidium laterem eadem de cau
&longs;a impo&longs;iti exaltentur.

Ne uerò ultimi, qui &longs;unt ad o&longs;tium fornacis, cadant,
ad eos laminæ ferreæ, uel panes ærei, cùm æs rur&longs;us perficitur, ex catino pri
mum extracti apponantur: atque ad hos panes ærei fathi&longs;centes, aut &longs;axa.

De
inde in panes inijciantur carbones: tum prunæ.

Primò autem panes cale&longs;cant
à leni igni: mox ad eos adijciantur plures carbones: interdum altitudine do
drantis.

Acriori certe igni nobis opus e&longs;t ad duros æreos panes calefacien­
dos quàm ad fragiles: panibus &longs;atis calefactis, quod &longs;pacio horarum ferè du
arum fieri &longs;olet, ex o&longs;tio fornacis remoueantur laminæ ferreæ, et panes ærei
fathi&longs;centes uel &longs;axa.

Deinde panes calefacti ordine extrahantur ra&longs;tro bi­
denti, quali is, qui panes fathi&longs;centes torrefacit, utitur.

Quo uerò qui&longs;que panis magis calet, hoc frangitur citius: quo minus,
hoc tardius: nam ærei ua&longs;is in&longs;tar huc & illuc flectitur.

Primò pane fracto &longs;e
cundus in eius fragmentis collocetur & percutiatur, u&longs;que dum etiam ip&longs;e diffi&longs;­
&longs;us di&longs;&longs;iliat: &longs;imili modo reliqui panes ex ordine frangantur.

Verùm mallei
&longs;int longi palmos tres, lati unum, utrinque acuti: eorum uerò manubria lignea
tres pedes longa: fragmenta ærea, &longs;iue panes frigidi pilo fuerint fracti, &longs;iue
calefacti malleis, in conclaue ærarium inuehantur.

Paries po&longs;terior A. Parietes qui &longs;unt a lateribus B. Tigna
&longs;tatuta C. Caminus D. Panes collocati E. Laminæ
ferreæ F. Saxa G. Ra&longs;trum bidens H. Malleus I.

At præ&longs;es o&longs;&longs;icinæ æs &longs;ecundum diuer&longs;as argenti portiones, quæ in eius
centumpondio in&longs;unt, cum plumbo temperet, &longs;ine quo argentum ab ære &longs;e
parari non pote&longs;t.

Si mediocris argenti portio inerit in ære, id quadrifariam
temperet.

Etenim &longs;i in tribus quartis centumpondij æris partibus argenti &longs;e­
libra, uel &longs;elibra & &longs;icilicus, uel &longs;elibra & &longs;emuncia, uel &longs;elibra & &longs;emuncia et
&longs;icilicus non fuerint, tum diuitis plumbi, hoc e&longs;t eius, à quo nondum argen­
tum &longs;eparatum &longs;it, dimidium centumpondium, uel totum, uel totum & dimi­
dium addat, ut in æris & plumbi mi&longs;tura in&longs;it unum aliquod ex iam dictis argenti
ponderibus: quæ prima temperatura e&longs;t: ad quam adijciat tantum plumbi depaupe
rati, uel &longs;pumæ argenti pondus, quantum ad hanc rem &longs;atis &longs;it, ut ex his omnibus
panis confletur, qui in &longs;e contineat fere duo plumbi centumpondia.

Quoniam uerò
ex &longs;pumæ argenti libris centum & triginta plerunque conficiuntur plumbi tantum
modo centum libræ, pro complemento &longs;pumæ argenti plus quam plumbi de­
pauperati adijciat.

Sed quia quatuor i&longs;tiu&longs;modi panes &longs;imul collocantur in
fornace, in qua argentum cum plumbo mi&longs;tum ab ære &longs;ecernitur, in tot pani­
bus erunt æris tria, plumbi octo centumpondia.

Sed plumbum cùm fuerit
ab ære &longs;ecretum, pendat &longs;ex centumpondia: in quorum &longs;ingulis argenti qua
drans & &longs;ere &longs;icilicus in&longs;it.

Eiu&longs;dem uerò argenti &longs;eptunx, remaneat in æreis
panibus fathi&longs;centibus, & in ea æris ac plumbi mi&longs;tura, quam no&longs;tri &longs;pi­
nas, non tam quod non careat aculeis, quam quod uilis, nominant.

Sin au­
tem in tribus quartis centumpondij æris partibus non fuerit argenti &longs;eptunx,
& &longs;emuncia, uel bes, tum plumbum diues tantum addat, ut æris & plumbi
mi&longs;turæ alterum ex iam dictis argenti ponderibus in&longs;it: quæ &longs;ecunda tem­
peratura e&longs;t: ad quam rur&longs;us adijciat tantum plumbi depauperati, uel &longs;pumæ
argenti pondus, ut ex mi&longs;tura conflari po&longs;&longs;it panis, qui plumbi duo centum­
pondia, & quartam centumpondij partem in &longs;e contineat: quo modo in qua­
tuor i&longs;tius generis panibus inerunt æris tria, plumbi nouem centumpondia.

Plumbum, quod ex illis panibus de&longs;tillat, centumpondia &longs;eptem pendat: in
quorum &longs;ingulis argenti quadrans, & paulo plus quam &longs;icilicus in&longs;int: fere
&longs;eptunx, remaneat in panibus fathi&longs;centibus & &longs;pinis: liceat nobis uetus no
men, nouæ rei impo&longs;itum, terere.

Si uerò in tribus quartis centumpondij
æris partibus argenti dodrans, aut dodrans & &longs;emuncia non in&longs;unt, tum plum
bum diues tam graue addat, ut æris & plumbi mi&longs;tura alterum ex iam dictis
argenti ponderibus in &longs;e contineat: quæ tertia temperatura e&longs;t: ad quam ad
ijciat tantum plumbi depauperati, uel &longs;pumæ argenti pondus, ut panis, ex
his omnibus conflatus, duo plumbi centumpondia, & tres quartas centum
pondij partes in &longs;e contineat: quo modo in quatuor id genus panibus æris
tria, plumbi undecim centumpondia inerunt.

Plumbum, quo hi panes in for­
nace recocti &longs;tillant, centumpondia ferme nouem pendat: in quorum &longs;ingu
lis argenti quadrans & plus quàm &longs;icilicus in&longs;int: &longs;eptunx in panibus fathi­
&longs;centibus & &longs;pinis reliquus &longs;it.

Si denique in tribus quartis centumpondij
æris partibus argenti dextans, aut dextans & &longs;emuncia non in&longs;unt, tum tan
tam diuitis plumbi portionem addat, ut æris & plumbi mi&longs;tura alterum ex
iam dictis argenti ponderibus in &longs;e contineat: quæ quarta temperatura e&longs;t:
ad quam adijciat tantum plumbi depauperati uel &longs;pumæ argenti pondus,
ut panis inde factus tria plumbi centumpondia in &longs;e contineat: quo modo
in quatuor i&longs;tius generis panibus æris tria, plumbi duodecim centumpon­
dia inerunt.

Plumbum, quod inde manat, centumpondia ferè decem pendat:
in quorum &longs;ingulis argenti quadrans, & plus quàm &longs;emuncia in&longs;unt, aut &longs;e­
ptunx: in panibus fathi&longs;centibus, & &longs;pinis, bes, uel &longs;eptunx & &longs;emuncia re&longs;i­
deant.

In &longs;ecunda aut domicilij parte, cuius &longs;pacium e&longs;t longum pedes octo
ginta, latum nouem & triginta, ad &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;int fornaces
quatuor, in quibus æs cum plumbo coctum permi&longs;cebitur: et &longs;ex, in quibus
recrementa recoquentur: harum pars caua lata &longs;it pedem & palmos tres, lon
ga pedes duos & digitos tres: illarum lata pedem & palmum, longa pedem
& palmos tres ac digitum.

Parietibus &longs;it altitudo fornacum, in quibus auri
uel argenti uenæ excoquuntur.

Cùm aut &longs;pacium definitum in duas partes
tignis &longs;tatutis diuidatur, prior habeat primo loco duas fornaces, in quibus
recrementa recoquentur: &longs;ecundo duas, in quibus æs cum plumbo mi&longs;cebi
tur, tertio unam, in qua recrementa recoquentur.

Po&longs;terior uerò primò lo­
co unam, in qua recrementa recoquentur: &longs;ecundo duas, in quibus æs cum
plumbo commi&longs;cebitur: tertio duas, in quibus recrementa recoquentur: una­
quæque ab alia di&longs;tet pedibus &longs;ex.

Primæ dextrum latus occupet pedes tres,
& palinos duos: ultimæ &longs;ini&longs;trum pedes &longs;eptem.

Binæ fornaces habeant com
mune o&longs;tium altum pedes &longs;ex, latum cubitum: attamen prima habeat propri­
um, itemque decima: cuique fornacum &longs;it &longs;uus fornix in muri tergo: &longs;ua à fron­
te fouea, quæ repleta puluere compo&longs;ito fi&longs;tucatione &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur, ut catinus fiat:
& &longs;ub eo latens humoris receptaculum: ex quo canalis &longs;tructilis per muri,
ad quem e&longs;t fornax, tergum dextror&longs;um penetrans halitus expiret, &longs;uus de­
nique catinus æreus ad dextrum frontis latus, in quem ex altero catino æs cum
plumbo mi&longs;tum fundatur, ut panes æque graues confici po&longs;&longs;int.

Hic cati­
nus æreus &longs;it cra&longs;&longs;us digitum, eius caua pars lata pedes duos, alta digitos &longs;ex.

Po&longs;t uerò &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;int follium paria decem, duæ machi­
næ eos comprimentes, uiginti organa eo&longs;dem diducentia: quæ omnia cuiu&longs;­
modi e&longs;&longs;e debeant, ex nono libro pote&longs;t intelligi.

Excoctor aut mi&longs;turus
æs cum plumbo in fornacem, excalfactam primò maiora æris fragmenta, in
manus &longs;umpta, inijciat: deinde alueum carbonum: tum minora æris fragmen­
ta.

Cùm uerò æs liquatum cœperit ex ore fornacis defluere in catinum, tunc
in eandem inijciat &longs;pumam argenti, ac, ne ex fornace pars eius euolet, carbo
nes &longs;uperinijciat: po&longs;tremò plumbum.

Sed quamprimum æs & plumbum,
ex quibus mi&longs;tis panis pote&longs;t confici, in fornacem coniecerit, rur&longs;us inijciat
alueum carbonum, & mox æris fragmenta, ex quibus &longs;ecundus panis con­
flari poterit, cis &longs;uperinijciat: mox æs & plumbum, quæ influxerunt in cati­
num, rutro purget à recremento.

Rutrum autem tale e&longs;t a&longs;&longs;erculus, in quo
contus ferreus e&longs;t infixus: a&longs;&longs;erculus ex alno uel &longs;alice factus, longus e&longs;t di­
gitos decem, latus &longs;ex, cra&longs;&longs;us &longs;e&longs;quidigitum.

Contus uerò longus pedes tres:
&longs;ed eius manubrium ligneum in eo inclu&longs;um, longum e&longs;t pedes duos & di­
midium.

Dum autem mi&longs;turam purgat & cochleari effundit in catinum æ­
reum, interea æris fragmenta, ex quibus &longs;ecundus panis fiet, liquantur.

Quod
ubi cœperit defluere, rur&longs;us &longs;pumam argenti inijciat, & carbonibus &longs;uper­
iniectis &longs;tatim plumbum: quem laborem iteret, u&longs;que dum panes triginta con­
fecerit: in quo operam & &longs;pacium horarum nouem, aut &longs;ummùm decem con
&longs;umet.

Si panes plures quàm triginta conflauerit, cùm extraordinarios tri­
ginta confecerit, ei unius operæ precium per&longs;oluatur: uerùm &longs;imul ut æris &
plumbi mi&longs;turam in catinum æreum infuderit, aquam &longs;uperiori catini parti
paulatim affundat: deinde ligno fi&longs;&longs;o & hiante prehendat uncum, & eius par
tem rectam in panem adhuc liquidum immittat.

Vncus ip&longs;e cra&longs;&longs;us &longs;it &longs;e&longs;qui­
digitum, eius recta pars longa palmos duos, lata & cra&longs;&longs;a digitos duos: po­
&longs;tea etiam pani aquam &longs;uperfundat: quo refrigerato includat uncum cate­
næ ab orbiculo linguæ gruis demi&longs;&longs;æ, in annulo ferreo: cuius pars caua &longs;it
lata &longs;ex digitos, ip&longs;e cra&longs;&longs;us fere &longs;e&longs;quidigitum: atque eundem annulum in un
co, cuius pars recta in panem immi&longs;&longs;a e&longs;t: atque &longs;ic panem de catino leuatum in
&longs;uo loco reponat.

Æs autem & plumbum, cùm ita recoquuntur, paucum re
crementum exudant, &longs;puma argenti multum: quod non cohæret, &longs;ed &longs;icuti
reliquiæ hordei, ex quo cerui&longs;ia &longs;it facta, dilabitur.

Ad murum & parietem
ei &longs;uperpo&longs;itum pompholyx in candido cinerea adhære&longs;cit, ad latera for­
nacum &longs;podos.

Fornax in qua recrementa recoquuntur A. Fornax in qua aes
cum plumbo mi&longs;cetur B. O&longs;tium C. Catinus qui est in terra
D. Catinus æreus E. Rutrum F. Vncus G. Lignum fi&longs;/
&longs;um H. Coruis ro&longs;trum I. Vncus eius catenæ K.

Atque hoc &longs;ane modo plumbum mi&longs;ceatur cum ære, in quo mediocris ar­
genti portio fuerit.

Si uerò magna in eo inerit, utpote libræ duæ, uel duæ &
bes in centumpondio, quod pendat libras centum triginta tres et trientem,
aut centum quadraginta &longs;ex & be&longs;&longs;em, tunc præ&longs;es officinæ ad talis æris cen
tumpondium addat plumbi tria centumpondia: in quorum &longs;ingulis &longs;it ar­
genti triens, uel triens et &longs;emuncia: quo modo tres fiant panes: in quibus æ­
ris tria, plumbi nouem centumpondia inerunt.

Plumbum, cùm fuerit ab æ­
re &longs;ecretum, centumpondia &longs;eptem pendat: in quorum &longs;ingulis, &longs;i æris cen­
tumpondium duas argenti libras, plumbi trientem in &longs;e continebat, argen­
ti libra & &longs;extans, ac plus quàm &longs;emuncia inerunt: in panibus uerò fathi&longs;cen
tibus & &longs;pinis remanebit triens.

Sin autem æris centumpondium duas argen
ti libras & be&longs;&longs;em, plumbi trientem & &longs;emunciam in &longs;e continebat, in &longs;ingu
lis panibus argenti &longs;e&longs;quilibra & &longs;emuncia, atque plus quam &longs;icilicus inerunt:
in panibus uerò fathi&longs;centibus triens & &longs;emuncia remanebunt.

At &longs;i exi­
gua argenti portio in ære fuerit, ea ab ip&longs;o &longs;ecerni utiliter non pote&longs;t, priu&longs;­
quam in alia fornace ita &longs;it recoctum, ut in eius parte inferiore plus argenti,
minus in &longs;uperiore remaneat.

Ea fornax crudis lateribus concamerata &longs;imi­
lis e&longs;t furno æque ac altera, in qua plumbum ab argento &longs;eparatur, à nobis
proximo libro de&longs;cripta.

Eius catinus codem modo, quo illius ex cinere con
ficitur à fronte fornacis e&longs;t os, ex quo æs recoctum in duos catinos, qui tribus
pedibus alte &longs;unt à &longs;olo officinæ, deriuatur: à &longs;ini&longs;tro uerò latere iccirco fo­
ramen, ut ligna fagina, quibus ignis alitur, in eam imponi po&longs;&longs;int.

Itaque &longs;iue
in æris centumpondio argenti &longs;extans & &longs;emuncia fuerint, &longs;iue quadrans, &longs;i
ue quadrans & &longs;emuncia, eius octo & triginta centumpondia &longs;imul in hac
fornace recoquuntur, u&longs;que dum in unoquoque æris re&longs;idui centumpondio re­
maneat argenti triens & &longs;emuncia: uerbi cau&longs;a: Si in æris nondum recocti cen
tumpondio argenti quadrans & &longs;emuncia fuerint, octo & triginta eiu&longs;dem
centumpondia, quæ &longs;imul recoqui &longs;olent, undecim argenti libras & unciam
in &longs;e continebunt.

Quoniam uerò à tanta æris ma&longs;&longs;a recocta quindecim cen
tumpondia, quibus de libris argenti quatuor ac triente & &longs;emuncia re&longs;tant
duæ libræ ac triens, auferuntur, tria & uiginti centumpondia, in quibus in­
&longs;unt argenti libræ octo & dimidia atque quadrans, remanent: quorum quodque
argenti trientem, &longs;emunciam, drachmam, drachmæ partem tertiam & uice&longs;i
mam in &longs;e continet.
Atque à tali ære argentum &longs;ecernere fructuo&longs;um e&longs;t.

Vt au­
tem magi&longs;ter de numero centumpondiorum æris re&longs;idui certior fieri po&longs;&longs;it,
ab eo ab&longs;tractum ponderet: primo enim deriuatur in catinum fornaci &longs;ubie
ctum, & ex eo panes fiunt: atque in ære &longs;ic diuidendo operam & &longs;pacium ho­
rarum quatuordecim con&longs;umit: æs quidem re&longs;iduum, cùm ad ip&longs;um certum
plumbi pondus, de qua temperatura mox dicam, adiectum fuerit, denuo co
quitur in prima fornace, ac conflantur panes, & ab ære argentum &longs;ecernitur.

Ab&longs;tractum uerò etiam iterum coquitur in prima fornace: deinde in &longs;ecun­
da recoquitur, ut re&longs;iduum rubrum fiat: at tunc ab&longs;tractum etiam denuo co
quitur in prima fornace, ac in &longs;ecunda recoquitur, ut inde conficiatur æs cal
darium.

Cùm autem æs uel fuluum, uel rubrum, uel caldarium, in &longs;ecunda for
nace recoquitur, cuiusque quadraginta centumpondia in ea collocantur: atque
ex ip&longs;is conficiuntur minimùm uiginti, &longs;ummùm quinque & triginta centun­
pondia.

Quinetiam panum fathi&longs;centium circiter duo & uiginti centumpon
dia, & æris fului decem, rubri octo &longs;imul in hac fornace collocata recoquun
tur, ut inde fiat æs perfectum.

Fornax A. Catinus &longs;uperior B. Catinus
inferior C. Panes D.
Itaque tale æs re&longs;iduum trifariam mi&longs;cetur cum plumbo.

Etenim primò æ­
ris quinque centumpondij octauæ, & plumbi centumpondia duo & tres, quar
tæ &longs;umuntur: ex quibus, quia unus conflatur panis, ex æris centumpondijs
duobus & dimidio, atque plumbi undecim conficiuntur quatuor panes.

Quod
&longs;i in &longs;ingulis æris centumpondijs fuerit argenti triens, in tot æris centumpon­
dijs inerit dextans: ad quæ adijciuntur plumbi, ex recrementis recocti, cen­
tumpondia quatuor: quorum quodque in &longs;e continet argenti &longs;icilicum & dra­
chmam: quæ pondera efficiunt &longs;e&longs;cuntiam: item plumbi depauperati &longs;eptem
centumpondia: in quorum unoquoque &longs;it drachma: quo modo in quatuor pa­
nibus ex ære & plumbo mi&longs;tis argenti libra & &longs;icilicus, ac drachma: atque &longs;ic
in &longs;ingulis plumbi, po&longs;tquam ab ære fuerit &longs;ecretum, centumpondijs argen
ti uncia & drachma: quam mi&longs;turam appellamus &longs;tannum pauper, quod pau
cum argentum in &longs;e contineat.

Quoniam uerò quinque id genus panes &longs;imul
in fornace collocantur, ex eis conflantur &longs;tanni pauperis centumpondia ple­
runque nouem & tres quartæ: in quorum &longs;ingulis argenti uncia & drachma
in&longs;unt, in uniuer&longs;is uerò de uo minus drachmæ quarta: &longs;pinarum autem re
manent centumpondia tria: in quorum &longs;ingulis argenti tres &longs;icilici &longs;unt.

At
panum fathi&longs;centium centumpondia quatuor: quorum &longs;ingula in &longs;e conti­
nent &longs;emunciam, & drachmæ quartam & dimidiam.

Quod &longs;i in æris re&longs;idui
centumpondio præter argenti trientem fuerit &longs;emuncia, in quinque panibus qui­
bu&longs;que in&longs;uper argenti &longs;e&longs;cuncia & drachma dimidia inerunt.

Deinde rur&longs;us
ex æris re&longs;idui alijs centumpondijs duobus & dimidio, ac plumbi centumpon­
dijs undecim conficiuntur quatuor panes.

Quod &longs;i in &longs;ingulis æris centumpon
dijs fuerit argenti triens, in tot uilioris metalli centumpondijs precio&longs;ioris
dextans inest: ad quod æs adijciuntur &longs;tanni pauperis octo centumpondia:
quorum &longs;ingula argenti unciam & drachmam in &longs;e continent, uniuer&longs;a do­
drantem: item plumbi depauperati centumpondia tria: in quorum &longs;ingulis
ine&longs;t drachma: quo modo quatuor id genus panes argenti libram, &longs;eptun­
cem, &longs;icilicum, drachmam in &longs;e continent: atque &longs;ic &longs;ingula plumbi, cùm ab æ­
re fuerit &longs;ecretum, centumpondia argenti &longs;e&longs;cunciam & &longs;icilicum: quam mi
&longs;turam &longs;tannum mediocre nominamus.

Tum iterum ex æris re&longs;idui alijs cen­
rtumpondijs duobus & dimidio, ac plumbi centumpondijs undecim con­
flantur quatuor panes.

Quod &longs;i in &longs;ingulis æris centumpondijs etiam fuerit
argenti triens, in tot uilioris metalli centumpondijs precio&longs;ioris dextans in
e&longs;t: ad quod æs adijciuntur &longs;tanni mediocris nouem centumpondia: quorum
&longs;ingula argenti &longs;e&longs;cunciam & &longs;icilicum in &longs;e continent: uniuer&longs;a libram, qua­
drantem, &longs;emunciam, &longs;icilicum: item &longs;tanni pauperis centumpondia duo: in
quorum utroque argenti uncia & drachma in&longs;unt: quo modo quatuor id ge­
nus panes argenti libras duas & trientem in &longs;e continent: atque &longs;ic &longs;ingula plum­
bi, cùm ab ære fuerit &longs;ecretum, centumpondia argenti &longs;extantem & &longs;emun­
ciam ac drachmam: quam mi&longs;turam &longs;tannum diues appellamus: id infertur
in &longs;ecundas &longs;ornaces, in quibus plumbum ab argento &longs;eparatur.

Quot rati­
onibus æs pro diuer&longs;a argenti portione, quæ in eo ine&longs;t, cum plumbo mi&longs;cea
tur, utroque in fornace liquefacto, & in catinum defluente, dixi: nunc dicam de
modo, quo plumbum unà cum argento rur&longs;us ab ære &longs;ecernatur.

Panes pri
mo &longs;ic grue de terra leuati in æneis fornacum laminis collocentur: uncus ca
tenæ à ro&longs;tro gruis demi&longs;&longs;æ includatur in annulo forcipis, altera chela haben
tis uncum: in cuius forcipis utroque manubrio annulus e&longs;t inclu&longs;us: atque hi duo
annuli rur&longs;us in tertio, in quo deinceps uncus catenæ.

At uncus chelæ mal­
leo percu&longs;&longs;us penetret in id ip&longs;um panis foramen, in quod pes unci erat im­
mi&longs;&longs;us, cùm de catino æreo leuaretur.

Altera uerò forcipis chela non uncina­
ta panem comprimat, ne illius uncus ex eo excidat.

Forceps autem longus &longs;it
&longs;e&longs;quipedem, annulus qui&longs;que cra&longs;&longs;us &longs;e&longs;quidigitum, pars eius lata palmum &
digitos duos.

Tales autem grues, quibus panes ex catinis æreis leuati in ter
ra reponuntur, & ex ea rur&longs;us &longs;ublati collocantur in fornacibus, duo &longs;int: u­
nus in medio &longs;pacio, quod e&longs;t inter tertium murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, & duo ti­
gna &longs;tatuta: alter in medio &longs;pacio, quod e&longs;t inter eadem tigna & &longs;eptimum mu
rum tran&longs;uer&longs;um.

Vtriu&longs;que axis quadrangulus, latus & cra&longs;&longs;us pedes duos,
di&longs;tet à tertio muro longo pedibus decem & octo, à &longs;ecundo decem & no­
uem.

Vtriu&longs;que loculamento duo tympana &longs;ufficiant: alterum ex fu&longs;is con&longs;tet:
alterum &longs;it dentatum: utriu&longs;que ro&longs;trum ex axe extet pedes decem & &longs;eptem,
atque palmos tres, & totidem digitos.

Vtriu&longs;que lingua &longs;it longa pedes duos,
& totidem palmos, lata pedem & digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;a ab utroque latere pal­
mum & digitos duos: qua uerò inter ro&longs;tri tigna fertur, lata digitos tres,
cra&longs;&longs;a palmum: quinque habeat foramina, in quibus quinque orbiculi orichal
cei uer&longs;entur: quorum quatuor parui &longs;int, quintus cæteris multo maior.

Fora­
mina, in quibus parui uer&longs;entur, longa &longs;int palmos duos, aliquanto latiora
palmo: quod orbiculi cra&longs;&longs;i &longs;int palmum, &longs;ed lati palmum & digitos duos.

Qua
tuor foramina &longs;int prope quatuor linguæ angulos, quintum in medio duo
rum priorum: à fronte tamen ab&longs;it duos palmos.

Orbiculus cæteris maior,
qui in eo foramine uoluetur, latus &longs;it palmos tres, cra&longs;&longs;us palmum, circumcir­
ca cauus, ut catena ferrea uoluatur in ea parte caua.

Eadem lingua duos ha­
beat axiculos: ad eorum alterum priores tres orbiculi &longs;int affixi, ad alterum po­
&longs;teriores duo.

Duo promoueantur in uno ro&longs;tri tigno: duo in altero: quin­
tus, cæteris maior, inter hæc duo tigna.

Eidem &longs;unt tres catenæ ferreæ &longs;uperius in annulo ferreo inclu
&longs;æ.

Operarij duo perticam, per eundem annulum penetrantem humeris &longs;u­
&longs;tinentes panem ad fornacem, in qua argentum &longs;eparatur, ab ære deportant.

Grus A. Tympanum quod ex fu&longs;is con&longs;tat B. Tympanum dentatum C.
Lingua eiusque orbiculi D. A&longs;&longs;er triangularis E. Panes F. Catenæ
gruis G. Eius uncus H. Annulus I. Forceps K.

At è regione fornacum, in quibus æs cum plumbo mi&longs;cetur, & recremen
ta recoquuntur, ad tertium murum longum &longs;int item fornaces decem, in qui­
bus argentum cum plumbo permi&longs;tum ab ære &longs;ecernetur.

Cùm autem hoc
&longs;pacium &longs;it longum pedes octoginta & palmos duos, atque in eius medio ter
tius murus longus habeat o&longs;tium latum pedes tres & palmos duos, ex u­
traque ip&longs;ius parte reliquæ erunt pedes octò & triginta, atque palmi duo: cumque
fornacum quæque occupet pedes quatuor & palmum, interuallum, quod
ab una ad aliam e&longs;t, latum &longs;it pedem & palmos tres, latitudo quinque forna­
cum, & quatuor interuallorum, efficiet pedes octo & uiginti ac palmum,
re&longs;tant ergo pedes decem & palmus: quæ men&longs;ura &longs;ic diuidatur, ut quinque
pedes & duo digiti &longs;int à prima fornace u&longs;que ad murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, &
totidem pedes ac digiti, à quinta fornace u&longs;que ad o&longs;tium.

Simili modo in
altera &longs;pacij parte ab o&longs;tio ad &longs;extam fornacem &longs;int quinque pedes & duo
digiti, & à decima fornace u&longs;que ad &longs;eptimum murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um, item
quinque pedes & duo digiti.

O&longs;tium uerò &longs;it altum pedes &longs;ex, & palmos du­
os: per id officinæ præ&longs;es & operarij ingredientur in conclaue, in quo plum­
bum, cum argento permi&longs;tum, reponetur.

Quæque fornacum habeat ba&longs;im,
focum, murum, parietes, catinum.

Ba&longs;is con&longs;tet ex duabus &longs;oleis &longs;axeis, qua­
tuor &longs;axis, quadrangulis, duabus laminis æneis.

Soleæ &longs;int &longs;axa longa pe­
des quinque & palmum, lata cubitum, cra&longs;&longs;a pedem & palmum: hæ in terra
defodiantur, ut extent palmum & digitos duos: di&longs;tentque inter &longs;e palmis fe­
rè tribus: quod tamen &longs;pacium po&longs;teriore parte &longs;it angu&longs;tius.

At &longs;axorum qua­
drangulorum quodque longum &longs;it pedes duos & totidem palmos, latum cu
bitum, cra&longs;&longs;um exteriore parte cubitum, interiore, qua &longs;pectat focum, pedem
& palmum.

Decliuia enim formentur ut laminæ æreæ, quæ ip&longs;is imponen­
tur, decliues locari po&longs;&longs;int: eorum enim duo in una &longs;olea collocentur: inque
ea &longs;uperius foramina incidantur, & immi&longs;&longs;is fibulis ferreis copulentur: plum
bo etiam infu&longs;o.

Verùm &longs;ic in &longs;oleis collocentur, ut ip&longs;a à lateribus extent pal
mum, &longs;oleæ priore parte tantundem emineant: &longs;i &longs;axa quadrangula non fue
rint in promptu, lateres in eorum locum &longs;upponantur.

Sed laminæ æreæ &longs;int
longæ pedes quatuor & palmos duos ac totidem digitos, latæ cubitum, cra&longs;­
&longs;æ palmum: utraque habeat particulam eminentem: altera priore parte, altera
po&longs;teriore: quæ longa &longs;it palmum & digitos tres, lata & cra&longs;&longs;a palmum.

Hæ
laminæ &longs;ic imponantur &longs;axis quadrangulis, ut ip&longs;æ parte po&longs;teriore ab&longs;int
à tertio muro longo tres digitos: &longs;axa priore extent totidem digitos, à lateri
bus palmum atque tres digitos: cùm laminæ coniunctæ fuerint, caua pars, quæ
e&longs;t inter particulas eminentes, & per quam &longs;tannum, quo &longs;tillant panes, de­
fluet, lata &longs;it palmum & digitos tres, longa pedes quatuor.

Laminæ uerò uel
igni uel decu&longs;&longs;u &longs;tanni, quod ad eas &longs;tiriarum figura adhærere &longs;olet, corru­
ptæ permutentur, dextra in locum &longs;ini&longs;træ repo&longs;ita, contraque &longs;ini&longs;tra in locum
dextræ.

Earum enim pars læuis, quæ dum æris fu&longs;ura fierent, arenam conti­
git, e&longs;&longs;e debet &longs;upina.

Sed, quia, cùm laminarum permutatio facta fuerit, emi
nentes particulæ, quæ tunc exteriorem locum tenent, à &longs;axis extant, ne &longs;ecre
tori &longs;int impedimento, ex eis decutiatur aliquantulum.

In utriu&longs;que uerò lo­
cum &longs;upponatur ferrum longum palmos tres, cra&longs;&longs;um utrinque digitum, &longs;ed
palmum media eius parte: quæ longa &longs;it palmum & tres digitos.

Pars caua,
quæ e&longs;t &longs;ub ip&longs;is laminis, inter utriu&longs;que lateris &longs;axa quadrangula po&longs;teriore
parte lata &longs;it pedem, priore pedem & palmum: paulatim enim dilatetur.

At
focus, qui e&longs;t intra ba&longs;im, &longs;tratus &longs;it molybdæna, ex catino, in quo plumbum
ab argento &longs;eparatur, &longs;umpta.

Po&longs;trema parte, quæ &longs;umma e&longs;t, tam altus, ut
digitos tantummodo &longs;ex ab&longs;it à laminis: à qua æqualiter decliuis ad imam,
ut &longs;tannum, quo &longs;tillant panes, in catinum defluere po&longs;&longs;it.

Sed murus ad ter
tium murum longum, ut eum ab iniuria ignium tueatur, lateribus &longs;uper la­
minas æreas &longs;tatutis, & luto conglutinatis ducatur, altus pedes duos & pal
mum, ac digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;us palmos duos, inferius latus pedes tres & pal­
mum, atque digitos tres, nam utranque laminam ibidem contegat: &longs;uperius pe
des tres, etenim utrinque oblique a&longs;&longs;urgat.

Ad utrunque i&longs;tius muri latus, qua
&longs;ub &longs;umma eius parte &longs;uberit altitudine palmi & duorum digitorum, &longs;it ba­
cillum ferreum uncinatum, in foramine tertij muri longi inclu&longs;um: plumbo
etiam infu&longs;o: ex quo muro extet palmos duos.

Ip&longs;um latum &longs;it digitos duos,
cra&longs;&longs;um digitum: habeat uncos duos: alterum ad latus, alterum parte po&longs;tre
ma, & quidem &longs;uperiore: quorum uterque &longs;pectet murum: uterque cra&longs;&longs;us &longs;it
digitum: uterque includatur in ultimum aut &longs;equentem aliquem annellum ca
tellæ ferreæ, quæ con&longs;tet ex quatuor annellis: quorum qui&longs;que longus &longs;it pal
mum & digitum, cra&longs;&longs;us &longs;emidigitum.

Sed primus in foramine anteceden­
tis bacilli ferrei includatur: in uno autem aliquo ex reliquis tribus annellis al­
teruter &longs;equentis bacilli ferrei uncus.

Bacilla uerò duo antecedentia &longs;int lon
ga pedes tres et totidem palmos ac digitum, lata digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;a unum.

Vtrunque utriu&longs;que caput habeat foramen: quorum po&longs;terius teres &longs;it, & latum
digitum, in quo primus annellus, ut dixi, includendus e&longs;t: prius longum di­
gitos duos, & dimidium, latum &longs;e&longs;quidigitum.

Etenim hoc bacilli caput la­
tum &longs;it digitos tres, cùm reliquum eius corpus tantummodo digitos duos
&longs;it latum: po&longs;terius caput digitos duos & dimidium.

In priora bacillorum fo­
ramina repagulum ferreum infigatur, longum pedes tres & palmos duos,
latum digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;um unum.

Id priore eius parte quinque parua fora­
mina quadrangula, undique lata duas tertias digiti partes, habeat: quorum ali­
ud ab alio di&longs;tet &longs;emidigito: &longs;ed primum à capite circiter digitum: in ea &longs;ecre
tor clauum ferreum infigat: &longs;i fornacem angu&longs;tare uoluerit, in po&longs;tremum:
&longs;i dilatare, in primum: &longs;i mediocriter contrahere, in aliquod medium: eadem
cau&longs;a e&longs;t, cur alteruter bacilli uncus, modò in ultimo catellæ annello, modò in
tertio, nunc uerò in &longs;ecundo includatur.

Dilatatur autem fornax, cùm panes
multi in ea collocantur: contrahitur, cùm pauci.

Veruntamen plures quàm
quinque collocari neque &longs;olent neque po&longs;&longs;unt: quinetiam panes tenues cau&longs;a &longs;unt
cur paries intror&longs;us ponatur: idem repagulum po&longs;teriore parte utrinque cor
nu eiu&longs;dem latitudinis & cra&longs;&longs;itudinis, cuius ip&longs;um e&longs;t, habeat: quod extet
digitum.

Ea cornua ob&longs;tant, ne repagulum per foramen dextri bacilli pene­
tret: in quo infixum etiam tunc manet, cùm ip&longs;um ac bacilla, parietes forna­
cis complexu &longs;uo non coercent & continent.

Porrò parietes fornacis tres &longs;int,
duo à lateribus, unus à fronte: nam à tergo murus alter e&longs;t: qui à lateribus exi­
&longs;tunt, longi &longs;int pedes tres, & totidem palmos ac digitos duos, alti pedes du
os: prior uerò longus pedes duos, & palmum, atque digitos tres, altus, æque
ac parietes à lateribus, pedes duos: qui&longs;que con&longs;tet ex ferreis bacillis, pedibus,
bracteis: ijs, qui à lateribus exi&longs;tunt, &longs;eptem &longs;int bacilla: quorum inferius &
&longs;aeperius habeant longitudinem parietis: illud &longs;tatuta &longs;u&longs;tineat, hoc eis impo­
natur.

Statuta quinque numero altitudinem habeant eandem quam parietes:
eorum media inclu&longs;a &longs;int in foraminibus inferioris & &longs;uperioris bacilli, exti
ma ex uno eodemque bacillo, ex quo inferius & &longs;uperius facta: quodque latum
&longs;it digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;um unum.

At paries prior quinque habeat bacilla: inferi
us, quod item &longs;tatuta, &longs;ed tria tantum, &longs;u&longs;tineat: &longs;uperius, quod eis impona­
tur.

Singulis autem parietibus bini &longs;int pedes, ad inferius bacillum utrinque
affixi longi palmos duos, lati unum, cra&longs;&longs;i digitum.

Sed bracteæ ferreæ ad
interiorem bacillorum partem filis ferreis alligentur, & lutum eis illinatur,
ut diutius in igne durent, & incorruptæ permaneant.

Sint præterea lateres
ferrei longi palmos tres, lati unum, cra&longs;&longs;i &longs;e&longs;quidigitum.

Superiore parte ali
quantum caui, ut panes in eis &longs;tatuí po&longs;&longs;int.

Hi lateres in uas, in quo e&longs;t terra
cum aquis mi&longs;ta, intincti &longs;upponantur tantummodo panibus, qui fiunt ex
ære cum plumbo in fornacibus permi&longs;to: nam in eis plus argenti ine&longs;t quàm
in alijs qui conficiuntur ex &longs;pinis uel cadmijs, uel recrementis recoctis.

Sin­
gulis uerò panibus bini lateres &longs;ubijciantur, ut ignis in exaltatos maiorem
uim conferre po&longs;&longs;it: eorum alter in dextra lamina, alter in &longs;ini&longs;tra collocetur.

Po&longs;tremò extra focum &longs;it catinus, latus pedem, altus palmos tres: is corru­
ptus solo luto, quod facile continet &longs;tannum, reficitur.

Soleæ A. Saxa quadrangula B. Laminæ C. Paries prior D.
Parietes qui &longs;unt a lateribus E. Repagulum F. Bacilla antece­
dentia G. Catenula H. Bacillum uncinatum I. Murus qui ab
iniuria ignium tuetur tertium murum longum K. Tertius murus
longus L. Pedes parietum M. Lateres N.
Panes O. Focus P. Catinus Q.

Sed panes quatuor numero in unius fornacis laminis collocentur, eisque
&longs;ubijciantur lateres ferrei.

Quod &longs;i fuerin: panes conflati, uel ex ære re&longs;iduo,
uel ex &longs;pinis, uel ex cadmijs, uel ex recrementis, de quibus partim &longs;upra &longs;cri­
p&longs;i, partim paulo po&longs;t &longs;cribam, quinque numero, quod tam magni et graues non
&longs;int, &longs;imul in æreis laminis collocentur, nec eis &longs;ubijciantur lateres.

Verùm
ne panis alius in alium, aut ultimus in murum, qui tertium murum longum ab iniuria
ignis tuetur, incidat, carbones longi digitos &longs;ex interponantur: medijsque lo
cis uacuis item longi & magni.

Deinde parietibus appo&longs;itis, & repagulo ob­
dito fornax carbonibus paruis compleatur: tum tot carbones, quot capit alueus
bracteis ligneis contextus, inijciantur in catinum: & &longs;uperinijciantur prunæ: pau
lo po&longs;t carbones ardentes batillo &longs;ublati in omnes fornacis partes di&longs;pergantur
ut carbones, qui in ea &longs;unt, æqualiter accendant.

Qui uerò reman&longs;erunt in ca
tino, inijciantur in focum, ut etiam ip&longs;e calefiat: quod ni factum fuerit &longs;tannum, quo
&longs;tillant panes, foci frigore congelans non defluit in catinum.

Incipiunt aut po&longs;t
quartam horæ partem &longs;tillare &longs;tanno: quod, quà non coeunt laminæ, defluit in fo­
cum: carbonibus longis combu&longs;tis, &longs;i panes inclinant ad murum, conto uncinato
erigantur: &longs;in ad repagulum, carbonibus &longs;uffulciantur.

Si præterea panis ali­
quis magis quàm cæteri &longs;ub&longs;idet, ad illum carbones addantur, ad hos non addan­
tur.

Argentum quidem unà cum plumbo de&longs;tillat: nam utrunque citius quam æs li­
que&longs;cit: &longs;pinas, quæ non effluunt, &longs;ed re&longs;ident in foco, crebrius conto uncinato
uer&longs;are oportet, ut etiam ip&longs;æ &longs;tillent &longs;tanno, mox in catinum defluente: etenim
id, quod in eis remanet, rur&longs;us excoquendum e&longs;t in primis fornacibus: quod in
catinum defluit, &longs;tatim cum reliquo in &longs;ecundas fornaces infertur, & plumbum ab
argento &longs;eparatur.

Contus aut uncinatus manubrium ferreum habeat, longum pe
des duos: in quo ligneum inclu&longs;um &longs;it longum pedes quatuor.

Stannum, quod
effluxit in catinum, &longs;ecretor cochleari æneo effundat in octo catillos æreos, la
tos palmos duos & digitos tres: quibus prius aqua luto&longs;a illinatur, ut eò fa­
cilius ex euer&longs;is &longs;tannei panes excidant: uerum &longs;i eum catilli propterea deficiunt,
quod &longs;tannum nimis celeriter defluit in catinum, tunc in ip&longs;os aquam infundat, ut
panes refrigerati citius ex eis elabantur: utque mox rur&longs;us ij&longs;dem catillis uti
po&longs;&longs;it: ni&longs;i enim talis nece&longs;&longs;itas urgeat &longs;ecretorem, catillis uacuis aquam luto­
&longs;am illinat.

Cochleare aut pror&longs;us eius e&longs;t &longs;imile, cuius u&longs;us e&longs;t in effunden­
dis metallis, quæ in primis fornacibus colliquefacta &longs;unt.

Sed cum omne &longs;tan
num è foco defluxerit in catinum, & in catillos æreos effu&longs;um fuerit, tunc pri­
mò &longs;pinæ rutro trahantur è foco in catinum: deinde ex catino in &longs;olum: tum
batillo conijciantur in ci&longs;ium: quo auectæ coaceruentur atque recoquantur,
Rutrum uerò &longs;it longum palmos duos & totidem digitos, latum palmos duos
& digitum, cumque eius po&longs;teriore parte coniunctum &longs;it manubrium ferreum longum
pedes tres: In quod inclu&longs;um &longs;it ligneum totidem pedes longum.

Po&longs;tquam
&longs;tannum ab ære fuerit &longs;ecretum, panes re&longs;iduos appellamus fathi&longs;centes, quod
&longs;ic excocti &longs;int, ut exucti e&longs;&longs;e uideantur.

Hi &longs;patha &longs;ub ip&longs;os acta &longs;ubleuentur,
& forcipe prehen&longs;i conijciantur in ci&longs;ium, atque aduehantur ad fornacem, in
qua torrentur.

Spatha quidem a&longs;&longs;imilis &longs;it eius, qua cadmiæ, quæ ad parietes
primarum fornacum adhæ&longs;erunt, decuti &longs;olent: forceps uerò longus pedes
duos & dimidium.

Eadem &longs;patha &longs;tiriæ decutiantur è laminis, ex quibus pen
dent: eadem ferrei lateres è panibus fathi&longs;centibus, ad quos adhærent.

Secre­
tor autem opus diurnum perfecit, cùm à panibus maioribus quater quater­
nis, à minoribus quater quinis &longs;tannum &longs;ecreuit: &longs;in à pluribus, extraordina
riæ operæ precium ip&longs;i &longs;eor&longs;um per&longs;oluatur.

Fornax in qua opus &longs;ecernendi perficitur A. Fornax in qua non perfici­
tur B. Catinus C. Catilli D. Panes E. Spinæ F.

Atque argenti quidem, &longs;iue plumbi cum argento permi&longs;ti, quod &longs;tannum
appellamus, ab ære &longs;ecernendi hæc ratio e&longs;t.

Stannum uero in &longs;ecundas for
naces infertur, in quibus plumbum ab argento &longs;eparatur: de qua ratione, quod
eam proximo libro pluribus uerbis expo&longs;ui, unum illud dicam.

Apud nos
abhinc aliquot annos &longs;tanni tantummodo quatuor & quadraginta centun
pondia, & æris unum &longs;imul in &longs;ecundis fornacibus fuerunt cocta, nunc &longs;tan
ni &longs;ex & quadraginta, æris unum & dimidium coquuntur: alibi uerò &longs;tanni
plerunque centum & uiginti, æris &longs;ex: quo modo &longs;pumæ argenti centumpon­
dia plus minus centum & decem, molybdænæ triginta conflantur.

Omnibus
autem his modis argentum, quod ine&longs;t in ære iniecto, cum reliquo argento
permi&longs;cetur, ip&longs;um æs, æque ac plumbum, partim in argenti &longs;pumam, par­
tim in molybdænam mutatur.

Stannum, quod non lique&longs;cit, è margine in
catinum conto uncinato trahatur.

At munus torrendi, in quatuor operas
di&longs;tributum, quatuor perficiatur diebus.

Primò, ut etiam cæteris tribus, ma
gi&longs;ter mane hora quarta ordiatur, & unà cum mini&longs;tro &longs;tirias è panibus fa­
thi&longs;centibus decutiat, & hos aduehat ad fornacem, illas auctas &longs;pinis &longs;uper
inijciat.

Malleus uerò longus &longs;it palmos tres & totidem digitos, acuta eius
pars lata palmum, teres cra&longs;&longs;a digitos tres, manubrium ligneum longum qua
tuor pedes.
Panes A. Malleus B.

Deinde magi&longs;ter puluerem terrenum conijciat in ua&longs;culum, & eum cum
aqua affu&longs;a permi&longs;ceat: qua totum fornacis focum perfundat, eique digiti cra&longs;&longs;ì
tudine puluerem carbonum in&longs;pergat.

Quod &longs;i facere neglexerit, æs in uijs
in&longs;idens, ad laminas æreas adhæret, è quibus difficulter decutitur: aut ad la­
teres, &longs;i focus eis &longs;tratus fuerit, qui ære ex eis decu&longs;&longs;o facile franguntur.

Se­
cundo die idem magi&longs;ter lateres ordinibus decem di&longs;ponat: quo modo du
odecim fiunt uiæ.

Primi autem duo laterum ordines &longs;int inter primum for­
nacis foramen, quod e&longs;t ad dextram, & &longs;ecundum: tres inter &longs;ecundum & ter­
tium foramen: rur&longs;us tres inter tertium & quartum: duo inter quartum & quin­
tum.

Lateres i&longs;tiu&longs;modi &longs;int longi pedem & palmum, lati palmos duos &
digitum, cra&longs;&longs;i palmum & digitos duos: &longs;eptem in latere cra&longs;&longs;o ex ordine col­
locentur: &longs;int enim &longs;eptuaginta numero.

Mox tribus cuiu&longs;que ordinis priori
bus lateribus imponat panes fathi&longs;centes, & tot carbones magnos in eos con­
ijciat, ut ad altitudinem digitorum quinque a&longs;&longs;urgant: deinde &longs;imiliter panes fa
thi&longs;centes &longs;uper alios lateres &longs;tatuat, eisque carbones &longs;uperinijciat, hoc modo
&longs;eptuaginta panum centumpondia in foco fornacis collocantur.

Si uerò di
midia tot ponderum pars, aut paulo maior fuerit torren da, cuique ordini late
res quatuor &longs;ufficiunt: attamen qui panes fathi&longs;centes, ex ære re&longs;iduo confla
tos, torrent, hi centumpondia nonaginta, uel centum &longs;imul in fornace collo
cant.

Priore fornacis parte locus relinquatur &longs;upremis panibus ex catino, in
quo æs perficitur, exemptis: quos &longs;u&longs;tinere panes fathi&longs;centes &longs;atius e&longs;t, quàm
laminas ferreas.

Etenim &longs;i panes illi calore liquefacti &longs;tillauerint ære, id cum
&longs;pinis in primas fornaces referri pote&longs;t: ferrum liquatum his in rebus nullo
nobis e&longs;t u&longs;ui.

Panibus i&longs;tiu&longs;modi ante panes fathi&longs;centes collocatis, torre
factor repagulum ferreum includat in muri interioribus foraminibus, quæ
à foco &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us &longs;unt ad palmos tres, & digitos duos: quorum &longs;ini&longs;trum
longius penetrat in murum, ut repagulum in ip&longs;um immitti & retrahi po&longs;&longs;it:
id teres &longs;it longum pedes octo, cra&longs;&longs;um digitos duos.

Ad dextrum latus
habeat an&longs;am item ferream, quæ à dextro capite ab&longs;it pedem: eius pars caua
&longs;it, lata palmum, alta digitos duos, ip&longs;a cra&longs;&longs;a digitum.

Repagulum aut ob­
&longs;tat, ne panes fathi&longs;centibus oppo&longs;iti, unà cum eis decidant: id, cùm munus
torrendi fuerit perfectum, torrefactor conto uncinato, in ip&longs;ius an&longs;a inclu­
&longs;o, ut po&longs;tea dicam, extrahat.

Sed, ut ea, quæ dixi, quæque dicturus &longs;um, intel­
ligi po&longs;&longs;int, etiam de hac fornace, qualis e&longs;&longs;e debeat, præcipere oportet.

A
quarto muro longo ab&longs;it pedes nouem, & totidem à muro qui e&longs;t inter &longs;e­
cundum & quartum murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um: con&longs;tet ex parietibus, fornicibus,
camino, interiore muro, foco.

Parietes duo &longs;int à lateribus, longi pedes un­
decim, palmos tres, digitos duos.

Alti, qua &longs;u&longs;tinent caminum, pedes octo
& palmum: qua prior fornix e&longs;t, tantummodo pedes &longs;eptem: cra&longs;&longs;i pedes du­
os, palmos tres, digitos duos: conficiantur ex &longs;axis uel lateribus: di&longs;tent in­
ter &longs;e pedibus octo, & palmo, atque duobus digitis.

Fornices quoque duo &longs;int:
etenim &longs;pacium etiam po&longs;tremum inter parietes &longs;tatim à &longs;olo fornicatum &longs;it,
ut caminum &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;it.

Eius fornicis fundamentum &longs;it in parietibus:
pars caua inferius eandem longitudinem habeat, quam &longs;pacium, quod e&longs;t in­
ter parietes, habet: &longs;uprema parte &longs;it alta pedes quinque & palmum, ac duos
digitos.

In huius fornicis parte caua: exi&longs;tat murus ex lateribus calce conglu­
tinatis factus: qui &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us à &longs;olo pedem & palmos tres habeat quinque
foramina &longs;piritalia, alta palmos duos & digitum, lata palmum & digitum:
quorum primum &longs;it ad dextrum murum interiorem, ultimum ad &longs;ini&longs;trum,
reliqua tria in medio eorum &longs;pacio: quinetiam ea &longs;oramina per murum inte
riorem, qui e&longs;t ad fornicem, penetrent.

In eiu&longs;modi foramina lateres dimidi
ati imponantur, ut fornax nimia aura non in&longs;piretur: & eximantur interdum,
ut is, qui panes æreos fathi&longs;centes torrefacit, in uias, quas uocant, in&longs;picere
po&longs;&longs;it, & contemplari, an recte torreantur.

At prior fornix à po&longs;teriore di&longs;tet
pedibus tribus: & palmis duobus: cuius pars caua æque longa &longs;it, ac po&longs;te
rioris fornicis: &longs;ed lata pedes &longs;ex.

Ip&longs;e fornix eandem habeat altitudinem, quam
ibidem habent parietes.

Fornicibus autem & parietibus caminus, ex lateri­
bus calce conglutinatis factus, &longs;uper&longs;truatur, altus pedes &longs;ex & triginta: is per
tectum penetret.

Murus uerò interior ad po&longs;teriorem fornicem & utrunque
parietem appo&longs;itus, ex quibus extat ad pedem, altus &longs;it pedes tres, & totidem
palmos, cra&longs;&longs;us item palmos tres: ex lateribus luto conglutinatis confectus
undique luto cra&longs;&longs;o illinatur, adeo ut id ip&longs;i &longs;uperius illitum clementer a&longs;&longs;ur­
gat ad altitudinem pedis.

Murus hic quidam qua&longs;i clypeus e&longs;t aliorum mu­
rorum: eos enim tuetur ab ignis calore muros labefactante: qui non facile re­
fici po&longs;&longs;unt, cùm i&longs;te leui opera reparari po&longs;&longs;it.

Focus uerò fiat ex luto, & te­
gatur uel laminis æneis, quales &longs;unt fornaci, in qua argentum ab ære &longs;ecerni
tur, &longs;ed quæ particulis eminentibus careant: uel lateribus, &longs;i domini in tabu­
las æneas impen&longs;am facere noluerint.

Horum latior pars ponatur decliuis:
quo modo focus po&longs;teriore parte tam altus fit, ut u&longs;que ad quinque foramina
&longs;piritalia pertingat: priore tam humilis, ut po&longs;terior prioris fornicis pars ca
ua &longs;it, alta pedes quatuor, & palmos tres, ac totidem digitos, prior pedes
quinque, palmos tres, & totidem digitos.

Quinetiam focus extra &longs;ornacem ad
pedes &longs;ex tectus &longs;it lateribus.

Prope hanc fornacem ad quartum murum lon­
gum, e&longs;t lacus longus pedes tredecim et palmum, latus pedes quatuor, altus
pedem & palmos tres: a&longs;&longs;eribus undique munitus, ne terra in cum incidat: in
quem altera parte per fi&longs;tulas aqua influit, altera eandem, &longs;i turbo fuerit ex­
tractus, terra &longs;orbet.

In huius lacus aquam conijciuntur panes ærei, à quibus
argentum & plumbum &longs;unt &longs;eparata: prioris fornicis pars prior partim clau­
di &longs;olet fore ferrea, inferius lata &longs;ex pedes & duos digitos, &longs;uperius aliquan­
tum rotundata, alti&longs;&longs;ima parte, quæ media e&longs;t, alta pedes tres & palmos du­
os.

Compo&longs;ita uerò e&longs;t ex ferreis bacillis & bracteis, ad ea filis item ferreis
affixis.

Bacilla numero &longs;unt &longs;eptem, tria tran&longs;uer&longs;a, quatuor &longs;tatuta: quorum
quodque latum e&longs;t duos digitos, cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;emidigitum: &longs;ed infimum tran&longs;uer
&longs;um longum e&longs;t pedes &longs;ex, & duos palmos, medium eandem habet longitu
dinem, &longs;upremum incuruatum media parte altius e&longs;t, atque &longs;ic longius alijs du­
obus.

Statutorum aliud ab alio di&longs;tat pedibus duobus: quorum utrunque ex
tremum altum e&longs;t pedes duos, & totidem palmos, media uerò, alta pedes tres
& palmos duos, ex &longs;upremo tran&longs;uer&longs;o curuato extant, & foramina habent,
in quæ inclu&longs;i &longs;unt unci catellarum longarum duos pedes: quarum &longs;upremi
annelli inclu&longs;i in unum aliquem annellum tertiæ catellæ: quæ exten&longs;a tigilli
caput aliquantum exci&longs;um complectitur, & ei circumuoluitur, rur&longs;usque de­
mi&longs;&longs;æ uncus uni alicui ip&longs;ius annello iniectus hæret.

Tigillum autem lon­
gum pedes undecim, latum palmum & digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;um palmum, cir­
ca ferreum axem, in proxima trabe infixum, uoluitur.

Po&longs;teriore parte ferre
um habet clauum: qui longus palmos tres, & digitum per tigillum, qua &longs;ub
it &longs;ub trabem, penetrat: & ex ip&longs;a extat altera parte palmum & digitos duos,
altera digitos tres, qua perforatus e&longs;t, ut anne'lus, in eo infixus, ip&longs;i ob&longs;tet,
ne ex tigillo excidat: nam ea pars uix cra&longs;&longs;a e&longs;t digitum, cùm altera teres cra&longs;
&longs;ior &longs;it digito.

Is clauus, cùm foris demittitur, &longs;ub trabem &longs;ubit, & facit, ut ibi
retenta pror&longs;us non decidat.

Idem ob&longs;tat, ne ferrea lamina quadrangula, quæ
ante ip&longs;um complectitur tigillum, & cui iniectus e&longs;t annulus longi unci, de
capite decidat.

Catenæ autem ferreæ, longæ pedes &longs;ex, infimus annulus in­
clu&longs;us e&longs;t in annulo fibulæ utrinque in dextrum fornacis parietem actæ, &
plumbo, in foramina infu&longs;o, firmatæ.

Vncus uerò &longs;uperius ex annulo pen­
dens, in uno aliquo annulo, cùm foris attollitur, includi &longs;olet: cùm demitti­
tur, & ex eo eximi, & in &longs;upremum imponi.

Parietes A. Fornix prior B. Fornix po&longs;terior C. Murus
in eius parte caua D. Murus interior E. Foramina F.
Caminus G. Focus H. Lacus I. Fi&longs;tula K. Turbo L.
Foris ferrea M. Becilla tran&longs;uer&longs;a N. Bacilla &longs;tatuta O.
Bracteæ P. Bacillorum foramina Q. Catellæ R. Ordi/
nes laterum S. Repagulum T. Eius an&longs;a V.
Tabulæ æneæ X.
Tertio die magi&longs;ter aggrediatur opus principale perficere.

Primo tot car
bones, &qring;t capit alueus, in &longs;olum, quod e&longs;t ante focum, conijciat, & prunis, ad eos
additis, accendat: Candentes carbonibus, in panes iniectis, batillo ferreo &longs;u
perinijciat, æqualiterque di&longs;pergat.

Batillum longum &longs;it palmos tres & digitum,
latum palmos tres: eius manubrium ferreum longum palmos duos, ligneum pedes de
cem, ut ad po&longs;teriorem fornacis parietem pertingat.

Cum panes fathi&longs;centes iam ex­
cande&longs;cunt, quod eis, &longs;i æs bonum & durum fuerit, &longs;e&longs;quihoræ &longs;pacio accidit: &longs;i ma
lum & fragile, po&longs;t duas horas, tunc torrefactor ad ip&longs;os addat carbones, qua
eos deficcre uidentur: quos carbones po&longs;tea per patens &longs;pacium, quod utrinque
e&longs;t inter parietem & forem demi&longs;&longs;am, in fornacem inijciat: id uerò latum &longs;it pedem &
palmum.

Forem aut demittat, cum recrementis primum effluentibus uiam conto a­
perit: quod fit, po&longs;tque horæ quin que abierint: & iccirco quidem foris &longs;ub &longs;upre
mam fornicis partem cauam ad pedes duos & totidem digitos demittitur, ut magi­
&longs;ter uim caloris &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;it.

Sed qua panes de&longs;ident, ea carbones non &longs;unt
adijciendi, ne liquentur.

Quod &longs;i panes, ex malo & fragili ære conflati, cum pa­
nibus, ex bono & duro ære confectis, torrentur, &longs;æpenumero æs adeo in uijs
in&longs;idere &longs;olet, ut contus adactus in eas penetrare non po&longs;&longs;it.

Is ferreus &longs;it, &
longus pedes &longs;ex atque palmos duos: in quo manubrium ligneum includatur lon
gum pedes quinque.

Deinde rutro recrementa detrahat de foco ad dextram: id
ex bractea ferrea factum priore parte: latum &longs;it pedem & palmum: mox pal
latim angu&longs;tius fiat manubrium uer&longs;us.

Altum uerò exi&longs;tat palmos duos: ei
us manubrium ferreum &longs;it longum pedes duos, ligneum, in hoc inclu&longs;um, decem.
Foris demi&longs;&longs;a A. Contus B. Panes fathi&longs;centes C. Lateres D. Forceps E.

Cùm autem panes fathi&longs;centes fuerint torrefacti, magi&longs;ter forem eo, quo
dixi modo, &longs;ubleuet: repagulum quoque conto uncinato, in eius an&longs;a inclu­
&longs;o, ex dextri muri foramine trahat in foramen &longs;ini&longs;tri: atque inde retractum re
ponat: tum contis uncinatis ip&longs;e & magi&longs;ter extrahant panes fathi&longs;centibus
oppo&longs;itos: mox de lateribus detrahant panes fathi&longs;centes.

Vncus aut qui&longs;que
&longs;it altus palmos duos, latus totidem digitos, cra&longs;&longs;us unum: eius manubrium
ferreum &longs;it longum pedes duos, ligneum undecim.

Sunt etiam ip&longs;is ra&longs;tri bi
dentes, quibus torrefacti panes extracti trahantur ad latus &longs;ini&longs;trum, ut for­
cipe prehendi po&longs;&longs;int: eorum dentes cu&longs;pidati exi&longs;tant, alti palmos duos, la
ti totidem digitos, cra&longs;&longs;i unum.

Eorundem manubrij pars ferrea &longs;it longa pe­
dem, lignea pedes nouem.

Panes torrefactos, à magi&longs;tro & mini&longs;tris e foco
exemptos, alij forcipibus prehendentes in lacum quadrangulum, aqua ferè
plenum, inijciant: qui forceps longus &longs;it pedes duos & palmos tres.

Eius ma­
nubrium utrunque teres & digito cra&longs;&longs;ius, po&longs;teriore parte ad latus rectà ex­
tet palmum & digitos duos: utraque chela priore parte lata &longs;it &longs;e&longs;quidigitum
& acuta, po&longs;teriore cra&longs;&longs;a digitum, deinde paulatim tenuior.

Hæ cùm coe­
unt, pars caua &longs;it, lata palmos duos & totidem digitos.

Panes autem torrefa
cti, qui &longs;tillant ære, &longs;tatim in lacum inijciendi non &longs;unt: quod di&longs;&longs;iliant, & to
nitur in&longs;tar &longs;onitum reddant: ijdem panes rur&longs;us ex lacu, duobus a&longs;&longs;eribus
tran&longs;uer&longs;is, in quibus &longs;tent operarij, &longs;uperiniectis ip&longs;i, forcipibus mox exi­
mantur: quanto enim citius ex eo fuerint exempti, tanto facilius ex ip&longs;is æs,
quod cinereum colorem contraxit, decutitur.

Po&longs;tremò magi&longs;ter &longs;patha la­
teres adhuc calentes de foco parumper leuet: ea longa &longs;it palmum & digitos
duos, inferius acuta, & lata palmum & digitum, &longs;uperius palmum: qua ma­
nubrium uer&longs;us fiat teres: cuius pars ferrea &longs;it, longa pedes duos, lignea &longs;e­
ptem & &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em.

Foris &longs;ublata A. Contus uncinatus B. Ra&longs;trum
bidens C. Forceps D. Lacus E.

Quarto die magi&longs;ter primò extrahat &longs;pinas, quæ in uijs &longs;ub&longs;ederunt: hæ
magis diuites &longs;unt argenti, quàm quæ confectæ &longs;unt, cùm &longs;tannum ab ære &longs;e­
cerneretur.

Etenim panes torrefacti &longs;tillant ære pauco, &longs;ed reliquo &longs;tanno fe
rè toto, ex quo &longs;pinæ con&longs;tant: certe quidem cum æris torrefacti centumpondio ar
genti tantummodo &longs;emuncia remanere debeat, interdum drachmæ tres rema­
nent.

Deinde torrefactor de lateribus metalla, quæ ad eos adhærent, malleo
decutiat, ut recoquantur.

Alij uerò lateres &longs;ub pila &longs;ubiectos contundant & la
uent: æs & plumbum &longs;ic etiam collecta recoquantur: magi&longs;ter, cùm has res aue­
ctas, in &longs;uis locis repo&longs;uerit, opus diurnum perfecit.

At mini&longs;tri panes torrefa
ctos, proximo die ex lacu exemptos, truncis quernis impo&longs;itos, primò mal­
leis teretibus percutiant, ut æs cinereum de ip&longs;is decidat: deinde eorundem par
ua foramina, in quibus idem æs ine&longs;t, malleis cu&longs;pidatis excauent.

Mallei tere­
tes longi &longs;int palmos tres & digitum: quorum altera pars &longs;it teres, & lata ac cra&longs;­
&longs;a duos digitos: altera, quæ acuta &longs;it, lata digitos duos & dimidium.

Mallei ue
rò cu&longs;pidati, cùm eandem habeant longitudinem, quam teretes, altera parte &longs;int
cu&longs;pidati, altera acuti.

Sed cu&longs;pis ex quadrangula &longs;uperiore parte paulatim
fiat tenuior.

Hæc aut e&longs;t natura æris, ut, cum torretur, colorem cinereum contrahat:
quia uerò tale æs in &longs;e continet argentum, recoquatur in primis fornacibus.

Lacus A. A&longs;&longs;er B. Forceps C. Panes torrefacti ex lacu extracti D.
