Truncus E. Malleus teres F. Malleus cu&longs;pidatus G.

De ratione, qua panes ærei fathi&longs;centes torrentur, &longs;atis dixi: nunc dicam
de modo, quo ex ij&longs;dem torrefactis rur&longs;us æs conficitur.

Hi autem, ut æris
&longs;peciem quodammodo ami&longs;&longs;am recuperent, coquantur in fornacibus, quarum
quatuor &longs;int ad &longs;ecundum murum longum in ea domicilij parte, quæ e&longs;t inter
&longs;ecundum et tertium murum tran&longs;uer&longs;um: cuius &longs;pacium longum e&longs;t pedes
tres & &longs;exaginta, atque palmos duos.

Cùm uerò quæque fornacum occupet pe­
des tredecim, utrunque &longs;pacium, quorum alterum e&longs;t ad dextrum latus primæ
fornacis, alterum ad &longs;ini&longs;trum quartæ, latum &longs;it pedes & palmos tres, medi­
um &longs;pacium, quod e&longs;t inter &longs;ecundam & tertiam fornacem, longum erit pe­
des &longs;ex.

In cuiu&longs;que horum trium &longs;paciorum medio &longs;it o&longs;tium latum &longs;e&longs;quipe
dem, altum pedes &longs;ex: quorum medium commune &longs;it utriu&longs;que fornacis magi­
&longs;tro: quæque fornax proprium caminum habeat: qui inter duos camini lon­
gi, &longs;upra de&longs;cripti, parietes a&longs;&longs;urgens innitatur duobus fornicibus & muro
communi.

Is &longs;it in medio duarum fornacum longus pedes quinque, altus decem,
cra&longs;&longs;us duos.

Ante hunc murum &longs;it pila communis duobus duarum fornacum
prioribus fornicibus, cra&longs;&longs;a pedes duos & totidem palmos, lata pedes tres
& dimidium.

Itaque fornicum prior ex hac pila communi pertineat ad alteram
pilam ei communem cum altero eiu&longs;dem fornacis fornice: is uerò ex &longs;ecundo
muro longo dextror&longs;um ad eandem pilam pertineat: quæ inferius cra&longs;&longs;a &
lata &longs;it pedes duos, & totidem palmos.

Sed prioris fornicis &longs;pacium uacuum
&longs;it longum pedes nouem & palmum: altiore eius parte altum pedes octo.

Eius uerò, qui à latere dextro e&longs;t, &longs;pacium &longs;it longum pedes quinque & pal­
mum, altitudo alteri æqualis: uterque autem fornix æque altus exi&longs;tat ac mu­
rus communis.

His certe fornicibus et muro communi, muri camini innixi obli
que a&longs;&longs;urgentes &longs;ic contrahuntur ut &longs;uprema parte, qua fumus ductatur, &longs;pa­
cium fiat longum pedes octo, latum pedem & palmos tres.

Quartus uerò
camini paries e&longs;t rectus ille &longs;uper &longs;ecundum murum longum &longs;tatutus.

Vt au­
tem murus medius communis e&longs;t duabus fornacibus, ita murus &longs;uper&longs;tructus
duobus caminis: atque hoc &longs;ane modo &longs;e habeant alij camini.

Ac primò quæque
fornax longa &longs;it pedes &longs;ex, & palmos duos, lata pedes tres & palmos duos,
alta cubitum.

Cuiu&longs;que etiam pars po&longs;terior, ad &longs;ecundum murum longum:
prior, uacua.

Primæ latus dextrum item uacuum & decliue, ut recrementa
detrahi po&longs;&longs;int: &longs;ini&longs;trum ad murum communem, ubi murum, ex lateribus lu
to conglutinatis factum, habeat, qui murum communem ab iniuria ignis tuea­
tur atque defendat: contra &longs;ecundæ fornacis latus &longs;ini&longs;trum uacuum &longs;it, dextrum
ad murum communem: ubi etiam ip&longs;i &longs;uus murus, qui igni tutamentum &longs;it.

De­
inde cuiu&longs;que fornacis pars prior extruatur &longs;axis quadrangulis, media terris
compleatur: tum quæque &longs;ornacum ad &longs;eeundum murum longum, qua in ei­
us foramine & fornice, qui à tergo e&longs;t, collocatur fi&longs;tula ærea, foueam habe­
at rotundam, latam pedes duos & totidem palmos, quæ à muro communi ab
&longs;it pedes tres.

Po&longs;tremò &longs;ub cuiu&longs;que fornacis fouea ad altitudinem cubiti &longs;it
latens humoris receptaculum, alijs a&longs;&longs;imile: cuius canalis &longs;tructilis penetrans
in &longs;ecundum murum longum declinet ad latus, dextrum quidem primæ for­
nacis, &longs;ini&longs;trum uerò &longs;ecundæ.

Magi&longs;ter autem primò catinum, &longs;i æs proxi­
mis diebus in eo fuit confectum, excindat &longs;patha lata digitos tres, longa to­
tidem palmos: cui manubrium ferreum &longs;it longum pedes duos, cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;e&longs;­
quidigitum: ligneum uerò, in eo inclu&longs;um, teres, & longum pedes quinque,
cra&longs;&longs;um ad digitos duos.

Deinde altera &longs;patha exci&longs;oria eundem catinum æ­
quet: ip&longs;a &longs;it lata palmum, longa palmos duos.

Eius manubrium, partim fer
reum, partim ligneum, omnino &longs;imile priori.

Tum puluerem terrenum & car
bonum in eum inijciat, aquam affundat, &longs;copis, quibus pertica e&longs;t infixa, uer
rat.

Mox in eundem catinum conijciat puluerem compo&longs;itum: qui habeat
pulueris carbonum cribrati ci&longs;ia duo, pulueris terreni item cribrati totidem
ci&longs;ia, arenæ fluuiatilis, quam cribrum angu&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imum tran&longs;mi&longs;it, alueos &longs;ex.

Is puluis æque ac ille, quo excoctores utuntur, aqua con&longs;per&longs;us, priu&longs;quam
conijciatur in catinum, madefiat, ut manibus niuis in&longs;tar in pilæ figuram for­
mari po&longs;&longs;it.

Iniectum primò magi&longs;ter pugnis æquet atque tundat: deinde du
obus pi&longs;tillis ligneis: quorum utrunque longum &longs;it cubitum: utrunque habeat
utrinque caput teres, &longs;ed alterum latum palmum, alterum tres digitos: utrunque
in medio &longs;it angu&longs;tius, ut manu teneri po&longs;&longs;it.

Tum iterum in catinum conij­
ciat puluerem madefactum, iterumque eum pugnis æquet, ac ij&longs;dem & pi&longs;til­
lis tundat: quinetiam a&longs;cendens & digitis in&longs;i&longs;tens, marginem catini plantis
æquet.

Po&longs;tea catino æquato, &longs;iccum puluerem carbonum in&longs;pergat, & ite­
rum eundem pi&longs;tillis tundat: &longs;ed prius angu&longs;tioribus eorum capitibus, po­
&longs;terius latioribus.

Deinde catinum percutiat marculo ligneo, longo pedes
duos: cuius utrunque caput teres &longs;it, & latum digitos tres: manubrium ligne­
um longum palmos duos, cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;e&longs;quidigitum.

Po&longs;tremò in catinum in­
ijciat tantum cinerem purum & cribratum, quantus utraque manu compre­
hendi pote&longs;t: ac in eum infundat aquam: & &longs;umpto panno lineo trito, eun­
dem cinere madido oblinat.

Catinus autem rotundus & decliuis fiat: atque,
&longs;i æs ex optimis panibus torrefactis conficitur, latus pedes duos, altus unum:
&longs;in ex alijs, latus cubitum, altus palmos duos.

Magi&longs;ter præterea habeat la­
minam ferream utrinque recuruatam, longam palmos duos, latam totidem
digitos: ea marginem catini, &longs;i fuerit altior quàm par &longs;it, amputet.

At fi&longs;tulæ
æneæ, quæ decliuis po&longs;ita ex muro eminet & extat palmos tres, &longs;uperiori
parti & utrique eius lateri, ne aduratur, lutum cra&longs;&longs;um illinat: inferiori, tenue:
nam eam margo catini ferè attingit: æs, cùm catinus ip&longs;o liquefacto fuerit ple­
nus, tangit: quin muro, qui e&longs;t &longs;upra fi&longs;tulam, ue uitium faciat, lutum illinat.

Item alteri parti laminæ ferreæ, longæ pedem & palmos tres, altæ pedem:
quam prope catinum ad latus foci decliue &longs;upra lapillos &longs;tatuat, ut recremen­
ta &longs;ub ip&longs;a effluere po&longs;&longs;int.

Alij laminæ non &longs;upponunt lapillos, &longs;ed ex ea
inferius excindunt particulam longam digitos tres, altam totidem.

Verùm
laminam, ne decidat, bacillum ferreum muro, &longs;ur&longs;um uer&longs;us ad palmos du­
os & totidem digitos, infixum teneat: id extet ex muro palmos tres.

Fornacis focus A. Caminus B. Pila communis C. Alte­
ra columna D. Murus communis post pilam communem est, &
uideri non potest: Fornices E. Murus qui communem murum
ab iniuria ignium tuetur F. Fouea G. Secundus murus lon­
gus H. O&longs;tium I. Spatha K. Altera &longs;patha L. Scopæ
quibus pertica est infixa M. Pi&longs;tilla N. Marculus li­
gneus O. Lamina P. Lapilli Q. Bacillum ferreum R.

Tum batillo ferreo, cui manubrium ligneum longius &longs;ex pedibus, prunas
in catinum inijciat, uel carbones, quos paucis prunis, ad eos adiectis, accen­
dat: & prunis &longs;uperponat panes torrefactos, qui, &longs;i ex ære fuerint, cui prima
bonitas, centumpondia tria, uel tria & dimidium pendant: &longs;i ex ære, cui &longs;e­
cunda bonitas, duo & dimidium: &longs;i ex eo, cui tertia, tantum duo.

Qui uero æ­
ris, cui præcipua bonitas, centumpondia &longs;ex imponunt, hi catinum latiorem &
altiorem faciunt.

Sed infimus panis torrefactus à fi&longs;tula di&longs;tet duobus pal­
mis, cæteri longius.

Etenim cùm inferiores liquati fuerint, &longs;uperiores dela­
p&longs;i propius ad fi&longs;tulam accedunt.

Quod &longs;i non delabuntur, batillo uel alte­
ra &longs;patha moueri debent.

Batillum autem longum &longs;it pedem, latum palmos
tres & digitos duos.

Eius manubrij pars ferrea, longa palmos duos, lignea
pedes nouem.

Circum panes torrefactos carbones longi & magni locandi
&longs;unt: in fi&longs;tula mediocres.

His omnibus ordine di&longs;po&longs;itis ignis acrior flatu
follium excitetur.

Cùm uerò ære iam lique&longs;cente carbones flammant, tunc
magi&longs;ter contum ferreum in medios infigat, ut ip&longs;i flatum concipere, flam­
ma eluctari po&longs;&longs;it: qui contus cu&longs;pidatus longus &longs;it pedes duos & dimidium.
Eius uerò manubrium ligneum, quatuor.

Panibus partim lique&longs;actis magi
&longs;ter egre&longs;&longs;us o&longs;tio per fi&longs;tulam æneam in&longs;pectet catinum: &longs;i aduerterit recte
menta nimis ad os fi&longs;tulæ adhærere, flatumque follium impedire, contum fer
reum uncinatum in fi&longs;tulam inter nares follium immittat, & eum circum os fi&longs;tulæ uol­
uens recrementa ab ip&longs;o remoueat: qui uncus &longs;it altus duos digitos.

Eius ma­
nubrij pars ferrea longa pedes tres, lignea totidem palmos.

Atque tunc tempus
e&longs;t contum &longs;ub lamina infigere, ut recrementa effluere po&longs;&longs;int.

Cum uerò panes o­
mnes liquefacti in catinum influxerint, tunc ex ære rapiat experimentum tertio
conto terete, & pror&longs;us ferreo, longo pedes tres, cra&longs;&longs;o digitum, habente cu
&longs;pidem chalybeatum, ne hi&longs;cens æs in &longs;e recipiat.

Hunc contum altero folle com
pre&longs;&longs;o per fi&longs;tulam inter utriu&longs;que narem, quàm pote&longs;t celerrime immittat in
catinum.

Rapiat uerò experimentum bis, ter, quaterue, imo u&longs;que dum intelligat
æs perfecte coctum e&longs;&longs;e.

Si æs bonum fuerit, facile ad contum adhæret, tuncque du­
obus tantummodo experimentis ip&longs;i opus e&longs;t: &longs;i bonum non fuerit, pluribus.

Etenim nece&longs;&longs;e habet id tandiu in catino coquere, u&longs;que dum ip&longs;i ad contum
adhærenti orichalceus color in&longs;idere uideatur.

Atque &longs;i eius bracteolæ æreæ
pars tam &longs;uperior quàm inferior facile frangitur, æs perfecte coctum e&longs;&longs;e &longs;i­
gnificat.

Conti autem cu&longs;pidem in parua incude ferrea locet, & de ea bracte
olam malleo decutiat.
Contus cu&longs;pidatus A. Bracteola area B. Incus C. Malleus D.

Quinetiam &longs;i æs non fuerit bonum, magi&longs;ter recrementa detrahat, bis,
terque, &longs;i res hoc po&longs;tulauerit: primò, cùm aliqui panes fuerint liquefacti:
&longs;ecundo cum omnes: tertio, cùm æs aliquandiu fuerit coctum.

At &longs;i æs fue­
rit bonum, recrementa anteaquam opus perficiatur, detrahere nece&longs;&longs;e non
e&longs;t: &longs;ed detracturus recrementa utriu&longs;que follis tigillum deprimat, & &longs;uper u­
trunque &longs;tatuat lignum longum cubitum, latum palmum, &longs;uperiore parte di­
midia exci&longs;um, ut &longs;ub ferreum clauum, po&longs;teriori ligno perforato infixum,
&longs;ubire po&longs;&longs;it.
Idem agat, cùm æs perfecte coctum fuerit.

Tunc uerò mini&longs;ter
laminam remoueat forcipe, longo pedes quatuor, & palmos tres: cuius che
læ circiter pedem longæ &longs;int: etenim earum pars recta palmos duos & tres
digitos, curuata palmum & digitum.

Idem mini&longs;ter batillo ferreo maiores
carbones conijciat in foci partem, quæ e&longs;t ad murum, qui alterum murum
ab iniuria ignis tuetur, & eos coaccruet, ac aquis affu&longs;is partim re&longs;tinguat.

Verùm magi&longs;ter æs bacillo colurno, etiam in catinum immi&longs;&longs;o bis agitet: po­
&longs;tea recrementa detrahat rutro: quod con&longs;tat ex &longs;patha ferrea lata & acuta,
& alni ligno: &longs;patha &longs;it lata &longs;e&longs;quidigitum, longa pedes tres: manubrium li­
gneum, in eius parte caua inclu&longs;um, longum totidem pedes.

At alni lignum,
in quod &longs;patha e&longs;t infixa, &longs;peciem quandam gerat rhombi, longum uerò &longs;it
palmos tres & digitum, latum palmum & digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;um palmum.

Mox &longs;copis &longs;umptis cum puluere carbonum, & carbunculis catinum totum
conuerrat, ne æs, priu&longs;quam ei conducat, refrigeretur: tum tertia &longs;patha refe
cet recrementa, quæ ad marginem catini adhæ&longs;erunt: ea longa &longs;it palmos du­
os, lata palmum & digitum.

Eius manubrij pars ferrea, longa pedem & pal­
mos tres, lignea &longs;ex pedes.

Deinde iterum recrementa detrahat de catino: quæ
mini&longs;ter nunquam aqua affu&longs;a re&longs;tinguat, ut alia recrementa re&longs;tingui &longs;olent,
&longs;ed eis paucam aquam in&longs;pergat, & &longs;inat refrigerari: &longs;i æs bullauerit, bullas
&longs;patha deprimat: tum aquam muro & fi&longs;tulæ affundat, ut tepida defluat in ca­
tinum.
Etenim æs, &longs;i frigida in ip&longs;um calidum &longs;tatim fuerit infu&longs;a, di&longs;&longs;ipatur.

Certe &longs;i tunc lapillus, uel lutum, uel lignum, uel carbo madidus in id incide­
rit, catinus æs omne, magno cum &longs;onitu, qualis e&longs;t tonitru, euomit, & quic­
quid tetigerit, lædit, & incendit.

Po&longs;t hæc a&longs;&longs;erculum excidendo curuatum
ad priorem catini partem apponat.

Is longus &longs;it pedes duos, latus palmum &
digitos duos, cra&longs;&longs;us digitum.

Mox æs, quod ine&longs;t in catino, cuneo ferreo
in panes &longs;ecare debet: is longus &longs;it pedes tres, latus digitos duos, priore par
te ad digitos duos chalybeatus: cuius manubrium ligneum item pedes tres
&longs;it longum.

Hunc autem cuneum a&longs;&longs;erculo curuato imponat, & in ære infi­
xum agitando deprimat: quo modo in uacuum æris &longs;pacium aqua influit,
& panem à reliquo eius corpore &longs;eparat.

Si æs &longs;atis perfecte coctum non fu
erit, panes fiunt nimis cra&longs;&longs;i, & non facile ex catino eximi po&longs;&longs;unt: quenque
uerò panem mox mini&longs;ter forcipe prehen&longs;um & &longs;ublatum in aquam, quam
contineat labrum, immergat: & hunc primum &longs;eor&longs;im reponat, ut magi&longs;ter
eum &longs;tatim recoquat: nam, quia aliquid recrementi ad eum adhæret, tam per­
fectus non e&longs;t, quàm qui ip&longs;um &longs;ub&longs;equitur.

Quin &longs;i æs non fuerit bonum,
duos priores panes reponat: tum iterum aquam muro, & fi&longs;tulæ affundens
&longs;ecundum panem excindat: quem mini&longs;ter item in aqua immer&longs;um, in offi­
cinæ &longs;olo reponat, eique reliquos omnes, codem modo exci&longs;os, &longs;uperimpo­
nat.

Qui &longs;i æs fuerit bonum, erunt tredecim aut plures: &longs;i non fuerit, minus
multi: atque etiam &longs;i æs fuerit bonum, unam operæ partem, nam in quatuor
partes di&longs;tributa e&longs;t, duabus horis magi&longs;ter perficit: &longs;i mediocre, duabus &
dimidia: &longs;i uile, tribus.

Alternis autem in uno catino, alternis in altero panes
torrefactos recoquat: &longs;ed mini&longs;ter quàm primum panes omnes, ex altero ca
tino exci&longs;os, aqua re&longs;tinxerit, laminam ferream, quæ e&longs;t in priore fornace, for­
cipe reponat in &longs;uo loco, & carbones batillo in catinum reijciat: dum hoc &longs;u
um munus exequitur magi&longs;ter, interea remoueat ligna à tigillis follium, ut
in alijs panibus recoquendis tertiam operæ partem con&longs;umat.

Hoc præte­
reundum non e&longs;t: &longs;i particula alicuius in&longs;trumenti ferrei ca&longs;u in catinum in­
ciderit, aut ab homine maleuolo iniecta fuerit, æs, anteaquam ferrum con&longs;u
matur, confici non pote&longs;t: quo modo duplicatus labor in id in&longs;umitur.

Ad
extremum mini&longs;ter carbones candentes omnes extinguat: & malleo lutum
&longs;iccatum ex ore fi&longs;tulæ æneæ decutiat.

Is altera parte cu&longs;pidatus &longs;it, altera te
res.
Manubrium habeat ligneum quinque pedes longum.

Quoniam uerò pe
riculum e&longs;t, ne æs, &longs;i pompholyx & &longs;podos, quæ adhæ&longs;erunt ad murum &
parietem ei &longs;uppo&longs;itum, decidant in catinum, di&longs;&longs;ipetur, eas interdum ab&longs;ter­
gat: &longs;ed &longs;ingulis hebdomadis florem æris ex labro aquis effu&longs;is eximat: in id
enim de panibus, cùm re&longs;tinguuntur, decidit.

Porrò folles, quibus magi&longs;ter
ille utitur, ab alijs differunt magnitudine: nam eorum tabulata &longs;unt longa pe
des &longs;eptem & &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em, po&longs;teriore parte lata pedes tres, priore, qua caput at
tingunt, pedem et palmos duos ac totidem digitos.

Caput uerò longum e&longs;t
cubitum & digitum, po&longs;teriore parte latum cubitum & palmum, deinde pau
latim angu&longs;tius: follium nares con&longs;tringuntur catena ferrea: quam coercet
batillum cra&longs;&longs;um, cuius alterum caput penetrat in terram ad &longs;ecundi muri
longi tergum: alterum &longs;ub tignum, quod prioribus tignis perforatis e&longs;t im­
po&longs;itum, &longs;ubit.

Eædem nares &longs;ic collocantur in fi&longs;tula ænea, ut ad palmum
unum ab&longs;int ab ore: quod latum e&longs;&longs;e debet digitos tres, ut flatus eo uehemen­
tius per angu&longs;tias eluctetur.

Catinus A. A&longs;&longs;erculus B. Cuneus C. Panes ex ære, cuneo
diui&longs;o, facti D. Forceps E. Labrum F.
Re&longs;tat de &longs;pinis, de ære cinereo, de recrementis, de cadmijs.

Panes ex &longs;pinis
conficiantur hoc modo: ad tres centumpondij partes &longs;pinarum, quæ de panibus,
ex ære & plumbo conflatis, dum &longs;tannum ab ære &longs;ecerneretur, ortæ &longs;unt: & ad
totidem centumpondij partes &longs;pinarum, quæ de panibus, ex &longs;emel recoctis
&longs;pinis conflatis eodem modo ortæ &longs;unt, addatur plumbi depauperati cen­
tumpondium, molybdænæ dimidium: &longs;in officina abundat &longs;puma argenti,
ea in locum plumbi depauperati &longs;upponatur.

Vel ad idem pondus prima­
rum &longs;pinarum, & ad centumpondium dimidium &longs;pinarum, quæ de panibus,
ex bis recoctis &longs;pinis conflatis, &longs;imili modo ortæ &longs;unt: & ad quartam centun­
pondij partem &longs;pinarum, quæ, dum panes fathi&longs;centes torrerentur, natæ &longs;unt,
adijciatur &longs;e&longs;quicentumpondium &longs;pumæ argenti & molybdænæ: utroque mo
do ex tribus centumpondijs fit panis unus.

Eiu&longs;modi uerò panes, excoctor,
&longs;ingulis diebus plus minus quindecim conficiat: qui diligenter curet ut res
metallicæ, ex quibus antecedens panis conflatur, prius recte atque ordine ef­
fluant in catinum quàm aliæ, ex quibus in&longs;equens conficitur.

Quinque autem
panes &longs;imul in fornace, in qua &longs;tannum &longs;eparatur ab ære, collocentur: qui cen­
tumpondia fere quatuordecim pendunt: nam recrementa, inde conflata, ple
runque centumpondium.

In tot uerò panibus argenti libra et unciæ ferme duæ
in&longs;unt: at &longs;tannum, quo hi par es &longs;tillant, centumpondia &longs;eptem & dimidium
pendit, quorum quodque argenti &longs;e&longs;cunciam in &longs;e continet: &longs;ed &longs;pinæ tria cen­
tumpondia, in quorum &longs;ingulis argenti fere uncia ine&longs;t: panes fathi&longs;centes
centumpondia duo & quartam partem: quæ omnia argenti ferme &longs;e&longs;cunci­
am in &longs;e continent.

Attamen hæc pro &longs;pinarum uarietate multum uariant:
etenim in &longs;pinis, quæ de panibus, ex ære & plumbo conflatis, dum &longs;tannum
ab ære &longs;ecerneretur, ortæ &longs;unt, & quæ de panibus fathi&longs;centibus dum torre
rentur, argenti unciæ fere duæ in&longs;unt, in cæteris uncia non integra.

Sunt a­
liæ præterea &longs;pinæ, de quibus paulo po&longs;t dicam.

Sed qui ex ære re&longs;iduo, quod
in fornace &longs;imili furno, cùm &longs;uperior æris pars ab inferiore fuerit diui&longs;a, re­
manet, in Carpatho monte panes conficiunt, hi &longs;pinas, quæ de panibus, cùm
&longs;tannum pauper uel mediocre ab ære &longs;ecerneretur, ortæ &longs;unt: item eas, quæ
de panibus ex recoctis &longs;pinis, aut &longs;puma argenti recocta conflatis, uno in lo
co coaceruant: &longs;ed eas, quæ de panibus ex molybdæna conflatis in loco, à pri
mo &longs;eparato, locant: &longs;imiliter ex panibus fathi&longs;centibus, dum torrerentur, na­
tas &longs;eparatim locant.
Ex his autem &longs;pinis &longs;ic conficiunt panes.

De primo acer
uo &longs;umunt quartam centumpondij partem, de altero tantundem, de tertiò
centumpondium: ad quas &longs;pinas addunt &longs;pumæ argenti &longs;e&longs;qui centumpondi
um, & molybdænæ dimidium centumpondium, atque ex eis in prima forna
ce coctis panem conflare &longs;olent.

Tales uerò panes excoctores &longs;inguli &longs;ingu
lis diebus conficiunt uiginti.
Hæc quoque hactenus, redeo ad no&longs;tra.

Æs ci­
nereum, quod è panibus torrefactis, ut dixi, decutitur, abhinc aliquot annis
in&longs;per&longs;um fuit &longs;pinis, quæ de panibus, ex ære & plumbo conflatis, ortæ fue
runt, quod in ip&longs;o æque, ac in illis argenti unciæ duæ in&longs;int: nunc uerò ramen
to, ex cadmijs, alijsque rebus lotis collecto, in&longs;pergitur.

At incolæ Carpathi
montis æs i&longs;tiu&longs;modi coquunt in fornacibus, in quibus recrementa, quæ, dum
æs rur&longs;us conficeretur, &longs;unt conflata, recoquuntur.

Quia uerò id cito lique­
&longs;cit, & ex fornacibus defluit, ad ip&longs;um coquendum opus e&longs;t duobus exco­
ctoribus: quorum alter coquat: alter panem cra&longs;&longs;um mox ex catino eximat:
hi panes tantummodo torrentur, & ex torrefactis æs denuo conficitur.

Sed re­
crementa, &longs;iue mox rutro de metallis mi&longs;tis detracta fuerint, &longs;iue cùm ad ca­
tinum cinereum digiti cra&longs;&longs;itudine adhæ&longs;erint, & eum angu&longs;tiorem fecerint,
po&longs;tea &longs;pathis exacta, dies, noctesque continenter recoquantur: quo modo pa
nes duo uel tres conflantur: prout multa uel pauca recrementa, de mi&longs;tura
æris & plumbi liquefacti detracta, recoquuntur.

Talis autem panis ad tria
centumpondia pendere &longs;olet: in quorum &longs;ingulis ine&longs;t argenti &longs;emuncia.

Quinque uerò panes &longs;imul in fornace, in qua &longs;tannum &longs;ecernitur ab ære, col­
locentur: ex his fit plumbum, cuius centumpondium argenti &longs;emunciam in &longs;e
continet: panes fathifcentes apponantur ad reliquos panes fathi&longs;centes uili
ores: ex quorum utri&longs;que æs luteum conficitur.

Spinæ uiles tunc ortæ cum pau
cis recrementis uilioribus recoquantur: ramento, ex cadmijs, alijsque rebus
facto, ip&longs;is in&longs;per&longs;o: quo modo &longs;ex uel &longs;eptem panes conflantur: quorum qui&longs;que
pendit ad duo centumpondia: eorum quinque &longs;imul in fornace, in qua &longs;tan­
num ab ære &longs;ecernitur, collocentur: qui &longs;tillant plumbo, quod pendit tria cen
tumpondia: in quorum &longs;ingulis ine&longs;t argenti &longs;emuncia.

Spinæ uili&longs;&longs;imæ tunc
natæ tantummodo cum paucis recrementis recoqui debent: æs mi&longs;tum cum
plumbo, quod è fornace defluit in catinum cinereum, cochleari effundatur
in æreos catinos oblongos: hi panes cum uilibus panibus fathi&longs;centibus tor
rentur.

Spinæ tunc ortæ, adijciantur ad &longs;pinas uiles, atque ex ip&longs;is eo modo,
quo dixi, conficiantur panes, &longs;ed ex panibus torrefactis efficiatur æs: cuius
exigua quædam portio addatur ad optimos panes torrefactos, cùm ex ip&longs;is
æs conficitur: ut æs uile unà cum bono permi&longs;tum, &longs;ine detrimento, diuen­
di po&longs;&longs;it: recrementa &longs;ecundo & tertio, &longs;i fuerit utile, recoquantur: panes in­
de facti torreantur: ex torrefactis conficiatur æs: quod æri bono immi&longs;cea­
tur.

At recrementa, quæ detrahit magi&longs;ter, qui æs ex panibus torrefactis con
ficit, cribrentur: quæ ex cribro decidunt in uas &longs;ubiectum, lauentur: quæ in
eo remanent, in ci&longs;ium effu&longs;a aduehantur ad primas fornaces, & recoquan­
tur unà cum alijs recrementis: quibus etiam in&longs;pergatur ramentum quod ex
i&longs;tis uel tunc natis cadmijs lauatis colligitur, æs quod è fornace defluit in ca
tinum cinereum, etiam cochleari effundat in æreos catinos oblongos: quo
modo conflantur panes nouem uel decem: qui &longs;imul cum uilibus panibus
fathi&longs;centibus torreantur: ex torrefactis conficiatur æs luteum.

Quinetiam
cadmia, apud nos uocata, fit ex recrementis, quæ detrahit magi&longs;ter qui æs
ex panibus torrefactis conficit, unà cum alijs uilibus recrementis recoctis.

E­
tenim &longs;i panes ærei, ex talibus recrementis conflati, franguntur, fragmenta
nominant cadmiam: ex qua & ære luteo duobus modis fit æs caldarium: uel
enim cadmiæ duæ portiones cum una æris lutei in primis fornacibus colli­
quefactæ permi&longs;centur: uel contrà æris lutei duæ cum una cadmiæ: æs autem
quod è fornace defluit in catinum cinereum, cochleari effunditur in æreos
catinos oblongos ante calefactos, ut cadmia & æs luteum bene commi&longs;ceantur:
ij&longs;dem catinis, priu&longs;quam æs caldarium futurum in ip&longs;os infundatur, puluis
carbonum in&longs;pergatur, & eodem puluere æs infu&longs;um &longs;uper&longs;pargatur, ne cad­
mia & æs luteum, anteaquam bene mi&longs;ceantur, congelent: quenque panem ex
catino effu&longs;um mini&longs;ter à puluere purget ligno: idem eum inijciat in labrum,
in qua calida in&longs;it: pulchrius enim fit æs caldarium, &longs;i calida re&longs;tinguatur.

Verùm quia &longs;æpe mentionem feci de æreis catinis oblongis, quales e&longs;&longs;e de­
beant, paucis dicam.

Longi &longs;int pedem & palmum: eorum pars caua &longs;uperi­
us, lata palmos tres & digitum, inferius rotundata.
Fornax A. Catinus B. Catini oblongi C.

Verùm ramentum duplex e&longs;t, precio&longs;um & uile: illud fit aut ex cadmijs
primarum fornacum ortis, cùm panes conflantur uel ex ære & plumbo, uel
ex &longs;pinis precio&longs;is, uel ex recrementis melioribus, uel ex ramento præ&longs;tanti­
ore: aut ex purgamentis & lateribus fornacum, in quibus panes fathi&longs;centes
torrentur: quæ omnia quibus modis tundenda & lauanda &longs;int, libro octa­
uo explicaui.

Vile uerò ramentum conficitur ex cadmijs natis, cùm panes con­
flantur uel ex &longs;pinis uilibus, uel ex recrementis deterioribus.

Excoctor aut,
qui ex ramento precio&longs;o conficiet panes, ad tria eius ci&longs;ia &longs;pumæ argenti &
molybdænæ quatuor ci&longs;ia, æris cinerei unum adijciat: quo modo nouem uel
decem panes conflantur: quorum quinque &longs;imul in fornace, in qua &longs;tannum
ab ære &longs;ecernitur, collocentur: centumpondium plumbi, quo &longs;tillant hi pa­
nes, argenti unciam in &longs;e continet: &longs;pinæ &longs;eor&longs;im locentur: quarum alueus cum
&longs;pinis precio&longs;is recoquendis commi&longs;ceatur.

Panes fathi&longs;centes unà cum alijs
bonis panibus fathi&longs;centibus torreantur.

At &longs;pinæ, quæ de plumbo, cùm
cùm in &longs;ecundis fornacibus &longs;eparatur ab argento, detrahuntur, atque molyb­
dæna, quæ in earundem fornacum media catini parte re&longs;idet, ac focus, qui ui­
tium fecit & &longs;tannum combibit, &longs;imul cum paucis recrementis in primis for
nacibus coquantur: plumbum, &longs;iue potius &longs;tannum, quod è fornace deflu­
xit in catinum, effundatur in catillos æreos, qualibus utitur &longs;ecretor.

Talis
plumbi centumpondium argenti uncias quatuor, aut &longs;i focus uitium fecerit,
plures in &longs;e continet: cuius exigua portio addatur ad æs & plumbum, cùm
ex eis conficiuntur panes.

Si enim magna adijceretur, temperatura ditior,
quàm par &longs;it, fieret: qua de cau&longs;a &longs;olertes officinæ præ&longs;ides &longs;pinas cum alijs
&longs;pinis precio&longs;is permi&longs;cent: molybdænam, quæ in media catini parte re&longs;e­
dit, & focum, qui &longs;tannum combibit, cum alia molybdæna, quæ in catino re&longs;e
dit.

Attamen aliquot panes i&longs;tiu&longs;modi diuites unà cum reliquis panibus &longs;tan
neis, quos &longs;ecretor confecit, rur&longs;us in &longs;ecundas fornaces inferri po&longs;&longs;unt.

Sed
incolæ Carpathi montis, &longs;i abundauerint particulis æris tu&longs;i, aut plumbo ex
scrementis confecto, uel in fornace, in qua panes fathi&longs;centes torrentur, col
lecto, aut &longs;puma argenti, ea uarijs modis temperant.

Prima temperatura ha­
bet plumbi ex &longs;pinis conflati centumpondia duo, &longs;pumæ argenti, &longs;pinarum
ex molybdæna confectarum: plumbi in fornace, in qua panes fathi&longs;centes
torrentur collecti, æris minuti &longs;ingulorum dimidium centumpondium: ex
quibus conflatur panis: quo modo excoctores, cùm debitam operam in co
quendo con&longs;ump&longs;erint, panes id genus quadraginta conficiunt.

Altera tem­
peratura habet &longs;pumæ argenti centumpondia duo, plumbi depauperati, uel
ex recrementis conflati unum et quartam partem, plumbi ex &longs;pinis confecti
dimidium centumpondium, æris minuti tantundem.

Tertia &longs;pumæ argen­
ti centumpondia tria, plumbi depauperati, plumbi ex &longs;pinis confecti, æris mi­
nutè contu&longs;i &longs;ingulorum dimidium centumpondium: utroque modo confla
tur panis.

Excoctores cùm munus coquendi perfecerint, panes triginta con
fecerunt.

Rationem aut, qua apud Rhetos panes fiunt, à quibus item &longs;tan­
num &longs;eparatur, libro nono explicaui.

At argentum hoc modo à ferro &longs;e­
cernatur: &longs;cobis ferri elimatæ & &longs;tibij pares portiones conijciantur in cati­
num fictilem: qui operculatus & oblitus imponatur in fornacem, quæ aura
in&longs;piratur: his liquefactis & rur&longs;us refrigeratis catinus frangatur.

Ma&longs;&longs;ula,
quæ in eius fundo re&longs;idet exempta, in puluerem conteratur: ad quem plum
bi tantundem addatur: in altero catino fictili cocta permi&longs;ceantur: ad ulti­
mum, ma&longs;&longs;ula inijciatur in catinum cinereum, & plumbum ab argento &longs;epa
retur.

Atque tot & tam uariæ &longs;unt rationes, quibus metallum à metallo &longs;ecer­
nitur.

Modos uerò, quibus eadem mi&longs;centur, partim in libro de natura fo&longs;&longs;i
lium octauo expo&longs;ui, partim aliàs exponam: nunc ad reliqua pergam.
De re Metallica Libri XI. FINIS.

GEORGII AGRICO
LAE DE RE METALLICA
LIBER DVODECIMVS.

Praecepta argenti di&longs;cernendi ab ære, libro pro­
ximo tradidi, &longs;upere&longs;t ea pars, quæ ad &longs;uccos con­
cretos pertinet: quæ, cùm aliena à re metallica uide
ri po&longs;&longs;it, quid cau&longs;æ &longs;it cur ab ea &longs;eparari non debe­
at, libro &longs;ecundo explicaui.

Succi autem concreti con­
ficiuntur uel ex aquis, quas natura, aut ars, &longs;uccis in­
fecit, uel ex ip&longs;is &longs;uccis liquidis, uel ex lapidibus mi
&longs;tis.

Initio &longs;olertes homines cùm uiderent aquas
quorundam lacuum, natura &longs;ucci plenas, &longs;olis ardo
ribus &longs;iccatas con&longs;pi&longs;&longs;ari, atque ex eis fieri &longs;uccos concretos, ueri&longs;imile e&longs;t eos
aquas a&longs;&longs;imiles alijs in locis infudi&longs;&longs;e uel corriua&longs;&longs;e in areas, ad aliquam alti­
tudinem depre&longs;&longs;as, ut ip&longs;as etiam &longs;olis calores conden&longs;arent.

Deinde, quia
uiderent i&longs;ta ratione &longs;uccos concretos tantummodo æ&longs;tate confici po&longs;&longs;e, nec
tamen in omnibus regionibus, &longs;ed in calidis & temperatis &longs;olum, in quibus
æ&longs;tiuo tempore raro pluit, eas quoque in ua&longs;is igne &longs;ubiecto coquere ad &longs;pi&longs;­
&longs;itudinem cœpi&longs;&longs;e: quo modo omnibus anni temporibus in omnibus regi
onibus, etiam frigidi&longs;&longs;imis ex aquis &longs;ucco&longs;is, &longs;iue natura, &longs;iue ars eas infece­
rit, coctis &longs;ucci concreti confici po&longs;&longs;unt.

Po&longs;tea cùm quo&longs;dam lapides u&longs;tos
&longs;tillare &longs;uccis uiderent, eos in ollis coxi&longs;&longs;e, ut etiam &longs;ic aliquos &longs;uccos concre
tos efficerent.

Sed quot & quibus rationibus, eorum qui&longs;que confici po&longs;&longs;it,
operæ precium e&longs;t cogno&longs;cere.

Itaque ordiar à &longs;ale: qui fit aut ex aqua, quæ uel
naturaliter &longs;al&longs;a e&longs;t, uel talis hominum operis effecta: aut ex diluto &longs;al&longs;o, aut ex
lixiuio item &longs;al&longs;o.

Atque aqua quidem naturaliter &longs;al&longs;a, aut in &longs;alinis à &longs;olis ar
dore, aut in cortinis uel ollis, uel fo&longs;&longs;is, ab ignis calore con&longs;pi&longs;&longs;ata uertitur in
&longs;alem.
Quæ uerò arte &longs;al&longs;a e&longs;t, igne den&longs;ata in eundem &longs;alem mutatur.

Sali­
næ autem, &longs;i loci ratio ita fert, ac ip&longs;a res hoc po&longs;tulat, fodiendæ &longs;unt multæ:
nec tamen plures quàm utile &longs;it.

Tantum enim &longs;alem conficere debemus, quan
tum po&longs;&longs;umus diuendere.

Sit uerò earum altitudo modica & planicies æ­
quata, ut omnes aquæ &longs;olis caloribus &longs;iccentur in &longs;alem: quinetiam areæ &longs;ali
nariæ, ne combibant aquas, &longs;ale primum facto cru&longs;tentur.

Vetus hoc e&longs;t &
multis in locis u&longs;itatum, aquas marinas infundere in &longs;alinas, &longs;iue in ea&longs;dem deri­
uare: non minus uetus &longs;ed minus u&longs;itatum aquas puteales in &longs;alinas ingerere:
quod Babylone factum e&longs;&longs;e autor e&longs;t Plinius: & in Cappadocia non modo putea
les, inge&longs;tas e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;ed etiam fontanas.
Certe in calidis regionib.

omnes aquæ &longs;al
&longs;æ, lacu&longs;tres quoque, in tales &longs;alinas ductæ, uel fu&longs;æ, uel inge&longs;tæ, & &longs;olis ardo
ribus &longs;iccatæ in &longs;alem conuerti po&longs;&longs;unt.

Dum autem aquæ &longs;al&longs;æ, quas conti
nent &longs;alinæ, &longs;ole coquuntur, &longs;i magni & crebri imbres effluxerint, &longs;pi&longs;&longs;itati
&longs;unt impedimento: &longs;i rari, &longs;al &longs;aporem grauiorem contrahit: ut etiam, cùm
&longs;alinæ alia aqua dulci rigantur.

Sed &longs;al ex aqua marina hoc modo conficitur:
qua parte mare ad litus &longs;tagnauerit, & ampla fuerit ac æquata campi plani­
cies, in quam marini fluctus non infunduntur, ea uel tria, uel quatuor, uel
quinque, uel &longs;ex, incilia fiunt, lata pedes &longs;ex, alta duodecim, longa &longs;excentos:
uel longiora, &longs;i planicies illa &longs;e extendit in longius &longs;pacium: eorum unum ab
altero di&longs;tat ad pedes ducentos.

Rur&longs;us inter ea fiunt tria incilia tran&longs;uer&longs;a: quin
fo&longs;&longs;a principalis &longs;ic agitur, ut aquas è &longs;tagno hau&longs;tas, infundere possit in in­
cilia, atque hæc in &longs;alinas, quibus inter incilia planicies plena e&longs;t.

Salinæ autem
&longs;unt areæ ad modicam altitudinem depre&longs;&longs;æ: circa quas terræ, ex eis, cùm de­
primerentur, effo&longs;&longs;æ, uel cùm purgarentur, extractæ, aggerantur: atque etiam
inter areas fiunt aggeres pedem alti: qui retinent aquas in eas immi&longs;&longs;as.

Inci
lia habent ora, per quæ aquas primæ quæque areæ recipiunt.

Areæ quoque ha
bent ora, per quæ aquæ rur&longs;us ex alijs in alias permanant.

Præcipitur autem
libramento, ut aquæ ex area in aream influere, & eam replere po&longs;&longs;int.

His o­
mnibus recte & ordine factis, &longs;epto reclu&longs;o aperitur os &longs;tagni, quod aquas
marinas cum aqua pluuia, uel fluuiali permi&longs;tas continet: ac omnia incilia con­
plentur.

Deinde aperitur os primæ cuiu&longs;que areæ: quæ reliquas talibus aquis
replet: hæ cùm &longs;ale, in quem den&longs;antur, totas areas incru&longs;tauerint, ip&longs;æ de­
nuo ab omnibus rebus terrenis purgantur: tum rur&longs;us prima quæque area in
cili proxima repletur i&longs;tiu&longs;modi aquis: quæ relinquuntur, donec plurimis
earum partibus tenuibus, ardore &longs;olis in halitum conuer&longs;is & di&longs;&longs;ipatis ali­
quantum cra&longs;&longs;e&longs;cant: mox aperto ore ex ea emittuntur in &longs;ecundam: ubi cum
certo temporis &longs;pacio man&longs;erint, eius quoque os aperitur, ut in tertiam aream
influant: in qua tandem totæ &longs;pi&longs;&longs;antur in &longs;alem.

Areæ uerò iterum atque ite­
rum, &longs;ale exempto, marinis aquis complentur.

Verùm &longs;al ra&longs;tris ligneis cor
radetur, batillis eijcitur.

Mare A. Stagnum B. Septum C. Incilia D.
Salinæ E. Ra&longs;trum F. Batillum G.

At aqua &longs;al&longs;a coquitur in cortinis, quæ &longs;unt in ca&longs;is prope puteos, ex qui­
bus hauritur: cuique ca&longs;æ nomen alicuius animalis, aut alterius rei &longs;olet impo
ni, & ad eam tabella picta illius effigiem exprimens affigi.

Cuiu&longs;que ca&longs;æ parietes,
uel ex terra fornacei &longs;unt, uel craticij cra&longs;&longs;o luto illiti: quanque etiam lapidei aut
latericij fieri po&longs;&longs;unt: qui &longs;unt in lateribus alti plerunque &longs;unt pedes &longs;edecim:
itaque &longs;i tectum in altitudinem pedum quatuor & uiginti a&longs;&longs;urgit, eos, qui in fron­
te & tergo exi&longs;tunt, altos e&longs;&longs;e quadraginta pedes oportet: ut etiam interio­
rem parietem intermedium.

Tectum autem con&longs;tat ex tabulis longis pedes
quatuor, latis unum, cra&longs;&longs;is digitos duos: ad quas inferius, qua longis & an­
gu&longs;tis a&longs;&longs;erculis, ad tigna in imo diuaricata, & in &longs;ummo coniuncta affixis,
imponuntur, &longs;tramina luto illita, & ad digiti cra&longs;&longs;itudinem coagmentata ap
ponuntur: &longs;uperius uerò eis item &longs;tramina luto illita, & ad &longs;e&longs;quipedis cra&longs;&longs;i
tudinem coagmentata &longs;uperimponuntur: ut ca&longs;æ ab incendio periculum non
&longs;it, & ab imbribus tuta e&longs;&longs;e, atque calorem ad ma&longs;&longs;as &longs;alis &longs;iccandas nece&longs;&longs;arium
continere po&longs;&longs;it.

Quæque autem ca&longs;a in tres partes e&longs;t di&longs;tributa: in quarum
prima ligna uel &longs;tramina collocantur: in media, inter quam & primam pari­
es communis exi&longs;tit, focus e&longs;t, &longs;uper quem imponitur cortina: ad cuius dextram
e&longs;t cupa, in quam &longs;al&longs;a, in ca&longs;am à baiulis a&longs;portata, infunditur: ad &longs;ini&longs;tram
&longs;camnum, in quo &longs;alis ma&longs;&longs;æ plus minus triginta reponuntur.

Sed triplo ple­
runque plures in po&longs;trema ca&longs;æ parte: quæ, ex luto & cinere facta, octo pedi­
bus altior e&longs;t quàm &longs;olum: quam altitudinem etiam &longs;camnum habet: nam ma
gi&longs;ter & mini&longs;tri, cùm &longs;alis ma&longs;&longs;as de cortina deportant, ex illa in hoc eunt.

In eam uerò ad cortinæ dextram a&longs;cendunt, non gradibus, &longs;ed terra cliuuli
in&longs;tar aggerata.

In &longs;ummo po&longs;tremi parietis &longs;unt duæ fene&longs;tellæ, & tertia i­
bidem in tecto, per quas fumus eluctatur: eum tam po&longs;teriore quàm priore
foci parte emi&longs;&longs;um excipit operculum: &longs;ub quo progre&longs;&longs;us ad fene&longs;tellas a­
&longs;cendit.

Hoc operculum con&longs;tat ex a&longs;&longs;eribus, quorum aliud alio paululum
e&longs;t impo&longs;itum: eos autem duæ trabes paruæ &longs;u&longs;tinent: quas trabes ca&longs;æ: in­
termedius paries è regione foci ianuam habet patentem, altam pedes octo, la
tam quatuor: per quam lenis aura, quæ fumum in po&longs;tremam partem agat,
in&longs;piratur.

Eiu&longs;dem altitudinis et latitudinis ianuam habet primus paries in
altero latere: utraque igitur tanta e&longs;t, ut per eam ligna uel &longs;tramina, atque &longs;al&longs;æ
importari, &longs;alis ma&longs;&longs;æ exportari po&longs;&longs;int.

Sed hæc, cum uentus flauerit, ne co
ctioni impedimento &longs;it, claudenda e&longs;t: quinetiam in primi i&longs;tius parietis fene­
&longs;tras uitrea &longs;pecularia &longs;unt impo&longs;ita, ut uentum excludant, lumen tran&longs;mittant.

Focum plerunque con&longs;truunt lapidibus &longs;al&longs;is, & terris cum &longs;ale mi&longs;tis, atque
&longs;al&longs;a madefactis: quales muri ualde dure&longs;cunt igni: longum uerò faciunt pedes
octo & dimidium, latum &longs;eptem & dodrantem, altum, &longs;i ligna cremantur,
ferè quatuor, &longs;i &longs;tramina, &longs;ex.

Tum autem bacillum ferreum, ad quatuor pe­
des longum, in foramine ferrei pedis, qui in medij oris, lati pedes tres, &longs;olo
in&longs;i&longs;tit, includunt: & in ip&longs;um intus procedens &longs;tramina inijciunt: at unam­
quanque cortinam ex ferri uel plumbi nigri laminis, longis pedes tres, & toti
dem latis, minus duobus digitis quadrangulam conficiunt, longam pedes
octo, latam &longs;eptem, altam &longs;emipedem: quæ laminæ iccirco non admodum
cra&longs;&longs;æ &longs;unt, ut aqua citius igni cale&longs;cat, & decoquatur: quò uerò &longs;al&longs;ior fue­
rit, eò breuiore tempore den&longs;atur in &longs;alem.

Hanc cortinam, qua laminæ cla­
uis confixæ compinguntur, maltha, quæ habet taurinum iecur, taurinumque &longs;an­
guinem & cinerem, oblinunt: ne &longs;al&longs;a effluat, aut exudet.

Ad utrunque foci me­
dij latus bina tigilla quadrangula ad tres pedes longa, ad &longs;emipedem lata &
cra&longs;&longs;a &longs;ic defodiunt in terra, ut alterum ab altero di&longs;tet pede: utrunque &longs;e&longs;qui­
pede altius quàm cortina a&longs;&longs;urgat: quibus, po&longs;tquam cortina fuerit in foci
muris locata, immittuntur duo tigilla eiu&longs;dem latitudinis & cra&longs;&longs;itudinis, &longs;ed
longa pedes quatuor: quæ, ne decidant, curta tigilla excauata continent.

Il­
lis autem longis tres perticas, longas pedes tres, latas digitos tres, cra&longs;&longs;os du
os tran&longs;uer&longs;as imponunt: quarum alia ab alia di&longs;tat pede.

Singulis autem ter­
nos bacillorum ferreorum uncos inijciunt, binos extra tigilla, &longs;ingulos in e­
orum medio.

Hæc bacilla pedem longa utrinque &longs;unt uncinata: alter uncus
dextram, alter &longs;ini&longs;tram &longs;pectat: inferiorem quenque inijciunt fibulis, quæ u­
trinque clauis fundo cortinæ affixæ in medio curuatæ eminent.

Sunt præte­
rea duæ perticæ longæ pedes &longs;ex, latæ palmum, cra&longs;&longs;æ digitos tres: quæ pri
ori tigillo &longs;ubditæ in po&longs;teriore iacent: utriu&longs;que po&longs;teriori capiti inijciunt un
cum bacilli ferrei, longi pedes duos, & digitos tres: cuius caput inferius re­
tortum cortinam &longs;u&longs;tinet: nam eius po&longs;terior pars duobus po&longs;terioribus fo­
ci angulis non in&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;ed ab eis abe&longs;t ferè be&longs;&longs;em, ut flamma, & fumus elu­
ctari po&longs;&longs;int: quæ po&longs;terior foci pars &longs;emipedem cra&longs;&longs;a, &longs;emipede altior e&longs;t
quàm cortina: quam cra&longs;&longs;itudinem & altitudinem etiam habet paries inter
hunc & tertiam ca&longs;æ partem medius & utrique contiguus, ut hæc, ex terra &
cinere factus, non ut ille lapidibus &longs;al&longs;is ductus: &longs;ed cortina prioribus duo­
bus foci angulis, eiusque lateribus in&longs;i&longs;tit: quæ, ne flamma ex foco exiliat, ci­
nere obturant.

Si &longs;al&longs;æ &longs;itula infu&longs;a in omnes cortinæ angulos influit, recte
e&longs;t &longs;uper focum impo&longs;ita.

Focus A. Os foci B. Cortina C. Tigilla in terra defo&longs;&longs;a D.
