rea uncinata G. Fibulæ H. Perticæ longiores I. Maiora ba­
cilla ferrea uncinata K.
Verùm &longs;itula ad decem &longs;extarios Romanos capit, modulus octo &longs;itulas.

In tales modulos &longs;al&longs;æ, ex puteis hau&longs;tæ, infunduntur, & à baiulis, ut dixi, in
ca&longs;am a&longs;portatæ in cupam effunduntur: & ex ea in his locis, in quibus ualde
&longs;al&longs;æ fuerint, mox &longs;itulis in cortinam transfunduntur.

In quibus uerò minus
&longs;al&longs;æ prius cochliari alto, & &longs;imul cum manubrio ex una arbore cauato in
paruas cupas, in quas &longs;al&longs;i lapides iniecti &longs;unt, ut acrimoniam, quæ in eis e&longs;t,
aquis impertiant: tum effu&longs;æ in canaliculos, per eos ducuntur in cortinam:
ex &longs;eptem & triginta &longs;al&longs;æ &longs;itulis Halæ Hermundurorum magi&longs;ter, & qui &longs;ue
cedit uicarius eius muneris uici&longs;&longs;im duas &longs;alis ma&longs;&longs;as, quibus e&longs;t metæ figu­
ra, conficiunt.

Vterque habet mini&longs;trum, aut pro eo uxorem &longs;ociam laboris:
ade&longs;t etiam adole&longs;cens, qui ligna uel &longs;tramina cortinæ &longs;ubijcit: omnes hi, quod
i&longs;tiu&longs;modi officinæ ualde incale&longs;cant, capita tantummodo pileolis &longs;tramineis
& uerenda &longs;ubligaculis tegunt, cætera nudi: &longs;ed quàm primum magi&longs;ter pri
mam &longs;al&longs;æ &longs;itulam infuderit in cortinam, adole&longs;cens ligna uel &longs;tramina &longs;ub­
iecta accendit, &longs;i ligna cremantur uel fa&longs;ces ramorum aut uirgultorum, &longs;al fit
candidus: &longs;i &longs;tramina, non raro &longs;ubniger: eorum enim fauillæ cum fumo in
operculum &longs;ublatæ, rur&longs;us decidunt in aquas, easque nigrore inficiunt.

Vt au
tem &longs;al&longs;æ celerius conden&longs;entur, cùm magi&longs;ter duos &longs;al&longs;æ modulos & toti­
dem &longs;itulas infuderit, circiter &longs;e&longs;quicyathum Romanum &longs;anguinis bubuli,
uel uitulini, uel hircini, uel mi&longs;ti in undeuige&longs;imam &longs;al&longs;æ &longs;itulam effundit, eaque
di&longs;&longs;olutum in omnes cortinæ angulos di&longs;tribuit.

Quanquam alibi &longs;angui­
nem cerui&longs;ia di&longs;&longs;oluunt, &longs;ed cùm iam aquarum feruentium &longs;ordes &longs;pumis mi­
&longs;tæ apparent, eas batillo de&longs;pumat: quam &longs;pumam, &longs;i ip&longs;i lapidibus &longs;al&longs;is o­
pus fuerit, per foramen, quod fumum emittit, in focum infundit: ibique coqui
tur in lapides &longs;al&longs;os: &longs;i non, in officinæ &longs;olum effundit: quod primum coquen
di & de&longs;pumandi munus &longs;emihora perficit.

Deinde eas adhuc horæ quadran­
tem decoquit: quo tempore incipiunt in &longs;alem den&longs;ari: quas iam calore con
cre&longs;centes ip&longs;e et mini&longs;ter, a&longs;&longs;idue &longs;pathis ligneis uer&longs;ant: tum hora eas ferue
re &longs;init: quo tempore &longs;e&longs;quicyathum cerui&longs;iæ infundit: &, ut aura cortinæ non
in&longs;piret, eius fronti mini&longs;ter imponit a&longs;&longs;erem longum pedes &longs;eptem & dimi
dium, altum pedem: utrique etiam eiu&longs;dem lateri a&longs;&longs;erem longum pedes tres
& dodrantem.
Ille, quod cortina in ip&longs;ius formis &longs;it inclu&longs;a, &longs;tabilis manet.

Hi duo, quod illi & priori tigillo tran&longs;uer&longs;o in&longs;i&longs;tant: po&longs;tea a&longs;&longs;eribus &longs;ubla
tis duas corbes altas pedes duos, & &longs;uperius totidem pedes latas, inferius tan­
tummodo palmum, tigillis tran&longs;uer&longs;is idem mini&longs;ter interponit: in quas magi
&longs;ter &longs;alem batillo inijcit, easque &longs;emihora complet.

Deinde rur&longs;us a&longs;&longs;eribus cor
tinæ impo&longs;itis, &longs;al&longs;as feruere &longs;init horæ dodrantem.

Tum iterum &longs;alem batil
lo &longs;ublatum, & &longs;ali, quo utraque corbis completa e&longs;t, &longs;uperiniectum accumu­
lat.

In diuer&longs;is autem locis, diuer&longs;as &longs;ali dant figuras: in corbibus fiunt ma&longs;&longs;æ
figura metæ, &longs;ed non in his &longs;olis, uerum etiam in in&longs;trumentis, quæ imagines
multarum rerum exprimunt, ut etiam tabulæ quædam, in quas item &longs;al con
ijcitur.

Tam uerò tabulas quàm corbes in altiore ca&longs;æ loco, qui tertia, ut di­
xi, eius pars e&longs;t, uel in &longs;camno æque alto, & in quod ex eo itur, reponunt, ut
&longs;al aere calido magis exiccetur.

Magi&longs;ter & eius uicarius, interdiu noctuque,
fe&longs;tis diebus anniuer&longs;arijs tantummodo exceptis, &longs;al&longs;as alternis coquentes &longs;a
lem conficiunt.

Nulla cortina diutius anno dimidio ignis uim &longs;u&longs;tinet: eam
magi&longs;ter &longs;ingulis hebdomadis aqua infu&longs;a lauat: lauatam &longs;traminibus &longs;ubie
ctis imponit & percutit: &longs;ed recentem primis duabus hebdomadis ter, reli­
quis bis.

Quo modo cru&longs;tæ de fundo decidunt: quæ ni decu&longs;&longs;æ fuerint, tardi
us uehementiore igni &longs;al conficitur: qui & plus &longs;al&longs;æ con&longs;umit, & cortinæ lami
nas adurit.

Si tunc aliquæ rimæ, quibus cortina fathi&longs;cit, apparent, oblinun
tur maltha.

Sal, qui primis duabus hebdomadis conficitur, minus bonus e&longs;t,
quod ferrugine fundi, nondum cru&longs;tas contrahentis, &longs;oleat infici.

Quanquam
uerò &longs;al i&longs;to modo ex &longs;al&longs;is tantum putealibus & fontanis fit, tamen etiam
eodem ex fluuialibus & lacu&longs;tribus, & marinis pote&longs;t confici: quin ex his e­
tiam, quæ arte &longs;al&longs;æ &longs;unt.

Etenim in locis, in quibus &longs;al effoditur, eius impu­
ra fragmenta & ramenta conijciuntur in aquam dulcem, ip&longs;aque decocta &longs;pi&longs;­
&longs;atur in &longs;alem.

Quidam &longs;alem quoque marinum, aqua dulci affu&longs;a, recoquunt,
& in metarum paruarum figuram formant.

Situla A. Modulus B. Cupa C. Magi&longs;ter D. Adole­
&longs;cens E. Vxor F. Spatha lignea G. A&longs;&longs;eres H.
Corbes I. Batillum K. Rutrum L. Stramina M.
Cyathus N. Va&longs;culum &longs;anguinem continens O.
Cantharus cerui&longs;iam continens P.

Aliqui &longs;alem ex &longs;al&longs;is, quæ feruentes ex terra effluunt, hoc modo confici­
unt.

In lacunam &longs;caturigino&longs;am imponunt ollas fictiles, inque eas tantam aquam,
ex &longs;caturigine cochlearibus hau&longs;tam, infundunt, ut &longs;emiplenæ fiant: quam
perpetuus aquarum, quas lacuna continet, feruor, non aliter ac ignis ardor
&longs;al&longs;am in cortinas infu&longs;am coquit.

Quamprimum autem cœperit cra&longs;&longs;e&longs;ce­
re, quod fit cùm ad tertias aut amplius fuerit decocta, forcipibus ollas pre­
hendentes eam in ferreas cortinas paruas, & quadrangulas item in lacuna col
locatas effundunt: quarum cauum longum e&longs;&longs;e &longs;olet pedes tres, latum duos,
altum digitos tres.

Quoniam uerò &longs;ingulis quaterni &longs;unt pedes graues, qui
bus in&longs;i&longs;tunt, aqua eas &longs;ubit & undique cingit: nec tamen influit: quæ, quia con
tinenter & ex lacuna per canales effluit, & &longs;caturigines recentis copiam &longs;up
peditant, &longs;emper feruet, atque cra&longs;&longs;e&longs;centem aquam in cortinas infu&longs;am, in &longs;a­
lem den&longs;are pote&longs;t: qui mox batillis eximitur, idemque labor &longs;æpius iteratur.

Verùm &longs;i &longs;al&longs;æ cum alijs &longs;uccis permi&longs;tæ fuerint, ut plerunque calidæ e&longs;&longs;e &longs;o­
lent, ex eis &longs;al non debet confici.
Lacuna A. Ollæ B. Cochlear C. Cortinæ D. Forceps E.

Alij aquas &longs;al&longs;as, &longs;ed maxime marinas, in magnis ollis ferreis coquunt:
qui, quia plerunque &longs;tramina &longs;olent concremare, &longs;alem nigriorem conficiunt:
quidam in ij&longs;dem ollis muriam &longs;al&longs;amentorum decoquunt: hi uerò &longs;alem ef
ficiunt, qui pi&longs;ces & &longs;apit & olet.
Ollæ A. Tripus B. Cochlear altum C.

Eos autem, qui &longs;alem ardentibus lignis, aquas &longs;al&longs;as infundendo confici­
unt, fo&longs;&longs;as, in quibus collocent ligna, facere oportet: quas conuenit e&longs;&longs;e lon­
gas pedes duodecim, latas &longs;eptem, altas duos & dimidium, ne aquæ infu&longs;æ
effluant: undique lapidibus &longs;al&longs;is, quamprimum haberi po&longs;&longs;unt, con&longs;tructas,
ut nec aquas &longs;orbeant, neque terra ex earum fronte, tergo, lateribus decidat:
&longs;ed, quoniam carbones unà cum liquore &longs;al&longs;o mutantur in &longs;alem, Hi&longs;pani, ut
Plinius &longs;cribit, etiam lignum referre arbitrantur.

Quercus optima, ut quæ per
&longs;e cinere &longs;yncero uim &longs;alis reddat: alibi corylus laudatur.

Attamen &longs;al, qui­
cunque ligno confit, non multum probatur, quod niger &longs;it & parum &longs;ynce­
rus: quo circa i&longs;ta &longs;alis conficiendi ratio à Germanis & Hi&longs;panis repudiata.

Fo&longs;&longs;a A. Vas in quod &longs;al&longs;a deriuatur B. Cochlear C.
Situla ad perticam, in ea inclu&longs;am, affixa D.

Sed dilutum, ex quo conficitur &longs;al, fit ex terra &longs;al&longs;a, uel &longs;alis & halinitri fœ
cunda: lixiuium uerò ex cinere arundinis uel iunci.

Verùm ex terra &longs;al&longs;a ori
tur dilutum, ex quo decocto &longs;al tantummodo conficitur: ex altera, de qua pau
lo po&longs;t plura dicam, ex quo &longs;al & halinitrum.

At ex cinere na&longs;citur lixiuium,
ex quo etiam &longs;al &longs;olus fit.

Tam autem cinis quam terra primò conijciatur in
magnam cupam: deinde aqua dulcis ei affundatur: quæ, cinere uel terra per­
ticis agitata, horarum ferme duodecim &longs;pacio imbibit &longs;alem: tum turbine ex
cupa extracto, colata excipiatur labro, mox &longs;iue dilutum fuerit &longs;al&longs;um, &longs;iue
lixiuium ua&longs;culis hau&longs;tum infundatur in paruas cupas: ad extremum trans­
fundatur in cortinam ferream uel plumbeam, & coquatur, donec aquis ex­
halatis &longs;uccus den&longs;etur in &longs;alem.

Cupa magna A. Turbo B. Labrum C. Cochlear
altum D. Cupæ paruæ E. Cortina F.
Atque hæ ferè &longs;alis conficiendi rationes &longs;unt.

Nitrum uerò item fieri &longs;olet uel ex
aqua nitro&longs;a, uel ex diluto, uel ex lixiuio.

Vt autem aqua maris, aut alia &longs;al&longs;a,
in &longs;alinas infu&longs;a, calore &longs;olis coquitur & mutatur in &longs;alem, ita nitro&longs;a Nili in
nitrarias infu&longs;a &longs;iue deriuata, & eodem ardore &longs;olis decocta uertitur in ni­
trum: quinetiam &longs;icuti mare &longs;ua ui influens in eiu&longs;dem Ægypti &longs;olum, abit
in &longs;alem, ita Nilus, cùm circa caniculæ ortum exundat, in nitrarias influens,
in nitrum conuertitur.
Nilus A. Nitrariæ B. Tales uero e&longs;&longs;e conijcio.

At dilutum, ex quo conficitur nitrum, fit ex aquis dulcibus terra nitro&longs;a
percolatis: lixiuium ex ij&longs;dem percolatis cinere roboris uel quercus: utrunque
labris exceptum, & in æreas cortinas quadrangulas inge&longs;tum coquitur u&longs;que
ad eum finem dum in nitrum &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur.

Sed nitrum tam natiuum quàm fa
cticium in cupis pueri impubis urina temperatum decoquitur in ij&longs;dem cor
tinis.

Decoctum infunditur in cupas, quibus &longs;unt fila ænea: ad quæ adhære
&longs;cens concre&longs;cit, & fit chry&longs;ocolla, quam boracem Maurorum uocabulo no
minamus.

Quondam nitrum præter urinam Cypria ærugine temperatum
fui&longs;&longs;e, & tritum Cyprio ære in Cyprijs mortarijs, Plinius autor e&longs;t.

Quineti
am quidam chry&longs;ocollam ex alumine fo&longs;&longs;ili, & &longs;ale ammoniaco conficiunt.

Cupa in qua nitrum mi&longs;cetur cum urina A. Cortina B. Cupa in qua
chry&longs;ocolla den&longs;atur C. Fila D. Mortarium E.

Verùm halinitrum conficitur ex terra &longs;icca & &longs;ubpingui: quæ, &longs;i aliquan­
tulum in ore retineatur, gu&longs;tatum &longs;al&longs;edine, cum acrimonia quadam permi­
&longs;ta, commouet.

Ea terra & puluis mi&longs;tus altitudine palmi, alternatim ponantur
in cupis: puluis i&longs;te habeat duas portiones calcis u&longs;tæ & aqua non re&longs;tin­
ctæ, atque tres cineris quernei, uel ilignei, uel roborei, uel cerrei, uel &longs;imilis: cum
quæque cupa his, alternatim po&longs;itis, tota excepto dodrante fuerit completa,
tantæ aquæ affundantur ut plena fiat: quæ po&longs;tquam terra percolatæ hali­
nitrum, quod in ea erat, combiberunt, turbine ex cupa extracto dilutum excipia
tur labro, & ua&longs;culis hau&longs;tum in paruas cupas infundatur.

Quod &longs;i &longs;apor ei
fuerit ualde &longs;al&longs;us, & aliquantum acris, probatur: &longs;in minus, improbatur: atque
idcirco rur&longs;us eadem terra percoletur, uel altera recenti: quinetiam aquæ duæ
uel tres, una eademque terra halinitri plena percolentur: &longs;ed diluta non commi­
&longs;ceantur, ni&longs;i idem &longs;apor omnibus eis fuerit: quod raro, uel nunquam accidit.

Verùm prima quæque in unam cupam infundantur: in alteram &longs;ecunda, in ter­
tiam tertia.

Quodque uerò &longs;ecundum uel tertium dilutum loco &longs;implicis aquæ ter­
ra percoletur recenti: quo modo ex utroque conficitur primum dilutum: cuiusque
primum copia habetur in æream cortinam quadrangulam infundatur & decoqua­
tur ad dimidias: mox transfundatur in cupam: in qua, operculo tecta, cum id, quod
terrenum e&longs;t, &longs;ub&longs;ederit, & dilutum fuerit limpidum, in eandem cortinam, uel alteram
refundatur atque recoquatur.

Cùm uerò efferue&longs;cens &longs;pumauerit ne effluat, &
magis purgetur, in ip&longs;um infundantur libræ tres uel quatuor lixiuij, facti ex
tribus cinereis quernei, uel a&longs;&longs;imilis portionibus, & una calcis u&longs;tæ, &longs;ed a­
qua non re&longs;tinctæ.

Verùm aqua, prius quàm infundatur, alumen fo&longs;&longs;ile re­
&longs;oluatur: &longs;int uerò illius libræ centum & uiginti, huius quinque: paulo po&longs;t di­
lutum uidebitur e&longs;&longs;e limpidum & cæruleum: &longs;ed coquatur u&longs;que dum aquas,
quæ &longs;ubtiles &longs;unt, exhalet: maxima &longs;alis po&longs;tea cochlearibus ferreis exhauri
endi pars in fundo cortinæ re&longs;ideat.

Succus autem transfundatur in cupam,
in qua bacilla recta & tran&longs;uer&longs;a &longs;unt inclu&longs;a: ad quæ refrigeratus adhære­
&longs;cit: atque, &longs;i multus fuerit, tribus quatuorúe diebus den&longs;atur in halinitrum: de­
inde dilutum, non congelatum effundatur, & re&longs;eruetur atque recoquatur.

Ha­
linitrum uerò exci&longs;um, & eo ip&longs;o diluto lauatum conijciatur in tabulas ut hoc
de&longs;tillet, ip&longs;um exiecetur.

Halinitrum certe ex diluto, pro &longs;ucci, quem com­
bibit multitudine uel paucitate, oritur multum uel paucum: ex lixiuio affu­
&longs;o, quod ip&longs;um purgat, quodam modo purum & limpidum.

Sed puri&longs;&longs;imum
& translucidum, quod magis à &longs;ale purgetur, & cra&longs;&longs;itudinem exuat, hoc mo­
do conficitur: quot amphoræ diluti infunduntur in cortinam, tot congij li­
xiuij, de quo iam dixi, affundantur: & in eandem cortinam conijciatur hali­
nitrum factitium, quantum diluto & lixiuio di&longs;&longs;olui po&longs;&longs;it: quàm primum
mi&longs;tura eficrue&longs;cens &longs;pumauerit, transfundatur in cupam, in quam iniectum
&longs;it &longs;abulum, de fluuio &longs;umptum & lauatum: ea panno tegatur: mox turbine
ex fundi foramine extracto mi&longs;tura &longs;abulo percolata excipiatur labro: dein
de in eandem uel alteram cortinam infu&longs;a decoquatur, donec maiorem diluti par­
tem exhalet.

Veruntamen &longs;i quando ualde bullit & &longs;pumat, lixiuium paucum
affundatur.

Tum transfundatur in alteram cupam: in qua bacilla &longs;unt inclu­
&longs;a: ad quæ etiam ip&longs;a adhære&longs;cens &longs;i pauca fuerit biduo, &longs;i multa triduo, uel
&longs;ummum quatriduo congelat: quæ uerò den&longs;ata non fuerit, in cortinam refun
datur & recoquatur ad dimidias: atque in cupam transfu&longs;a refrigeretur: quod
toties facere oportet, quoties res hoc po&longs;tulat ut fiat.

Alij alio modo halini­
trum purgant: eo enim ollam, ex ære caldario factam, complent, & opercu­
lo, item æreo, tectam in prunis locant: ac ip&longs;um coquunt donec lique&longs;cat.

Ol­
lam autem operculatam non oblinunt, ut operculo, cui an&longs;a e&longs;t, &longs;ublato uide­
re po&longs;&longs;int utrum liquatum &longs;it necne.

Cùm liquefactum fuerit &longs;ulfure, in pulue
rem re&longs;oluto con&longs;pergunt: Quod, &longs;i olla, in igni repo&longs;ita, non ar&longs;erit, accen­
dunt: quo &longs;imul cùm cra&longs;&longs;a halinitri pinguitudine, quæ &longs;upernatat, & &longs;ola
tunc ardet, con&longs;umpto fit purum: mox ollam ex igni remouent: po&longs;tea ex re
frigerata eximunt halinitrum puri&longs;&longs;imum: quod candidi marmoris &longs;peciem
gerit: atque tunc etiam id, quod terrenum e&longs;t, in fundo re&longs;idet.

At terra, ex qua
dilutum fuit factum, & rami quernei uel con&longs;imilis arboris alternis &longs;ub dio
ponantur, & aqua, quæ combibit halinitrum, con&longs;pergantur: quo modo
quinque uel &longs;ex annis rur&longs;us apta fit ad conficiendum dilutum.

Halinitrum,
quodammodo purum, quod dum terra tot annos quieuit interea, ortum fuit,
& quod lapidei parietes in cellis uinarijs & locis opacis exudant, cum pri­
mo diluto permi&longs;tum decoquatur.

Cortina A. Cupa in quam &longs;abulum est iniectum B. Turbo C.
Labrum D. Cupæ in quibus bacilla &longs;unt inclu&longs;a E.

Hactenus de nitri conficiendi rationibus, quæ non minus ac &longs;alis uariæ &
multiplices &longs;unt, dixi: nunc dicam de ratione conficiendi aluminis, quæ nec
ip&longs;a uniu&longs;modi et &longs;implex e&longs;t.

Etenim fit ex aqua alumino&longs;a decocta u&longs;que dum
den&longs;etur in alumen, uel ex diluto alumino&longs;o, quod ex id genus terra, uel &longs;a­
xo, uel pyrite, uel alio mi&longs;to, conficitur.

Terra effo&longs;&longs;a primò tanta, quanta tre­
centis ci&longs;ijs uehi pote&longs;t, conijciatur in duo ca&longs;tella: deinde aquis in ea deriua
tis, &, &longs;i atramenti &longs;utorij particeps fuerit, urinis puerorum impubium &longs;uper
fu&longs;is diluatur.

Operarij autem quotidie &longs;æpius uenam perticis oblongis &
cra&longs;&longs;is commoueant, ut cum aquis et urinis permi&longs;ceatur: tum turbine ex utroque
ca&longs;tello extracto dilutum excipiatur lacu, ex una uel duabus arboribus ca­
uato.

Si uerò locus aliquis talium uenarum copiam &longs;uppeditauerit, ip&longs;æ &longs;ta
tim non conijciantur in ca&longs;tella, &longs;ed primò conuehantur in areas, atque cumu­
lentur: quanto enim diutius aeri & pluuijs expo&longs;itæ fuerint, tanto meliores
fiunt.

Nam in eiu&longs;modi cumulis, aliquot po&longs;t men&longs;ibus, quàm uenæ in are­
as fuerunt conge&longs;tæ, na&longs;cuntur fibræ longè uenis bonitate præ&longs;tantes: de­
inde uehantur in &longs;ex, pluraúe ca&longs;tella, longa & lata ad nouem pedes, ad quinque
alta: mox aquis, in ea deriuatis, &longs;imiliter diluantur: po&longs;teaquam aquæ combi­
berunt alumen turbinibus extractis, dilutum excipiat lacuna rotunda, lata
pedes quadraginta, alta tres: tum uenæ ex his ca&longs;tellis euectæ conijciantur
in alia ca&longs;tella, & aquis, denuo in eo deriuatis, atque puerorum impubium uri­
nis &longs;uperfu&longs;is commoueantur perticis: quod dilutum turbinibus extractis ea
dem lacuna excipiat: &longs;iue uerò hæc, &longs;iue lacus dilutum contineat paucis po&longs;t
diebus exanclatum canaliculis infundatur in plumbeas cortinas quadran­
gulas, & in eis coquatur, donec multo maximam aquæ partem exhalarit, atque
terra ab eo &longs;ecreta fuerit: quæ in fundo cuiu&longs;que cortinæ re&longs;idens pinguis e&longs;t
& alumino&longs;a, ac ex minimis cru&longs;tis con&longs;tare &longs;olet: in quibus non raro candi
di&longs;&longs;imus & leui&longs;&longs;imus amianti, uel lapidis &longs;pecularis puluis ine&longs;t.

Tum diui
tum farinæ &longs;imile uidetur.

Sunt qui modice coctum effundunt in cupam, ut
limpidum & purum fiat: deinde in cortinam refu&longs;um recoquunt, u&longs;que dum fa
rinæ &longs;imile euadat: utro modo &longs;pi&longs;&longs;atum fuerit, mox transfundatur in ua&longs;a
lignea, in terra defo&longs;&longs;a, ut refrige&longs;cat: deinde refrigeratum effundatur in cu­
pas, in quibus &longs;urculi recti & tran&longs;uer&longs;arij &longs;unt inclu&longs;i, ad quos adhære&longs;cens
den&longs;atur in alumen: fiuntque cubi parui, & candidi, & translucidi: qui in hy­
pocau&longs;tis repo&longs;iti &longs;iccentur.

Si uenæ alumino&longs;æ atramenti &longs;utorij participi,
cum aquis dilueretur, urinæ &longs;uperfu&longs;æ non fuerint, eas in dilutum limpidum,
& purum, cùm recoquitur, infundere nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.

Ip&longs;æ enim atramentum &longs;u­
torium ab alumine &longs;eparant: quo modo illud in fundo cortinæ &longs;ub&longs;idet, hoc
&longs;upernatat: utrunque &longs;eor&longs;um effundere conuenit, in ua&longs;a minora, & ex his in
cupas, ut &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur.

Si uerò, dum dilutum recoquitur, &longs;eparata non fuerint,
mox ex minoribus ua&longs;is infundatur in maiora, eaque concludantur: in quibus
item atramentum &longs;utorium &longs;eparatum ab alumine concre&longs;cit: utrunque exci­
&longs;um, & in hypocau&longs;to &longs;iccatum diuendatur dilutum, quod in ua&longs;is & cupis
non concreuit, in cortinam refu&longs;um recoquatur: &longs;ed terra, quæ in fundo cu­
iu&longs;que cortinæ re&longs;edit, ablata in ca&longs;tello unà cum uenis, denuo aqua & urina
diluatur.

At terra, quæ in ca&longs;tellis diluto, po&longs;tquam effluxit; &longs;uperfuit ege­
&longs;ta & coaceruata quotidie, rur&longs;us magis ac magis fit alumino&longs;a, non aliter
atque terra, ex qua halinitrum fuit confectum, &longs;uo &longs;ucco plenior fit: quare de­
nuo in ca&longs;tella conijcitur, & aquæ affu&longs;æ ea percolantur.

Ca&longs;tella A. Perticæ B. Turbo C. Lacus D. Lacuna
E. Canaliculus F. Cortina plumbea G. Va&longs;a lignea in
terra defo&longs;&longs;a H. Cupa in qua &longs;urculi inclu&longs;i &longs;unt I.
At &longs;axa alumino&longs;a primò in fornace calcariæ &longs;imili &longs;ic urantur.

In &longs;undo
fornacis ex id genus &longs;axis fiat te&longs;tudo: quæ &longs;it ignis receptaculum: reliqua &longs;or­
nacis pars uacua compleatur tota ij&longs;dem &longs;axis alumino&longs;is: mox igni continenter
urantur donec rube&longs;cant, & fumum &longs;ulfureum exhalent: quod eis &longs;ecundum diuer&longs;am
ip&longs;orum naturam &longs;pacio decem uel undecim uel duodecim, uel plurium horarum
accidit: hoc unum magi&longs;tro maxime cauendum e&longs;t, ne &longs;axa plus minus quàm o­
portet, urat: nam altero modo aquis con&longs;per&longs;a non molle&longs;cunt, altero uel duriora
fiunt uel in cinerem re&longs;oluuntur: neutro ex eis alumen copio&longs;um conficitur, quia
uires, quas habent, ip&longs;a deficiunt: deinde refrigerata extrahantur, & in aream con­
uehantur, aliaque alijs &longs;uperponantur, ut &longs;trues fiat longa ad pedes quinqua­
ginta, lata octo, alta quatuor: quibus aquæ, cochliari alto hau&longs;tæ, in&longs;pergan
tur diebus quadraginta: uernis quidem mane & ue&longs;peri, æ&longs;tiuis etiam meri­
die: tanto temporis &longs;pacio madefacta calcis in&longs;tar re&longs;tinctæ re&longs;oluuntur, ori
turque noua quædam aluminis futuri materia, quæ mollis e&longs;t atque &longs;imillima li­
quidæ medullæ in &longs;axis repertæ: & quidem candida, &longs;i &longs;axa ante fuerunt can­
dida quàm urerentur: ro&longs;ea, &longs;i rubor candore mi&longs;tus eis in&longs;edit: ex illa fit alu
men candidum, ex hac ro&longs;eum: tum fornax &longs;it rotunda: cuius pars inferior, ut uim
caloris &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;it, fiat ex &longs;axis, quæ igni neque lique&longs;cunt, nec in puluerem
re&longs;oluuntur, cratis in&longs;tar con&longs;tructis: ab his alte duobus pedibus in muro, ij&longs;dem
&longs;axis ducto, collocetur grandis cortinæ fundum: quod con&longs;tet è laminis æreis: ei
us fundi concaui & rotundi linea dimetiens, pedum &longs;it octo: in locum uacuum, qui
e&longs;t &longs;ub fundum, imponentur ligna igni accendenda.

Super marginem fundi corti
na &longs;axis extruatur figura turbinata, ut eius fundi linea dimetiens fiat pedum &longs;e­
ptem, oris decem: ip&longs;a alta octo: quæ intus oleo perfricetur, deinde malthetur, ut
aquas bullientes continere po&longs;&longs;it: maltha fiat è calce recenti, cuius gleba uino
&longs;it re&longs;tincta, è &longs;quama ferri, ex umbilicis cum albumine ouorum & oleo tu&longs;is
atque permi&longs;tis: margini cortinæ &longs;uperponatur ligneus circulus, cra&longs;&longs;us pe­
dem, altus &longs;emipedem: in quo excoctores reponant batilla lignea, quibus aquas
à terreno & glebis &longs;axorum non re&longs;olutis, quæ re&longs;ident in cortinæ fundo, pur
gant.

Cortina &longs;ic præparata fere tota compleatur aquis, in eam per canaliculum
infu&longs;is, quas acri igni coquere conuenit u&longs;que dum bulliant: deinde materiæ,
ex &longs;axis u&longs;tis & aqua con&longs;per&longs;is ortæ, ci&longs;ia octo paulatim à quatuor excocto
ribus conijciantur in cortinam: qui batillis, quæ u&longs;que ad fundum pertingant,
materiam ab imo reuoluant & cum aquis mi&longs;ceant: ij&longs;dem glebas &longs;axorum non re­
&longs;olutas è cortina eximant: quo modo ter aut quater omnem materiam inijcient ho
ris plus minus duabus uel tribus interpo&longs;itis: quibus aquæ, &longs;axea illa mate­
ria refrigeratæ, rur&longs;us incipient feruere: aquas tandem &longs;atis purgatas & ad conge
landum aptas altis cochlearibus effu&longs;as per canaliculos ducant in triginta la­
cus roboreos, uel quernos, uel cerreos: quorum pars uacua &longs;it longa pedes &longs;ex,
alta quinque, lata quatuor.

In his aquæ congelant & in alumen den&longs;antur uer
no tempore diebus quatuor, æ&longs;tiuo &longs;ex: po&longs;tea foraminib.

quæ in lacuum fun­
do &longs;unt, apertis, aquæ non congelatæ excipiantur ua&longs;culis, et refundantur in cor
tinam, uel re&longs;eruentur in uacuis lacubus, ut cum magi&longs;tro excoctorum ui&longs;um fuerit
eas mini&longs;tri in cortinam refundant: quæ quia non carent alumine, meliores &longs;unt
aquis eius pror&longs;us expertibus: tum alumen &longs;calpro uel cultro excindetur: quod
cra&longs;&longs;um & præ&longs;tans erit &longs;ecundum &longs;axi uires: candidum uel ro&longs;eum &longs;ecundum eiu&longs;­
dem &longs;axi colorem.

At terrenus puluis, qui aluminis particeps in fundo lacuum
re&longs;idet cra&longs;&longs;us ad digitos tres aut quatuor, denuo cum noua aluminis materia
conijciatur in cortinam atque recoquatur: po&longs;tremò alumen exci&longs;um laue­
tur & &longs;iccatum diuendatur.
Fornax A. Area B. Saxa C. Corblear altum D. Cortina E. Caualiculus F. Lactes G.
Sed ex pyritis crudis alijsúe mi&longs;tis alumino&longs;is alumen &longs;ic fiat.

Primo in a­
reis urantur: deinde aliquot men&longs;ibus aeri exponantur, ut molle&longs;cant: tum in
cupas coniecti diluantur: po&longs;thæc dilutum in plumbeas cortinas quadrangu
las infu&longs;um coquatur donec &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur in alumen: &longs;ed pyritæ alijque lapides mi
&longs;ti non aluminis modo, &longs;ed atramenti etiam &longs;utorij participes fuerint, ut ple
runque e&longs;&longs;e &longs;olent, ex ip&longs;is utrunque eo, quo dixi, modo, confiat.

Po&longs;tremò &longs;i in pyri
tis alijsque mi&longs;tis lapidib.

dilutis fuerit metallum, &longs;iccentur, & ex eis in fornace co
ctis ip&longs;um, &longs;iue aurum, &longs;iue argentum, &longs;iue æs fuerit, conficiatur.

Atramentum uerò
&longs;utorium quatuor modis confici pote&longs;t: duob.

ex aqua atramento&longs;a, uno ex me­
lanteriæ & &longs;oryos, & chalcitidis diluto: item uno ex terris uel lapidib.

uel mi­
&longs;tis atramento &longs;is.

Aquam aut atramento&longs;am in lacunis collectam, &longs;i inde deri­
uari non pote&longs;t, operarij uel &longs;itulis hau&longs;tam ex ip&longs;is exportent, & in calidis
regionibus æ&longs;tiuo tempore in &longs;ubdiales areas, ad aliquam altitudinem de­
pre&longs;&longs;as infundant: uel machinis è puteis extractam in canales fundant: per
quos in areas influat, & in eis &longs;olis calore concre&longs;cat.
Cuniculus A. Situla B. Area C.
In frigidis autem regionib.

& hyeme eadem aqua atramento&longs;a & dulcis, pari
men&longs;ura primò in plumbeis cortinis quadrangulis decoquantur: deinde re
frigeratæ infundantur in cupas, uel in lacus, Plinius uocat pi&longs;cinas ligneas,
quibus quædam qua&longs;i tran&longs;tra &longs;uperius &longs;ic inclu&longs;a &longs;int, ut immobilia maneant:
ex his pendant re&longs;tes lapillis extentæ, ad quas humor &longs;pi&longs;&longs;us adhære&longs;cens den&longs;a
tur in translucentes atramenti &longs;utorij uel cubos uel acinos, qui uuæ &longs;peciem gerunt.
Cortina A. Lacus B. Tran&longs;tra C. Re&longs;tes D. Lapilli E.

Tertio modo atramentum &longs;utorium conficitur ex melanteria & &longs;ory: nam chal
citis, magis uero mi&longs;y, &longs;i fodinæ melanteriæ & &longs;ory copiam &longs;uppeditant, reijcere
conuenit: quod ex eis, præ&longs;ertim ex mi&longs;y atramentum &longs;utorium fiat maculo&longs;um: i­
taque hæc effo&longs;&longs;a & in cupas iniecta primo diluantur aqua: deinde, ut pyritæ,
ex quib.

non raro æs conflatur, qui in fundo cuparum re&longs;ederunt, eximi po&longs;&longs;int, di
lutum in alias cupas, latas pedes nouem, altas tres transfundatur.

Surculi & cre­
mia, quæ &longs;upernatant, eijciantur &longs;copis: po&longs;tquam omne cra&longs;&longs;amentum in fundo
cuparum con&longs;ederit: dilutum infundatur in plumbeam cortinam quadrangulam, lon­
gam pedes octo, latam & altam tres: in qua decoquatur u&longs;que dum cra&longs;&longs;um et lentum
fiat: tum in canaliculum effundatur, per quem in alteram cortinam plumbeam, iam di­
ctæ æqualem & &longs;imilem influat: refrigeratum effundatur in duodecim canalicu­
los: è quibus defluat in totidem ua&longs;a lignea, alta pedes quatuor & dimidium, la­
ta tres.

His ua&longs;is imponantur tran&longs;tra digitos quatuor aut &longs;ex inter &longs;e di&longs;tan
tia, quæ perforata &longs;int: atque è foraminib.

arundines graciles paxillis uel cune
is adactis dependeant ad fundum u&longs;que pertinentes: ad quas atramentum &longs;utorium
adhære&longs;cens paucorum dierum &longs;pacio concre&longs;cit in cubos, qui ablati reponan­
tur in conclaui: cuius &longs;olum a&longs;&longs;eribus tectum decliue &longs;it, ut humor, quo atramen­
tum &longs;utorium &longs;tillat, in &longs;ubiectum uas defluere po&longs;&longs;it: qui cum diluto recoquatur:
ut etiam is, qui in duodecim illis ua&longs;is, propterea quod nimis tenuis & liquidus
e&longs;&longs;et, non concreuit, atque &longs;ic in atramentum &longs;utorium conuer&longs;us non fuit.

Vas ligneum A. Tran&longs;tra B. Arundines C. Solum conclauis de/
cliue D. Vas ei &longs;ubiectum E.

Quarto modo atramentum &longs;utorium fit ex terris aut lapidibus atramento
&longs;is.

Talis aut uena primo conuehatur & coaceruetur, & imbribus uernis uel
autumnalibus, caloribus æ&longs;tiuis, pruinis & gelicidijs hybernis quinque aut
&longs;ex men&longs;es exponatur, & aliquoties batillis ita &longs;ubuertatur, ut ea, quæ in &longs;un
do re&longs;idebat, &longs;upremum locum teneat: ita uentiletur, ut refrige&longs;cat: quo modo ter
ta re&longs;oluitur atque fermente&longs;cit, lapis ex duro mollis euadit: deinde uena te­
cto operta, uel &longs;ub tectum uecta rur&longs;us in eo loco remaneat &longs;ex, aut &longs;eptem, aut
octo men&longs;es: po&longs;tea eius tanta portio, quanta &longs;atis e&longs;t, conijciatur in ca&longs;tellum,
cuius dimidia pars aquis &longs;it repleta: id longum exi&longs;tat pedes centum, latum quatu
or & uiginti, altum octo: habeat ad fundum forem, ut ea aperta uenæ, quæ exuit
atramentum, feces eximi po&longs;&longs;int: habeat à fundo alte uno pede, tria uel quatu­
or foramina, ut ip&longs;is clau&longs;is aquæ contineri po&longs;&longs;int, reclu&longs;is dilutum effluere,
uena &longs;ic cum aquis mi&longs;ta, & perticis agitata in ca&longs;tello relinquatur, donec eius
partes terrenæ in fundo re&longs;ederint, aquæ &longs;ucco&longs;as combiberint: tum foramini
bus reclu&longs;is dilutum, ex ea &longs;tello effluens, excipiat ca&longs;tellum ei &longs;ubiectum: quod
eandem habeat longitudinem, &longs;ed latum &longs;it pedes duodecim, altum quatuor,
ut dilutum capere po&longs;&longs;it: id &longs;i non fuerit &longs;atis atramento&longs;um, ip&longs;o uena recens
diluatur: &longs;in atramento&longs;um fuerit, nec tamen omne uenæ diuitis atramentum
exorbuerit, uenam denuo aqua &longs;implici diluere conuenit: dilutum quàm pri­
mum limpidum fuerit, in plumbeas cortinas quadrangulas per canaliculos infu­
&longs;um coquatur, u&longs;que dum aquas exhalet: mox inijciantur tantulæ ferri bracteæ re
&longs;oluendæ quantulas diluti natura po&longs;tulat: inde rur&longs;us coctum bulliat, donec
tam cra&longs;&longs;um fiat, ut refrigeratum in atramentum &longs;utorium &longs;pi&longs;&longs;ari po&longs;&longs;it: po&longs;thæc
effundatur in lacus, aut cupas, aut alia ua&longs;a, in quibus omne duobus uel tri­
bus diebus congelat, quod ad congelandum aptum e&longs;t: id uerò quod non fue­
rit congelatum uel &longs;tatim in cortinam refu&longs;um recoquatur, uel re&longs;eruetur, ut eo
uena recens diluatur: nam aqua &longs;implici longe præ&longs;tat.

Atramentum uerò den­
&longs;atum excindatur, & denuo in cortinam coniectum recoquatur & liquefiat: liqua
tum infundatur in catinos ut ex eo pa&longs;tilli fiant: &longs;i primo non &longs;atis &longs;pi&longs;&longs;atur,
diluto effu&longs;o den&longs;atum bis, uel ter, rur&longs;us in cortina liquefiat, & in catinos re­
fundatur: quo modo ex eo pa&longs;tilli conficiuntur puri, & a&longs;pectu pulchri.
Cortina A. Catini B. Pa&longs;tilli C.

Sed pyritæ atramento&longs;i, qui in numero mi&longs;torum &longs;unt, ut alumino&longs;i uran­
tur, aquis diluantur, dilutum coquatur in cortinis plumbeis donec den&longs;etur
in atramentum &longs;utorium.

Quanque ex his alumen & atramentum &longs;utorium
plerunque confiunt: nec mirum: &longs;ucci enim &longs;unt cognati, & in hac r e&longs;olue
runt, quod illud minus, hoc magis &longs;it terrenum.

I&longs;tiu&longs;modi autem pyritæ, &longs;i
quid metalli in eis inerit, item in fornacibus excoquantur.

Eodem modo ex
alijs mi&longs;tis atramento&longs;is atque metallicis conficiatur atramentum &longs;utorium et
metallum.

Quinetiam &longs;i uenæ pyritis atramento&longs;is abundauerint, quidam
metallici non magnas arbores medias diffindunt, easque rur&longs;us in partes &longs;e­
cane tam longas quam latæ &longs;unt fo&longs;&longs;æ latentes & cuniculi, in quibus eas tran&longs;
uer&longs;as collocant: quoniam uerò ip&longs;as &longs;tabilitatis ergò &longs;ic humi &longs;ternunt, ut
pars lata &longs;it prona: teres, &longs;upina: inferius quodammodo committi po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;upe­
rius non po&longs;&longs;unt: intermedium &longs;pacium uacuum pyritis complent, & ij&longs;dem
ac lignis pyritas comminutos &longs;uperinijciunt, ut ingredientibus & egredienti­
bus, iter planum & æquabile explicent.

Hi pyritæ, cùm fo&longs;&longs;æ latentes uel cu
niculi &longs;tillant aquis, ip&longs;is madefacti ex &longs;e gignunt atramentum &longs;utorium, eique
cognata: cum aquæ ce&longs;&longs;ant de&longs;tillare, ip&longs;um &longs;iccatur & dure&longs;cit, & è puteis
unà cum pyritis nondum aqua re&longs;olutis tractum, uel è cuniculis euectum con
ijciunt in cupas uel lacus, & aquis feruentibus &longs;uperfu&longs;is atramentum re&longs;ol­
uunt, atque pyritas diluunt: quod dilutum uiride in alias cupas aut lacus tran&longs;­
fundunt, ut limpidum & purum fiat: id deinde in cortinis plumbeis coquunt
donec &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur: mox in ua&longs;a lignea infundunt: ubi ad re&longs;tes, uel arundines,
uel &longs;urculos adhærens in atramentum &longs;utorium uiride concre&longs;cit.

At &longs;ulfur
conficitur ex aquis &longs;ulfuro&longs;is, ex uenis &longs;ulfureis, ex mi&longs;tis item &longs;ulfureis, aquæ
quidem ingerantur in cortinas plumbeas, & coquantur donec den&longs;entur in
&longs;ulfur.

Ex hoc plerunque & &longs;quama ferri concoctis, ac in urceos transfu&longs;is, atque
po&longs;tea facticio &longs;ulfure luteo obductis fit aliud &longs;ulfur facticium, quod caballi
num nominamus.

Venæ uerò, quæ ferè con&longs;tant ex &longs;ulfure & terra, ex alijs
fo&longs;&longs;ilibus raro, coquantur in uentro&longs;is ollis fictilibus.

Ip&longs;æ fornaces duarum
capaces in tres partes &longs;int di&longs;tributæ: quarum infima alta pedem à fronte ha­
beat os, quo in&longs;piretur: &longs;uperius tecta &longs;it laminis ferreis, latera uer&longs;us perfo­
ratis: quas bacilla ferrea &longs;u&longs;tineant, ip&longs;æ uerò ligna in fornacem impo&longs;ita: me­
dia pars alta &longs;it &longs;e&longs;quipedem: quæ item os habeat à fronte, ut ligna in forna­
cem immitti po&longs;&longs;int: &longs;uperius habeat bacilla, &longs;uper quæ fundum ollæ cuiu&longs;que
&longs;tatuatur: &longs;uprema alta &longs;it ferè duos pedes: &longs;ed ollarum quæque item alta du­
os pedes, & cra&longs;&longs;a digitum: quæque &longs;ub ore habeat narem longam, uerum an
gu&longs;tam: quæque tegatur operculo item fictili &longs;ic facto, ut os ollæ tegat, & in
eo aliquantum includatur.

Ad binas qua&longs;que id genus ollas opus e&longs;t &longs;ingulis
ollis eiu&longs;dem magnitudinis & formæ, cuius illæ &longs;unt: &longs;ed hæ naribus care­
ant, tria uerò habeant foramina: quorum duo, quæ &longs;unt &longs;ub ore, duas duarum
ollarum nares recipiant: ex tertio, quod e&longs;t è contraria eius parte ad fundum,
effluat &longs;ulfur: &longs;ingulæ fornaces binis ollis, quibus nares &longs;unt, in cas impo&longs;i­
tis tegantur laminis ferreis luto cra&longs;&longs;o digitos duos oblitis, eisque totæ conclu
dantur, relictis tantummodo duobus uel tribus &longs;piramentis: ollarum etiam ora
ex eis emineant.

Extra quanque fornacem ad alterum eius latus collocetur olla,
uacans nare: in cuius foramina illarum duarum nares penetrent, ea lateribus, ut im­
mobilis maneat, utrinque muniatur: cum uenæ &longs;ulfureæ in ollas, in fornaces im
po&longs;itas, coniectæ fuerint, eas confe&longs;tim operculare, & qua cum operculo coniun
guntur, luto oblinire conuenit ne &longs;ulfur exhalent: eadem de cau&longs;a ollæ &longs;ubiectæ
operculis tegantur & luto oblinantur: lignis accen&longs;is uenæ coquantur u&longs;que dum
&longs;ulfur exhalarint: uapor &longs;ublatus dum per narem penetrat in ollam &longs;ubiectam
cra&longs;&longs;e&longs;cit in &longs;ulfur: quod ceræ liquefactæ &longs;imile in fundum decidit: ex quo
cum è foramine, quod ad ollæ fundum e&longs;&longs;e dixi, defluxerit excoctor uel pa­
nem efficit, uel cannas bacillaúe format, uel &longs;ulfurata, exilibus lignis in id in
tinctis, conficit: mox ardentia ligna & prunas ex fornace extrahat, eaque refri
gerata duas illas ollas aperiat, & exinaniat purgamentis: quæ, &longs;i uenæ com­
po&longs;itæ fuerint ex &longs;ulfure & terra, cineris &longs;ua &longs;ponte re&longs;tincti, &longs;imilia &longs;unt:
&longs;in ex &longs;ulfure & terra & lapide, uel ex &longs;ulfure & lapide tantum, terræ ualde
&longs;iccatæ, uel lapidi multum to&longs;to: po&longs;thæc ollæ rur&longs;us uenis compleantur, et
eadem i&longs;ta omnia iterentur.
Ollæ quibus nares &longs;unt A. Olla uacans nare B. Opercula C.

Sed mi&longs;ta &longs;ulfurea, &longs;iue ex lapide et &longs;ulfure tantummodo con&longs;titerint, &longs;iue ex
lapide & &longs;ulfure & metallo, coquantur in &longs;imilib. ollis, &longs;ed in fundo perfora­
tis: fornax &longs;ic &longs;e habeat: ad murum officinæ n. extruantur latericij parietes, alti
pedes vn. longi tres, cra&longs;&longs;i &longs;e&longs;quipedem.

Hi di&longs;tent inter &longs;e pedib. XXVII. inter &qring;s
item latere ducantur VII. muri humiles, utpote alti pedes II. & totidem digitos,
&longs;ed longi, æque ac parietes, pedes III. cra&longs;&longs;i unum, parib. interuallis inter &longs;e &
parietes di&longs;tincti: qua ratione alius ab alio aberit pedes duos & dimidium.

In eius &longs;uperius inclu&longs;a &longs;int bacilla ferrea, quæ &longs;u&longs;tineant laminas ferreas, lon
gas & latas pedes tres, cra&longs;&longs;as digitum, ut & ollarum graue onus & ignis uim
&longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;int: earum quæque in medio habeat foramen rotundum, quod
latum &longs;it &longs;e&longs;quidigitum: quia uerò nec plures quàm octo e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt, eis to
tidem ollæ in fundo perforatæ &longs;uperponantur, totidem integræ &longs;upponan
tur: illæ contineant mi&longs;ta, & operculis tegantur.

Hæ aquas, & earum ora ad
laminas pertineant: mi&longs;ta lignis, circa &longs;uperiores ollas po&longs;itis & accen&longs;is, co
cta &longs;tillant &longs;ulfure rubro, uel luteo, uel uiridi: quod per foramina defluens ex­
cipiunt ollæ laminis &longs;uppo&longs;itæ: quarum aqua mox refrige&longs;cit: &longs;i in mi&longs;tis in
e&longs;t metallum, ea re&longs;eruata excoquuntur: &longs;i minus, abijciuntur.

Veruntamen
&longs;ulfur ex i&longs;tiu&longs;modi mi&longs;tis optime poterit elici, &longs;i ollæ &longs;uperiores &longs;ic in forna
ce concamerata locatæ fuerint, ut illæ, de quibus libro octauo, cum eandem
rem metalli, quod in eis ine&longs;t, cau&longs;a tractarem, dixi, ut eædem fundo carue­
rint, inque eas cancelli fuerint impo&longs;iti: inferiores uerò eis hoc modo &longs;uppo&longs;i
tæ fuerint: &longs;ed laminam quanque amplius habere foramen oportet.

Murus longus A. Muri alti B. Muri humiles C. Laminæ D.
Ollæ &longs;uperiores E. Ollæ inferiores F.

Alij urceum defodiunt in terra, & in eum imponunt alterum urceum in
fundo perforatum: in quo pyriten, uel cadmiam, uel alium lapidem &longs;ulfuro­
&longs;um &longs;ic concludunt, ut &longs;ulfur exhalare non po&longs;&longs;it.

Is acri igni coctus &longs;tillat &longs;ul­
fure, quod in urceum inferiorem, qui continet aquas, defluit.
Vrceus inferior A. Vrceus &longs;uperior B. Operculum C.

At bitumen fit ex aquis bitumino&longs;is, ex bitumine liquido, ex mi&longs;tis bitu­
mino&longs;is: nam aqua bitumino&longs;a &longs;imul & &longs;al&longs;a Babylone, ut Plinius &longs;criptum re
liquit, & è puteis in &longs;alinas inge&longs;ta, & flagranti&longs;&longs;imo &longs;ole cocta den&longs;atur par
tim in bitumen liquidum, partim in &longs;alem.

Sed bitumen, ut leuius, &longs;uperio­
rem: &longs;al, ut grauius, inferiorem locum obtinet.

Bitumen uerò liquidum, &longs;i mul
tum aquis fontium, riuorum, fluminum, innatarit, &longs;itulis, alijsúe ua&longs;culis hau­
&longs;tum: &longs;i paucum, alis an&longs;erum, linteolis, rallis, arundinum panniculis, & alijs
ad quæ facile adhære&longs;cit, collectum in magnis ollis æreis uel ferreis coqua­
tur & igne &longs;pi&longs;&longs;etur.

Verùm, quia ad diuer&longs;os u&longs;us expetitur, quidam cum li
quido mi&longs;cent picem, quidam axungiam ueterem, ut eius lentorem tempe­
rent.
Sed hi, quanquam ip&longs;um coquunt in ollis, durum non efficiunt.

At mi
&longs;ta, in quibus ine&longs;t bitumen, eo modo, quo ea, in quibus e&longs;t &longs;ulfur, in ollis
iuxta fundum terebratis coquuntur: et&longs;i rarius hoc fieri &longs;olet, quod tale bitu
men non magni æ&longs;timetur.
Fons bitumino&longs;us A. Situla B. Olla C. Operculum D.

Quin omnes &longs;ucci concreti, &longs;i copio&longs;e & abundanter cum aquis fuerint
permi&longs;ti, atque omnes etiam terræ, re&longs;ident in fontibus, & in riuorum ac flu­
minum alueis: atque lapides, in his iacentes eis obducuntur: nec indigent ullo
&longs;olis aut ignis calore, quo concre&longs;cant.

Quod cùm uiri &longs;agaces con&longs;idera&longs;&longs;ent,
excogitarunt rationes, quibus reliquos quo&longs;dam &longs;uccos concretos, & terras
qua&longs;dam in&longs;ignes colligerent: etenim talem aquam, &longs;iue ex fonte, &longs;iue ex cu­
niculo defluat, aliquot lacubus ligneis, uel ca&longs;tellis ex ordine collocatis exci
piunt: in eis enim re&longs;ident: quare &longs;ingulis annis dera&longs;i colliguntur: ut in mon­
te Carpatho chry&longs;ocolla, in Meliboco ochra.
Os cuniculi A. Canalis B. Ca&longs;tella C. Canaliculi D.

Re&longs;tat uitrum, cuius con&longs;ectura propterea huc pertinet, quod ex &longs;uccis qui­
bu&longs;dam concretis, & &longs;abulo, uel arena ui ignis & arte &longs;ubtili exprimatur: & quod
expre&longs;&longs;um, ut &longs;ucci concreti & gemmæ, atque lapides quidam, transluceat: ut lapi­
des lique&longs;centes & metalla fundi po&longs;&longs;it: &longs;ed primò mihi dicendum e&longs;t de ma
teria, ex qua uitrum conficitur: deinde de fornacibus, in quibus conflatur: tum
de eius conficiendi ratione.

Confit aunt ex lapidibus lique&longs;centibus & ex &longs;uccis
concretis, aut ex aliarum rerum &longs;uccis, qui cum his naturali cognatione iunguntur.

Lapides quidem lique&longs;centes, &longs;i fuerint candidi & translucidi, cæteris præ&longs;tant:
quib.
de cau&longs;is ad cry&longs;tallos primas deferunt: ex his.
n.

fractis in India fieri ui­
trum tam translucida facilitate præcellens, ut nullum cum eo comparari po&longs;&longs;it, autores
e&longs;&longs;e Plinius &longs;cribit: &longs;ecundas tribuunt lapidibus, qui, tamet&longs;i eis duricia cry&longs;tal­
lorum non &longs;it, tamen &longs;imili modo candidi &longs;unt & translucent: tertias dant his lapidi
bus candidis, qui translucidi non &longs;unt.

Eos aut omnes prius urere nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t: po­
&longs;tea pilis &longs;ubiectos &longs;ic frangere & comminuere, ut inde &longs;abulum fiat: tum cribrare:
quocirca, &longs;i tale &longs;abulum uel arena, &longs;e uitrarijs ad o&longs;tia fluminum o&longs;tendit, eos uren
di & tundendi labore leuat.

Quod uerò ad &longs;uccos concretos attinet, primæ de
feruntur nitro: &longs;ecundæ &longs;ali fo&longs;&longs;ili candido & translucido: tertiæ &longs;ali, qui confici
tur ex lixiuio; ex cinere anthyllidis, aut alterius herbæ &longs;al&longs;æ facto.

Sunt tamen
qui huic &longs;ali, non illi, &longs;ecundas tribuunt.

Verum &longs;abuli uel arenæ, ex lapidibus li­
que&longs;centibus confectæ, portiones duæ cum nitri uel &longs;alis fo&longs;&longs;ilis, aut ex herba &longs;al
&longs;a facti unà commi&longs;ceantur: ad quas adijciatur minuta magnetis particula: cer
te &longs;ingularis illa uis no&longs;tris etiam temporib.

æque ac pri&longs;cis ita in &longs;e liquorem uitri
trahere creditur, ut ad &longs;e ferrum allicit: tractum aut purgat, & ex uiridi uel luteo
candidum facit: &longs;ed magnetem po&longs;tea ignis con&longs;umit: qui uerò iam dictis &longs;uccis ca­
rent, ip&longs;i duas portiones cineris quernei uel ilignei, uel roborei, uel cerrei, aut,
&longs;i hi in promptu non fuerint, fagini uel abiegni cum una &longs;abuli uel arenæ permi
&longs;cent, & addunt modicum &longs;alem, ex aqua &longs;al&longs;a uel marina factum, atque exiguam magne
tis particulam: &longs;ed i&longs;ti minus candidum & translucidum uitrum conficiunt: uerum cinis
ex antiquis arborib.

fit: quarum truncus, ubi a&longs;&longs;urrexit ad altitudinem &longs;ex pedum
cauatur, & iniecto igni arbor tota comburitur, ac in cinerem uertitur: quod fit
hyeme cum niues diutinæ &longs;edent, uel æ&longs;tate, cum non pluit: nam imbres alijs anni
temporib.

quod cineres cum terra mi&longs;ceant, impuros reddunt: quanobrem tunc ex ij&longs;dem
arborib.
in plures partes &longs;ectis, & &longs;ub tecto combu&longs;tis, cinis confiat.

Sed uitra
rijs alijs tres &longs;unt fornaces, alijs duæ, alijs una: quib.

tres, hi in prima coquunt
materiam, in &longs;ecunda eam recoquunt, in tertia refrigerant uitrea ua&longs;a & cætera ope
ra candentia: eorum prima fornax concamerata & furno &longs;imilis &longs;it: in cuius &longs;upe
riori camera, longa pedes &longs;ex, lata quatuor, alta duos lignis aridis accen&longs;is res
mi&longs;tæ coquantur acri igni donec lique&longs;cant, & in ma&longs;&longs;am uertantur uitream: et&longs;i
nondum &longs;atis à recremento purgatam: ea refrigerata extrahatur & in partes
diuidatur: in eadem fornace ollæ, quæ continebunt uitrum, calefiant.
Primæ fornacis inferior camera A. Superior B. Vitrea ma&longs;&longs;a C.

Secunda fornax rotunda & lata pedes decem, alta octo, extrin&longs;ecus, ut &longs;it
firmior, cingatur quinque arcubus &longs;e&longs;quipedem cra&longs;&longs;is: ea item con&longs;tet ex du
abus cameris: quarum inferioris te&longs;tudo &longs;it cra&longs;&longs;a &longs;e&longs;quipedem: ip&longs;a camera
habeat à fronte os angu&longs;tum, ut ligna in focum, qui e&longs;t in eius &longs;olo, imponi
po&longs;&longs;int: in &longs;umma uerò & media eiu&longs;dem te&longs;tudine magnum foramen rotun­
dum: quod ab ea pateat ad &longs;uperiorem cameram, ut flammæ in ip&longs;am pene­
trare po&longs;&longs;int.

At in &longs;uperioris cameræ muro inter arcus &longs;int octo fene&longs;træ
tantæ, ut per eas ollæ uentro&longs;æ in &longs;olo cameræ circum magnum foramen col­
locari po&longs;&longs;int: quarum ollarum cra&longs;&longs;itudo &longs;it ad digitos duos, altitudo ad to
tidem pedes, latitudo uentris ad &longs;e&longs;quipedem, oris & fundi ad pedem.

In po
&longs;teriori fornacis parte &longs;it foramen quadrangulum, cuius altitudo atque etiam
latitudo ad palmum: per quod calor penetret in tertiam fornacem, cum hac
coniunctam: ea quadrangula & longa pedes octo, lata &longs;ex &longs;imiliter con&longs;tet
ex duabus cameris: quarum inferior à fronte habeat os, ut ligna in focum, qui
etiam e&longs;t in eius &longs;olo, imponi po&longs;&longs;int: ab utroque oris latere in muro &longs;it oblon
gi ua&longs;is fictilis receptaculum, longum circiter pedes quatuor, altum duos, la
tum &longs;e&longs;quipedem.

Superior uerò camera habeat duo foramina, alterum à dex­
tro latere, alterum à &longs;ini&longs;tro, tam lata & alta, ut ua&longs;a illa commode in eam im
poni po&longs;&longs;int: quæ ua&longs;a &longs;int longa pedes tres, alta &longs;e&longs;quipedem, lata inferiori
parte pedem, &longs;uperiori rotundata: in his opera uitrea iam conflata recondan­
tur, ut mitiori calore refrigerentur: quæ ni ita paulatim fuerint refrigerata, di&longs;
rumpuntur.

Deinde ua&longs;is i&longs;tis ex &longs;uperiori camera extractis & repo&longs;itis in
receptaculis pror&longs;us refrigerentur.

Secundæ fornacis arcus A. Eius cameræ in&longs;erioris os B.
Fene&longs;træ &longs;uperioris cameræ C. Ollæ uentro&longs;æ D. Ter/
tiæ fornacis os E. Receptacula ua&longs;orum F. Foramina
&longs;uperioris cameræ G. Va&longs;a oblonga H.

At quibus duæ &longs;unt fornaces, eorum partim in prima coquunt mi&longs;turam,
& in &longs;ecunda non modo eandem recoquunt, uerum opera etiam uitrea re­
ponunt: quanquam in diuer&longs;is cameris partim in &longs;ecunda materiam coquunt
pariter & recoquunt, in tertiam uerò opera uitrea recondunt: atque ita illi ca­
rent tertia fornace, hi prima: &longs;ed i&longs;tiu&longs;modi fornax &longs;ecunda differt ab altera
fornace &longs;ecunda: etenim rotunda quidem e&longs;t, &longs;ed eius caua pars lata pedes
octo, alta duodecim, quod con&longs;tet ex tribus cameris: quarum infima non di&longs;­
&longs;imilis e&longs;t inferiori alterius &longs;ecundæ fornacis.

In mediæ uerò cameræ muro
&longs;unt &longs;ex fornices: quæ cum ollæ calefactæ in eam impo&longs;itæ fuerint, etiam luto
ob&longs;truuntur relictis modicis fene&longs;tellis: in huius mediæ cameræ &longs;umma &
media parte e&longs;t foramen quadrangulum, cuius longitudo, itemque latitudo
ad palmum: per id calor penetrat in &longs;upremam cameram: quæ po&longs;teriori par­
te habet os, ut in oblongum uas fictile, in ea locatum, opera uitrea paulatim
refrigeranda reponi po&longs;&longs;int.

Ea autem parte &longs;olum officinæ e&longs;t altius, aut &longs;ca­
mnum habet appo&longs;itum, ut uitrarij con&longs;cendentes commodius opera po&longs;­
&longs;int recondere.

Alterius fornacis &longs;ecunda camera infima A. Media B. Suprema C.
Eius os D. Foramen rotundum B. Foramen quadrangulum F.

Sed qui carent prima fornace, hi, cùm munus diurnum perfecerint, ue&longs;peri
materiam in ollas inijciunt: quæ noctu cocta lique&longs;cit & in uitrum abit.

Duo aut
pueri interdiu noctuque alternatim ignem alunt aridis lignis in focum impo&longs;itis.

At quibus una tantummodo fornax e&longs;t, utuntur ea &longs;ecunda, quæ ex tribus came
ris con&longs;tat: nam ut proximi materiam ue&longs;peri inijciunt in ollas: mane uerò recre­
mentis detractis opera uitrea conficiunt: quæ in &longs;upremam cameram, ut alteri, re­
condunt.

Verum &longs;ecunda fornax, &longs;iue ex duabus, &longs;iue ex tribus cameris con&longs;tite
rit, atque etiam prima, fiant ex lateribus crudis in &longs;ole &longs;iccatis: qui ducti &longs;int ex ter
ra, quæ facile igni neque lique&longs;cit, nec in puluerem re&longs;oluitur: et quæ à lapillis
purgata &longs;it, atque bacillis uerberata: eadem terra calcis loco lateres interlinantur:
ex eadem figuli forment tam ua&longs;a que ollas, eaque in umbra &longs;iccent.

Duabus partibus
ab&longs;oluta re&longs;tat tertia.

Ma&longs;&longs;a uitrea in prima fornace eo, quo dixi modo, confe
cta & fracta mini&longs;tri &longs;ecundam excalfaciunt, ut ea fragmenta recoquant.

Dum ue­
rò hoc agunt, interea ollæ in prima fornace primum lento igni calefiunt, ut hu­
morem exhalent: deinde acriori, ut &longs;iccatæ rufe&longs;cant: mox uitrarij huius os aperi
unt, & ollas forcipe prehen&longs;as, &longs;i rimis non fathi&longs;cunt, celeriter in &longs;ecunda repo­
nunt: et recalfactas fragmentis uitreæ ma&longs;&longs;æ, uel uitri complent: deinde fene&longs;tras
omnes luto & laterib.

ob&longs;truunt: cuiu&longs;que loco duabus tantummodo fene&longs;tellis re­
lictis, de quarum altera in&longs;pectant & fi&longs;tula recipiunt uitrum, quod ollæ in &longs;e continent:
in altera reponunt alteram fi&longs;tulam ut calida fiat: utraque orichalcea, uel ænea uel
ferrea e&longs;t, tres pedes longa: quin ante fene&longs;tellas cru&longs;ta marmoris fornici im
ponitur: atque ei rur&longs;us terra aggerata & ferrum: hoc fi&longs;tulam in fornacem immi&longs;sam
retinet, illa oculos uitrarij ab ignis calore tuetur: his omnibus ordine factis
uitrarij opus perficiendum aggrediuntur.

Lignis aut aridis, quæ flamam, non
fumum emittunt, fragmenta recoquunt: &longs;ed quanto diutius recoxerint, tanto puri
ora & magis translucida ex eis fiunt opera: tanto minus maculo&longs;a et ue&longs;iculis
turge&longs;centia: tanto denique facilius uitrarij &longs;uum munus exequuntur: quocirca qui
materiam, ex qua uitrum conficitur, unam modo noctem coquunt, ac mox ex ea opera
uitrea efficiunt, minus pura & translucida faciunt, que qui primo ma&longs;&longs;am conficiunt
uitream, dein eius fragmenta, diem noctemque recoquunt: atque hi etiam minus pura
& translucida, que qui duos dies noctesque eadem recoquunt: nam uitri bonitas non
&longs;olum in materia, ex qua conficitur, &longs;ita e&longs;t, &longs;ed etiam in coquendo.

Sæpius aut ui­
trarij fi&longs;tulis rapiunt experimentum: &longs;ed que primum ex eo didicerint fragmenta re
cocta &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;e purgata, qui&longs;que altera fi&longs;tula in ollam demi&longs;&longs;a, & paulatim uer­
&longs;ata, recipit uitrum: quod tanque lentus aliquis & glutino&longs;us &longs;uccus ad eam adhære
&longs;cit: & quidem globo&longs;um.

Recipit uerò tantum, quantum ad opus, quod efficere uult,
&longs;atis e&longs;t: id marmori impre&longs;&longs;um uoluit & reuoluit, ut adunetur: atque per fi&longs;tu
lam in&longs;pirans ue&longs;icæ in&longs;tar inflat: quam fi&longs;tulam &qring;ties in&longs;pirat, &longs;æpius uerò in&longs;pira
re nece&longs;&longs;e habet, toties eam repente remotam ab ore ad maxillam admouet, ne flam
mam &longs;piritu reducto in os trahat: mox fi&longs;tulam &longs;ublatam circum caput in orbem tor
quens uitrum facit longum, aut idem in æreo in&longs;trumento cauo uer&longs;ans figurat: tum
recalfaciendo, inflando, premendo, amplificando in poculi, uel ua&longs;is, uel alterius
rei figuram mente conceptam, format: deinde rur&longs;us marmori imprimit, atque &longs;ic
fundum dilatat: quod altera fi&longs;tula in partem interiorem compellit: po&longs;tea forfice eius
os amputat: atque, &longs;i res hoc po&longs;tulat, pedes & an&longs;as affingit: quinetiam, &longs;i ei libi
tum fuerit, inaurat, & uarijs colorib.
pingit.

Po&longs;tremò in oblongo ua&longs;e fictili,
quod e&longs;t in tertia fornace, uel in &longs;uprema &longs;ecundæ camera reponit, &longs;initque refrige
rari: quod cum talibus operib.

&longs;en&longs;im refrigeratis plenum fuerit, bacillo ferreo la­
to, &longs;ub ip&longs;um acto, &longs;ublatum in &longs;ini&longs;trum brachium in altero receptaculo eo illocat.

Fi&longs;tula A. Fene&longs;tella B. Marmor C. Forceps D.
In&longs;trumenta quibus formæ &longs;unt datæ E.

Vitrarij autem diuer&longs;as res efficiunt: etenim cyphos, phyalas, urceos, am­
pullas, lances, patinas, &longs;pecularia, animantes, arbores, naues: qualia opera mul
ta præclara & admiranda cum quondam biennio agerem Venetijs, contem­
platus &longs;um: in primis uerò anniuer&longs;arijs diebus fe&longs;tis a&longs;cen&longs;ionis dominicæ
cùm uenalia e&longs;&longs;ent apportata Morano: ubi uitrariæ officinæ omnium cele­
berrimæ &longs;unt: quas uidi cum aliâs, tum maxime cum certis de cau&longs;is Andre
am Naugerium in ædibus, quas ibi habebat, una cum Franci&longs;co A&longs;ulano
conuenirem.

tis author in &longs;equenti De animantibus &longs;ubterraneis libro u&longs;us,

CATALOGVS.

GEORGIVS AGRICOLA GEOR­
gio Fabricio S. P. D.
Q

Vanquam duos libros de &longs;tirpibus &longs;crip&longs;it Ari&longs;toteles, tamen
ijs Theophra&longs;tum di&longs;cipulum non deterruit, quo minus &longs;uam
de ij&longs;dem &longs;tirpibus &longs;ententiam multis libris explicaret.

Nec ip&longs;e
Theophra&longs;tus tanta &longs;cientia, tantaque copia &longs;tudium Dio&longs;cori­
dis ardoremque re&longs;tinxit: &longs;ed etiam is po&longs;teritati &longs;eruiens quarun­
dam arborum ac herbarum figuras & uires, longo atque multo u&longs;u perceptas,
literis memoriæque mandauit.

Male enim &longs;e habui&longs;&longs;ent &longs;tudia, &longs;i ætate inferi
oribus ad ca quæ à maioribus erant inuenta, nihil addere licui&longs;&longs;et: certe &longs;i
Græci hanc legem iniquam quondam accepi&longs;&longs;ent, nulla ars, nulla &longs;cientia,
nulla di&longs;ciplina potui&longs;&longs;et perfici.

Quapropter et&longs;i Ari&longs;toteles libros com­
plures edidit, in quibus animantium naturas, partes, ortus, ratione & uia e&longs;t
per&longs;ecutus: tamen philo&longs;ophiæ deditos auocare nec uoluit, nec debuit, à &longs;tu
dio tum perquirendi po&longs;terisque prodendi naturas earum animantium, de qui
bus parum aut nihil &longs;crip&longs;it: tum tractandi locos, quos in ijs libris non &longs;atis
expre&longs;&longs;it.

Itaque etiam apud Græcos Oppianus &longs;crip&longs;it de pi&longs;cibus, de animan­
tium natura Porphyrius & Ælianus: apud Latinos item de pi&longs;cibus Ouidi
us, de omnibus ferè animantibus Plinius.

Quos &longs;criptores ego &longs;ecutus cum
res &longs;ubterraneas, quæ anima carent, expo&longs;ui&longs;&longs;em pluribus libris, ut rationem
in&longs;titutam, quoad fieri po&longs;&longs;et, ab&longs;oluerem, animantes etiam de&longs;crip&longs;i &longs;ubter
raneas: nec eas modo quæ perpetuo ferè uer&longs;antur in terra, &longs;ed eas &qring;que quæ
certis anni temporibus in eadem &longs;olent latere.

Quo &longs;anè modo & be&longs;tiarum
quarundam formas Ari&longs;toteli & alijs uel incognitas, uel parum expre&longs;&longs;as,
& illius locum de animantibus, quæ hybernis &longs;e condunt men&longs;ibus, uolui
latius explicare.

Hunc librum &longs;i probauero tibi, qui Latinis & Græcis li­
teris in primis eruditus, animantium naturas &longs;crutaris, & iam multarum co­
gnitionem cepi&longs;ti, eum facilius, ut &longs;pero, cæteris qui item rerum occultarum
&longs;tudio delectantur, probabo.

GEORGII AGRICO
LAE DE ANIMANTIBVS
&longs;ubterraneis Liber, ab autore recognitus.

Corpvs &longs;ubterraneum, ut res ip&longs;a demon&longs;trat, in
animatum di&longs;tribuitur, & inanimatum: quod autem
animi expers e&longs;t, rur&longs;us diuiditur in id, quod &longs;ua
&longs;ponte erumpit ex terra, & in id, quod ex eadem ef
foditur.

De altero inanimi genere dixi in quatuor
libris De natura eorum quæ effluunt ex terra in&longs;cri
ptis, de altero in decem De natura fo&longs;&longs;ilium: nunc de
&longs;ubterraneis animantibus dicam.

Cùm uerò genus
animantium omne con&longs;tet ex quatuor elementis, &
corpus humidum ac &longs;iccum, id e&longs;t aqua & terra, ad accipiendum apta &longs;int, nece&longs;&longs;e
e&longs;t ea ip&longs;a duo elementa animantium materiam e&longs;&longs;e.

Ex quo rur&longs;us illud qua­
dam naturæ nece&longs;&longs;itate con&longs;equitur, ut omne animal & in aqua uel terra gi­
gnatur, & in eis commoretur atque uita fruatur.

Nam be&longs;tiæ uolucres, & &longs;i pa&longs;­
&longs;im per aerem uolitant, tamen in terra, uel in &longs;tirpibus ex ea natis, uel in ædi­
ficijs &longs;uper ip&longs;am collocatis, con&longs;truunt nidos, & eis aut terra aut aqua cibos
&longs;uppeditat.

Vt enim uerum &longs;it quod perhibent, aues raras illas, & non adeò
magnas, quarum pennas longas, & colore luteo dilutiore &longs;plendentes, rex
Turcarum in &longs;uperiore parte coronæ, multis gemmis precio&longs;is ornatæ ge­
&longs;tat, in aere perpetuum uitæ cur&longs;um tenere, fœminam ouis quæ parit, &longs;uper
dor&longs;um maris &longs;inuatum, locatis uentre item &longs;inuato incubare, & pullos ex­
cludere, neutram uiuam unquam pedibus breui&longs;&longs;imis, & in pluma recondi
tis terram attingere, tamen &longs;olo aere nec ali uidentur po&longs;&longs;e, nec auge&longs;cere, &longs;ed
his quibus ue&longs;cuntur.

Ac uerò etiam be&longs;tiolæ, quæ puri/gonoi, propterea quòd
in terreno i&longs;ti igni gignuntur, à Græcis nominantur, terra & aqua non carent:
gignuntur aut, ut Ari&longs;toteles &longs;cribit, in his Cypri fornacibus, in quibus lapis
ærarius multos dies crematur: atque magnis mu&longs;cis paulo maiores &longs;unt &
&longs;ubalatæ.

In igni ambulant & &longs;aliunt, &longs;ed emoriuntur quàm primum ab eo di
motæ fuerint.

Animantium aut partim, tamet&longs;i latere &longs;oleant, non &longs;ubeunt ter­
ræ rimas, nec foramina, nec &longs;peluncas: quæ in &longs;ubterranearum numero non
&longs;unt: partim noctu, aut interdiu &longs;ubterraneas &longs;uccedunt cauernas, partim cer­
to anni tempore: quarum utræ que eo ip&longs;o diei uel anni tempore &longs;ubterraneæ
&longs;unt, atque dici po&longs;&longs;unt: partim ferè perpetuo occulte in terra latent: quæ &longs;ub­
terraneæ & &longs;emper &longs;unt, & proprie dicuntur.

Vt autem res expre&longs;&longs;ior & il­
lu&longs;trior fiat, paulo altius ordiar.

Quoniam animantes omnes natura mutati
ones temporum &longs;entiunt, pleræque frigoris aut caloris uitandi cau&longs;a, uel regi
onem, locumúe mutant: uel ingrediuntur in domicilia, aut arbores exe&longs;as &
excauatas: uel &longs;ubeunt terram.

Earum aut quæ regionem mutant, aliæ &longs;emei
egre&longs;&longs;æ nunquam reuertuntur, aliæ reuertuntur: nun quam redire &longs;olent ra­

Etenim hi non modo frigoris aut caloris
uitandi cau&longs;a alibi &longs;edem collocant, uerum etiam ex regionibus macris & ni
hil ferentibus migrant in opimas & fertiles: uel cùm tanta multitudo fuerit

Quo &longs;anè modo alia ora parsque terrarum onus, quo premitur, in alia &longs;æpe de­

Cymbros uerò et Teutones, ex ultimis Galliæ Belgicæ oris,
in quas è Germania commigrarunt, maris inundationes exegerunt.

Et eædem
ac terræ motus atque eruptiones ignium & aquarum calidarum effu&longs;iones ex

Atque his fe­
rè de cau&longs;is gentes aut uictæ ab his quæ migrarunt, expelluntur & eijciun­

Simili modo animantes rationis expertes, maxime uolucres, ex re

Quin ut interdum unicus homo in longinquas regiones abit, nec redit un­

co Egnatio Caluino præfecto ui&longs;am Plin. memoriæ prodidit.

Aquilam &qring;que
Northu&longs;æ in Toringia, quum ibi con&longs;enui&longs;&longs;et, mortuam &longs;cimus.

Eodem modo
